Generated description:
Professionals in this field design and oversee systems and processes aimed at safeguarding environmental quality, addressing issues such as air, water, and soil contamination. They assess potential environmental effects of projects and develop strategies for remediation and pollution control. Collaborating with diverse specialists, they provide guidance on environmental policies and standards, advise on cleanup procedures for hazardous sites, and ensure compliance with regulations. Responsibilities include preparing technical reports, developing safety protocols, managing projects, and communicating findings to stakeholders, government agencies, and the public. They also monitor program progress, coordinate with officials, and contribute to the development of environmental conservation and resource management plans, often through detailed documentation and site inspections.

ONET description:
Research, design, plan, or perform engineering duties in the prevention, control, and remediation of environmental hazards using various engineering disciplines. Work may include waste treatment, site remediation, or pollution control technology.

Element Name: Health and Safety Engineers, Except Mining Safety Engineers and Inspectors
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this role investigate incidents to determine causes and recommend preventive measures, ensuring compliance with established policies and regulations. They evaluate product designs and potential misuse to identify and mitigate hazards. This involves conducting research, performing tests on environmental factors, and analyzing data to assess risks. They also develop safety standards and provide technical guidance to organizations on managing health-related issues. Training is coordinated for workers on safety procedures and regulations. These professionals communicate findings through reports, offer expert testimony, and collaborate with external groups to facilitate emergency responses. They maintain up-to-date knowledge of industrial processes and relevant laws, contributing to the creation and revision of safety codes.

ONET description:
Promote worksite or product safety by applying knowledge of industrial processes, mechanics, chemistry, psychology, and industrial health and safety laws. Includes industrial product safety engineers.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Investigate industrial accidents, injuries, or occupational diseases to determine causes and preventive measures.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct research to evaluate safety levels for products.'}, equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain and apply knowledge of current policies, regulations, and industrial processes.'}, {'Task': 'Recommend procedures for detection, prevention, and elimination of physical, chemical, or other product hazards.'}, {'Task': 'Report or review findings from accident investigations, facilities inspections, or environmental testing.'}, {'Task': 'Evaluate potential health hazards or damage that could occur from product misuse.'}, {'Task': 'Evaluate adequacy of actions taken to correct health inspection violations.'}, {'Task': 'Interpret safety regulations for equipment to determine whether all safety requirements have been met.'}, {'Task': 'Participate in preparation of product usage and precautionary label instructions.'}, {'Task': 'Interview employers and employees to obtain information about work environments and workplace incidents.'}, {'Task': 'Provide expert testimony in litigation cases.'}, {'Task': 'Review employee safety programs to determine their adequacy.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct or direct testing of air quality, noise, temperature, or radiation levels to verify compliance with health and safety regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Provide technical advice and guidance to organizations on how to handle health-related problems and make needed changes.'}, {'Task': 'Develop industry standards of product safety.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain liaisons with outside organizations, such as fire departments, mutual aid societies, and rescue teams, so that emergency responses can be facilitated.'}, {'Task': 'Plan and conduct industrial hygiene research.'}, {'Task': 'Compile, analyze, and interpret statistical data related to occupational illnesses and accidents.'}, {'Task': 'Write and revise safety regulations and codes.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with medical professionals to assess health risks and to develop ways to manage health issues and concerns.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role analyze potential hazards to life and property by researching fire causes and studying material properties. They develop comprehensive plans for prevention and protection against fires, explosions, and other risks. A significant part of their work involves inspecting existing structures and reviewing designs to ensure compliance with safety codes and regulations. They make critical decisions regarding the selection, design, and implementation of detection, alarm, and extinguishing systems. These professionals communicate findings and recommendations through detailed reports and direct consultations with architects, builders, and regulatory bodies, aiming to safeguard assets and lives.

ONET description:
Research causes of fires, determine fire protection methods, and design or recommend materials or equipment such as structural components or fire-detection equipment to assist organizations in safeguarding life and property against fire, explosion, and related hazards.

[{'Task': 'Advise architects, builders, and other construction personnel on fire prevention equipment and techniques and on fire code and standard interpretation and compliance.'}, {'Task': 'Design fire detection equipment, alarm systems, and fire extinguishing devices and systems.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect buildings or building designs to determine fire protection system requirements and potential problems in areas such as water supplies, exit locations, and construction materials.'}, {'Task': 'Review building plans to verify compliance with fire code.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare and write reports detailing specific fire prevention and protection issues, such as work performed, revised codes or standards, and proposed review schedules.'}, {'Task': 'Consult with authorities to discuss safety regulations and to recommend changes as necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Evaluate fire department performance and the laws and regulations affecting fire prevention or fire safety.'}, {'Task': 'Direct the purchase, modification, installation, testing, maintenance, and operation of fire prevention and protection systems.'}, {'Task': 'Attend workshops, seminars, or conferences to present or obtain information regarding fire prevention and protection.'}, {'Task': 'Determine causes of fires and ways in which they could have been prevented.'}, {'Task': 'Develop training materials and conduct training sessions on fire protection.'}, {'Task': 'Study the relationships between ignition sources and materials to determine how fires start.'}, {'Task': 'Develop plans for the prevention of destruction by fire, wind, and water.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct research on fire retardants and the fire safety of materials and devices.'}]

Generated description:
This role involves the systematic design and evaluation of integrated production and operational systems. Key responsibilities include analyzing processes to optimize the use of resources such as personnel, materials, and utilities, and developing methods to improve efficiency and reduce costs. Professionals in this field assess production schedules and specifications to plan sequences of operations, ensuring the effective fabrication and assembly of products. They also establish quality and reliability standards by analyzing data and product specifications, and oversee testing activities. Furthermore, this work requires conferring with various stakeholders to coordinate project status, discuss specifications, and implement improvements. Developing documentation, estimating costs, and recommending modifications for enhanced performance are also crucial aspects of the day-to-day activities.

ONET description:
Design, develop, test, and evaluate integrated systems for managing industrial production processes, including human work factors, quality control, inventory control, logistics and material flow, cost analysis, and production coordination.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field systematically analyze how people interact with systems, products, and environments. They gather information by observing user activities, conducting interviews, and administering surveys to understand needs and identify potential issues. These professionals then analyze this data to assess usability, identify hazards, and evaluate system performance. They collaborate with other specialists, advocating for user needs and recommending changes to optimize designs, improve safety, and enhance overall efficiency. Their work involves preparing detailed reports and presentations, developing research methodologies, and integrating findings into operational requirements to ensure optimized human-machine interfaces and user well-being.

ONET description:
Design objects, facilities, and environments to optimize human well-being and overall system performance, applying theory, principles, and data regarding the relationship between humans and respective technology. Investigate and analyze characteristics of human behavior and performance as it relates to the use of technology.

Includes metallurgists and metallurgical engineers, ceramic engineers, and welding engineers.

Element Name: Mining and Geological Engineers, Including Mining Safety Engineers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this field analyze geological data from surveys to identify characteristics of development sites. They determine optimal methods for resource extraction, considering safety, cost-effectiveness, and environmental impact. Responsibilities include planning operations, specifying necessary processes, labor, and equipment for efficient and safe extraction. They also design and implement systems, monitor production rates, and assess operational effectiveness. A key aspect involves inspecting sites for potential hazards, unsafe conditions, or equipment issues, and developing mitigation strategies. These professionals prepare detailed reports, cost estimates, and schedules for management and technical teams, ensuring projects adhere to safety and operational standards.

ONET description:
Conduct subsurface surveys to identify the characteristics of potential land or mining development sites. May specify the ground support systems, processes, and equipment for safe, economical, and environmentally sound extraction or underground construction activities. May inspect areas for unsafe geological conditions, equipment, and working conditions. May design, implement, and coordinate mine safety programs.

[{'Task': 'Prepare technical reports for use by mining, engineering, and management personnel.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect mining areas for unsafe structures, equipment, and working conditions.'}, {'Task': 'Select or develop mineral location, extraction, and production methods, based on factors such as safety, cost, and deposit characteristics.'}, {'Task': 'Select locations and plan underground or surface mining operations, specifying processes, labor usage, and equipment that will result in safe, economical, and environmentally sound extraction of minerals and ores.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare schedules, reports, and estimates of the costs involved in developing and operating mines.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor mine production rates to assess operational effectiveness.'}, {'Task': 'Supervise, train, and evaluate technicians, technologists, survey personnel, engineers, scientists or other mine personnel.'}, {'Task': 'Examine maps, deposits, drilling locations, or mines to determine the location, size, accessibility, contents, value, and potential profitability of mineral, oil, and gas deposits.'}, {'Task': 'Design, implement, and monitor the development of mines, facilities, systems, or equipment.'}]

Generated description:

They devise methods to enhance recovery, plan drilling operations, and oversee well completion and evaluation. Key responsibilities include monitoring production rates, analyzing test results, and recommending strategies for improvement. They assess the economic viability of extraction sites and develop plans for field operations, product recovery, and treatment. These individuals also troubleshoot and solve operating issues, often by conferring with technical and scientific teams. They maintain detailed records of operations and prepare technical reports to communicate findings and recommendations to management. They may also coordinate the activities of research and development personnel and evaluate designs for equipment and processes.

ONET description:
Devise methods to improve oil and gas extraction and production and determine the need for new or modified tool designs. Oversee drilling and offer technical advice.

Element Name: Energy Engineers, Except Wind and Solar
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this field analyze energy consumption to identify opportunities for conservation and cost reduction. They conduct audits, monitor systems like HVAC and lighting, and collect data through site observations and inspections. These individuals review plans and specifications to assess energy efficiency, perform energy modeling, and verify energy bills. They advise clients and colleagues on climate control, sustainable design, and energy auditing, often preparing reports and documentation. They also manage projects, ensuring they meet budget, timeline, and regulatory requirements, and may negotiate energy purchase agreements. Additionally, they research and promote alternative energy technologies, and train others on energy management practices.

ONET description:
Design, develop, or evaluate energy-related projects or programs to reduce energy costs or improve energy efficiency during the designing, building, or remodeling stages of construction. May specialize in electrical systems; heating, ventilation, and air-conditioning (HVAC) systems; green buildings; lighting; air quality; or energy procurement.

Professionals in this role create detailed technical drawings and specifications for mechanical components and systems. They use specialized software to produce two- and three-dimensional models and layouts, accurately depicting how parts fit together and function. A significant part of their day involves interpreting engineering concepts, reviewing specifications, and applying mathematical principles to ensure designs meet requirements. They collaborate with colleagues to refine concepts and resolve design challenges. Additionally, they revise existing designs to improve performance or address production issues and may assist in creating technical documentation or training others. Their work requires careful attention to detail, critical thinking, and clear communication to translate ideas into precise visual representations for manufacturing and assembly.

ONET description:
Prepare detailed working diagrams of machinery and mechanical devices, including dimensions, fastening methods, and other engineering information.

Element Name: Aerospace Engineering and Operations Technologists and Technicians
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals install, operate, adjust, and maintain integrated computer systems and specialized equipment used for data acquisition and testing. They set up equipment according to specified requirements, identifying necessary data and test parameters. Daily activities involve monitoring equipment for malfunctions, performing diagnostic checks, and conducting repairs or adjustments to faulty components. They also fabricate and install parts for testing purposes. After tests, they record and interpret data, conferring with engineering personnel to discuss test procedures and results. Their responsibilities include ensuring systems are ready for operation and assessing performance against established parameters.

ONET description:
Operate, install, adjust, and maintain integrated computer/communications systems, consoles, simulators, and other data acquisition, test, and measurement instruments and equipment, which are used to launch, track, position, and evaluate air and space vehicles. May record and interpret test data.

They meticulously review blueprints and project specifications to determine structural dimensions and material needs. Element Name: Electrical and Electronic Engineering Technologists and Technicians
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals apply electrical and electronic theory to design, build, and repair components and systems. They interpret blueprints and schematics to assemble and test circuitry, often under engineering direction. Day-to-day activities include diagnosing and resolving equipment malfunctions, replacing defective parts using various tools, and modifying prototypes to correct deviations. They meticulously document testing procedures, operational issues, and repairs, maintaining detailed logs and manuals. Selecting appropriate components and equipment to meet specifications is crucial. They may also contribute to quality control, research part needs, and provide support for equipment installation or upgrades. Staying current with technological advancements through training is also a key responsibility.

ONET description:
Apply electrical and electronic theory and related knowledge, usually under the direction of engineering staff, to design, build, repair, adjust, and modify electrical components, circuitry, controls, and machinery for subsequent evaluation and use by engineering staff in making engineering design decisions.

Element Name: Electro-Mechanical and Mechatronics Technologists and Technicians
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals operate, test, and maintain automated and electromechanical systems. They meticulously inspect and verify component dimensions, ensuring conformance to specifications using precision instruments. They modify, repair, and troubleshoot complex electrical, electronic, or mechanical systems to ensure optimal functioning. Their work involves fabricating, assembling, and installing various components, often following detailed blueprints and schematics. They also program and install related software and hardware. Additionally, they may use specialized equipment to observe or record information in diverse environments, and assist in evaluating and testing new equipment designs, maintaining detailed operational records throughout.

ONET description:
Operate, test, maintain, or adjust unmanned, automated, servomechanical, or electromechanical equipment. May operate unmanned submarines, aircraft, or other equipment to observe or record visual information at sites such as oil rigs, crop fields, buildings, or for similar infrastructure, deep ocean exploration, or hazardous waste removal. May assist engineers in testing and designing robotics equipment.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field apply scientific and engineering principles to address environmental challenges. They collect and analyze various environmental samples, such as air or water, to monitor pollution levels. Their day-to-day activities involve operating and testing equipment designed for pollution control and remediation. They meticulously record data from field and laboratory work, often using computer programs or logbooks. These individuals prepare samples for shipping and testing, and they maintain equipment to ensure proper functionality. Furthermore, they compile data into reports, creating charts and graphs to illustrate findings. They also review technical documents and work plans to ensure tasks are completed accurately and in accordance with requirements.

ONET description:
Apply theory and principles of environmental engineering to modify, test, and operate equipment and devices used in the prevention, control, and remediation of environmental problems, including waste treatment and site remediation, under the direction of engineering staff or scientists. Generated description:
Professionals in this field meticulously examine structures, components, and materials to ensure their integrity without causing damage. They operate specialized equipment to perform various tests, interpreting complex data and results against established standards. These specialists identify potential flaws, such as cracks or fatigue, using techniques like radiography, ultrasonics, and thermal imaging. They meticulously document their findings, preparing detailed reports and records of the testing methods and outcomes. Decision-making involves selecting appropriate testing procedures, calibrating equipment, and evaluating whether detected imperfections meet safety or quality benchmarks. ONET description:
Test the safety of structures, vehicles, or vessels using x-ray, ultrasound, fiber optic or related equipment.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role gather critical data for various projects by conducting surveys and mapping operations. They meticulously position and secure equipment to take precise measurements of angles, distances, and elevations. A key part of their day involves analyzing aerial photographs and existing information to identify and interpret topographical features, property boundaries, and other geographic attributes. They utilize specialized computer systems to manage and process this data, producing maps and reports. A significant responsibility includes verifying the accuracy of maps and data against original sources and established standards, making necessary corrections and ensuring all information is up-to-date and complete before finalizing their work.

ONET description:
Perform surveying and mapping duties, usually under the direction of an engineer, surveyor, cartographer, or photogrammetrist, to obtain data used for construction, mapmaking, boundary location, mining, or other purposes. May calculate mapmaking information and create maps from source data, such as surveying notes, aerial photography, satellite data, or other maps to show topographical features, political boundaries, and other features. Generated description:
Professionals in this field apply scientific principles to analyze and improve food products and processes. They conduct in-depth studies on food composition, structure, and changes during storage or processing. Day-to-day activities involve checking raw ingredients and finished goods for safety, quality, and nutritional value, often through rigorous testing. They collaborate with various specialists to resolve development challenges and explore new methods for enhancing flavor, texture, and convenience. These professionals also research safer additives and develop innovative ways to preserve, process, package, and distribute food items, ensuring adherence to established standards and regulations.

Use chemistry, microbiology, engineering, and other sciences to study the principles underlying the processing and deterioration of foods; analyze food content to determine levels of vitamins, fat, sugar, and protein; discover new food sources; research ways to make processed foods safe, palatable, and healthful; and apply food science knowledge to determine best ways to process, package, preserve, store, and distribute food.

Generated description:
Individuals in this field explore the fundamental chemical and physical processes underlying life. They design and conduct experiments to investigate complex biological mechanisms, such as metabolism, growth, and heredity, often utilizing specialized equipment. Researchers analyze the effects of various substances on living organisms and tissues, seeking to understand disease at a molecular level. They also develop new methodologies for studying biological phenomena and may design or build unique laboratory apparatus. A significant part of their work involves synthesizing and analyzing molecules, determining structures, and preparing detailed reports or scientific publications. Many also engage in teaching, advising students, and securing funding for their investigations through proposal writing.

ONET description:
Study the chemical composition or physical principles of living cells and organisms, their electrical and mechanical energy, and related phenomena. May conduct research to further understanding of the complex chemical combinations and reactions involved in metabolism, reproduction, growth, and heredity. May determine the effects of foods, drugs, serums, hormones, and other substances on tissues and vital processes of living organisms.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field conduct in-depth investigations into the characteristics, growth, structure, and development of microscopic organisms. They meticulously isolate and maintain cultures under controlled conditions, adjusting environmental factors like moisture, aeration, temperature, and nutrition. Day-to-day activities involve performing tests on various specimens to detect harmful microorganisms, identify pathogens, or assess pollution and contamination. They often analyze the relationship between organisms and disease, studying the effects of treatments and observing how microorganisms interact with living tissues and organic matter. These professionals also develop new methods for preservation and detection, prepare detailed reports on their findings, and may supervise technical staff. Their work requires careful observation using specialized equipment and rigorous scientific analysis to understand and document microbial life.

ONET description:
Investigate the growth, structure, development, and other characteristics of microscopic organisms, such as bacteria, algae, or fungi. Includes medical microbiologists who study the relationship between organisms and disease or the effects of antibiotics on microorganisms.

[{'Task': 'Isolate and maintain cultures of bacteria or other microorganisms in prescribed or developed media, controlling moisture, aeration, temperature, and nutrition.'}, {'Task': 'Provide laboratory services for health departments, community environmental health programs, and physicians needing information for diagnosis and treatment.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor and perform tests on water, food, and the environment to detect harmful microorganisms or to obtain information about sources of pollution, contamination, or infection.'}, {'Task': 'Examine physiological, morphological, and cultural characteristics, using microscope, to identify and classify microorganisms in human, water, and food specimens.'}, {'Task': 'Supervise biological technologists and technicians and other scientists.'}, {'Task': 'Use a variety of specialized equipment, such as electron microscopes, gas and high-pressure liquid chromatographs, electrophoresis units, thermocyclers, fluorescence-activated cell sorters, and phosphorimagers.'}, {'Task': 'Investigate the relationship between organisms and disease, including the control of epidemics and the effects of antibiotics on microorganisms.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare technical reports and recommendations, based upon research outcomes.'}, {'Task': 'Observe action of microorganisms upon living tissues of plants, higher animals, and other microorganisms, and on dead organic matter.'}, {'Task': 'Study growth, structure, development, and general characteristics of bacteria and other microorganisms to understand their relationship to human, plant, and animal health.'}, {'Task': 'Study the structure and function of human, animal, and plant tissues, cells, pathogens, and toxins.'}, {'Task': 'Develop new products and procedures for sterilization, food and pharmaceutical supply preservation, or microbial contamination detection.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct chemical analyses of substances such as acids, alcohols, and enzymes.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this field develop and implement plans for managing forest resources sustainably. They assess forest conditions, map vegetation, and estimate timber value and growth potential. These professionals negotiate contracts for harvesting, ensuring compliance with regulations and minimizing environmental impact. They design and oversee projects for conservation, including wildlife habitat preservation and water quality protection. Their responsibilities extend to planning reforestation efforts, selecting planting sites, and monitoring the health and growth of new trees. They also supervise forestry operations and provide expert advice on a range of forestry-related issues to various stakeholders. Their work involves complex problem-solving and critical decision-making to balance resource utilization with long-term ecological health.

ONET description:
Manage public and private forested lands for economic, recreational, and conservation purposes. May inventory the type, amount, and location of standing timber, appraise the timber's worth, negotiate the purchase, and draw up contracts for procurement. May determine how to conserve wildlife habitats, creek beds, water quality, and soil stability, and how best to comply with environmental regulations. May devise plans for planting and growing new trees, monitor trees for healthy growth, and determine optimal harvesting schedules.

Professionals in this field investigate and analyze the causes, spread, and effects of diseases, disabilities, and other health conditions. These professionals also oversee public health programs, contributing to health planning, surveillance, and improvement initiatives. Generated description:
Individuals in this role analyze and investigate the properties and structures of diverse natural and synthetic materials, including metals, polymers, and ceramics. They plan and conduct experiments to assess material behavior under various conditions and stresses, aiming to enhance existing materials or develop new ones with specific characteristics. This involves testing materials for mechanical, electrical, and thermal properties, and evaluating their performance in different environments. They also document findings through reports and research papers, and collaborate with colleagues and customers to understand requirements and recommend appropriate material solutions for various applications. This work may also involve supervising production processes and ensuring adherence to quality standards.

ONET description:
Research and study the structures and chemical properties of various natural and synthetic or composite materials, including metals, alloys, rubber, ceramics, semiconductors, polymers, and glass. Determine ways to strengthen or combine materials or develop new materials with new or specific properties for use in a variety of products and applications. Includes glass scientists, ceramic scientists, metallurgical scientists, and polymer scientists.

Element Name: Environmental Scientists and Specialists, Including Health
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this field conduct investigations to identify, mitigate, or eliminate sources of pollution or hazards affecting the environment or public health. They collect, analyze, and synthesize data from various sources, such as air, soil, and water samples, to understand environmental impacts and pollution levels. Based on their findings, they prepare reports, create charts, and provide scientific guidance. They also develop theories and methods for pollution abatement and control, and recommend preventive measures. These professionals communicate scientific and technical information to diverse audiences, review and implement environmental regulations, and provide oversight for environmental programs. Additionally, they may conduct audits, process permits, and offer advice on environmental management policies and strategies.

ONET description:
Conduct research or perform investigation for the purpose of identifying, abating, or eliminating sources of pollutants or hazards that affect either the environment or public health. Using knowledge of various scientific disciplines, may collect, synthesize, study, report, and recommend action based on data derived from measurements or observations of air, food, soil, water, and other sources.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Communicate scientific or technical information to the public, organizations, or internal audiences through oral briefings, written documents, workshops, conferences, training sessions, or public hearings.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor effects of pollution or land degradation and recommend means of prevention or control.'}, {'Task': 'Collect, synthesize, analyze, manage, and report environmental data, such as pollution emission measurements, atmospheric monitoring measurements, meteorological or mineralogical information, or soil or water samples.'}, {'Task': 'Review and implement environmental technical standards, guidelines, policies, and formal regulations that meet all appropriate requirements.'}, {'Task': 'Provide scientific or technical guidance, support, coordination, or oversight to governmental agencies, environmental programs, industry, or the public.'}, {'Task': 'Process and review environmental permits, licenses, or related materials.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct environmental audits or inspections or investigations of violations.'}, {'Task': 'Provide advice on proper standards and regulations or the development of policies, strategies, or codes of practice for environmental management.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare charts or graphs from data samples, providing summary information on the environmental relevance of the data.'}, {'Task': 'Research sources of pollution to determine their effects on the environment and to develop theories or methods of pollution abatement or control.'}, {'Task': 'Supervise or train students, environmental technologists, technicians, or other related staff.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor environmental impacts of development activities.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role engage in thorough research and analysis of evolving policies concerning environmental conditions and climate dynamics. They critically examine existing legislation and studies from various sources to understand their impacts and identify areas for improvement. Based on their findings, they formulate and present recommendations for new or revised policies, legislative actions, and strategic initiatives aimed at addressing climate change and promoting sustainability. They prepare comprehensive reports, briefs, and other written materials to communicate complex information to diverse audiences, including government bodies and advocacy groups. Furthermore, they may contribute to developing educational programs and seek funding to support climate-related projects.

ONET description:
Research and analyze policy developments related to climate change. Make climate-related recommendations for actions such as legislation, awareness campaigns, or fundraising approaches.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role analyze scientific data to create practical strategies for restoration and management. They conduct site assessments to evaluate environmental conditions and identify restoration needs, then develop detailed plans, often involving habitat management and restoration. Collaboration is key as they provide technical guidance to field and biology staff, overseeing project implementation and ensuring compliance with policies. They also develop project schedules and budgets, seek necessary permits, and communicate findings and recommendations to colleagues and other professionals. Writing grants for funding and creating models or diagrams to visualize plans are also part of their responsibilities, all aimed at achieving environmental restoration goals.

ONET description:
Collaborate with field and biology staff to oversee the implementation of restoration projects and to develop new products. Process and synthesize complex scientific data into practical strategies for restoration, monitoring or management.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role analyze the environmental impact of products, systems, and projects by examining material and energy flows in production processes. They develop and implement strategies to minimize ecological damage, often by redesigning linear systems into cyclical ones that treat waste as a resource. This involves conducting sustainability assessments, reviewing scientific literature, and building databases of relevant information. They also analyze how human behavior affects and is affected by environmental changes. A key responsibility is preparing technical reports on environmental impacts and recommending methods to protect the environment, translating ecological theories into practical applications. They may also develop alternative energy scenarios and forecast future ecosystem conditions.

ONET description:
Apply principles and processes of natural ecosystems to develop models for efficient industrial systems. Use knowledge from the physical and social sciences to maximize effective use of natural resources in the production and use of goods and services. Examine societal issues and their relationship with both technical systems and the environment.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field conduct field studies and collect samples to gather data on the Earth's composition and structure. They analyze and interpret geological, geochemical, and geophysical information using specialized software and various data sources like survey results and well logs. These individuals investigate the Earth's crust, examining soils, minerals, rocks, and fossil remains to understand its history. They also identify risks associated with natural disasters and prepare reports, maps, and diagrams to communicate their findings. Their work involves advising on land use, construction projects, and resource management, often by locating potential natural resources or water sources. Furthermore, they measure Earth characteristics like gravitational or magnetic fields and review relevant technical documents.

ONET description:
Study the composition, structure, and other physical aspects of the Earth. May use geological, physics, and mathematics knowledge in exploration for oil, gas, minerals, or underground water; or in waste disposal, land reclamation, or other environmental problems. May study the Earth's internal composition, atmospheres, and oceans, and its magnetic, electrical, and gravitational forces. Includes mineralogists, paleontologists, stratigraphers, geodesists, and seismologists.

Tasks:

These individuals advise management on policies and practices, facilitate organizational development, and coach leaders. Generated description:
Individuals in this role assess, diagnose, and treat mental, emotional, and behavioral disorders. They conduct interviews, administer psychological tests, and review case histories to understand clients' issues. Developing and implementing individualized treatment plans using various therapeutic techniques is central to their work. They provide counseling to help clients gain insight, manage distress, and achieve personal, social, educational, or vocational adjustments. Documentation of client progress, session notes, and treatment plans is essential. They also consult with other professionals and may provide training or educational programs. This involves critical thinking to evaluate treatment effectiveness and adapt approaches as needed, while maintaining professional knowledge.

ONET description:
Assess, diagnose, and treat mental and emotional disorders of individuals through observation, interview, and psychological tests. Help individuals with distress or maladjustment understand their problems through their knowledge of case history, interviews with patients, and theory. Provide individual or group counseling services to assist individuals in achieving more effective personal, social, educational, and vocational development and adjustment. May design behavior modification programs and consult with medical personnel regarding the best treatment for patients.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field assess individuals to identify educational, behavioral, or developmental challenges impacting their learning. They interpret assessment results and collaborate with educators, families, and other personnel to develop and implement intervention strategies. This involves counseling individuals and families, maintaining confidential records, and providing consultation on learning and behavioral approaches. They also collect and analyze data to evaluate program effectiveness, design educational programs, and facilitate understanding of child development. When necessary, they report concerns about child welfare and refer individuals to external support services. They continually engage in professional development to stay current with advancements in their field.

ONET description:
Diagnose and implement individual or schoolwide interventions or strategies to address educational, behavioral, or developmental issues that adversely impact educational functioning in a school. May address student learning and behavioral problems and counsel students or families. May design and implement performance plans, and evaluate performance. May consult with other school-based personnel.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role conduct evaluations to assess cognitive functions such as intelligence, memory, and attention. They interview patients to gather detailed medical histories and administer various tests. Based on the data collected from these assessments and interviews, they diagnose conditions impacting the central nervous system. Professionals write comprehensive reports detailing their findings and may consult with other specialists regarding patient care. They also establish baseline measures for monitoring disease progression or recovery. Some individuals design and implement rehabilitation plans for cognitive dysfunction, provide education and counseling to patients and their families, and may supervise students or staff. Staying current with developments in the field through literature and professional engagement is also a key responsibility.

ONET description:
Apply theories and principles of neuropsychology to evaluate and diagnose disorders of higher cerebral functioning, often in research and medical settings. Study the human brain and the effect of physiological states on human cognition and behavior. May formulate and administer programs of treatment.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role conduct comprehensive evaluations to assess cognitive and neurobehavioral functions, focusing on how nervous system disorders affect behavior. They interview individuals to gather detailed medical histories and administer various tests to measure abilities like intelligence, memory, and language. Based on this data, they write detailed reports, diagnose conditions resulting from brain injuries or illnesses, and distinguish between different causes of dysfunction. They then develop and recommend treatment plans, which may include therapy or other interventions. These professionals also collaborate with other specialists, monitor patient progress before and after medical procedures, and provide education to patients, families, and students.

ONET description:
Assess and diagnose patients with neurobehavioral problems related to acquired or developmental disorders of the nervous system, such as neurodegenerative disorders, traumatic brain injury, seizure disorders, and learning disabilities. Recommend treatment after diagnosis, such as therapy, medication, or surgery. Assist with evaluation before and after neurosurgical procedures, such as deep brain stimulation.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field examine human society and social behavior by studying the groups, organizations, and institutions people form. They collect data through observation, interviews, and document reviews to understand attitudes, values, and behaviors. Researchers develop and test theories about societal issues, analyzing data to understand social dynamics. They design and implement data collection methods, and may write grants for funding. Findings are often communicated through publications, reports, and presentations to colleagues or the public. They may also consult with others on social issues, advise on policies, and direct the work of support staff. Collaboration with peers in related fields is also common.

ONET description:
Study human society and social behavior by examining the groups and social institutions that people form, as well as various social, religious, political, and business organizations. May study the behavior and interaction of groups, trace their origin and growth, and analyze the influence of group activities on individual members.

These professionals develop and administer plans and policies that guide land use and development. They conduct research and analyze data on economic, social, and environmental factors impacting communities. They prepare reports and maps to visualize land use and demographic information. Professionals in this role collaborate with government officials, experts, developers, and the public through meetings and discussions to address land use issues and formulate plans. They assess the feasibility and potential impacts of proposed projects, recommending approval or denial. They also mediate disputes, identify sustainability opportunities, and ensure compliance with regulations. Some may also guide the work of technical staff and coordinate with consultants.

ONET description:
Develop comprehensive plans and programs for use of land and physical facilities of jurisdictions, such as towns, cities, counties, and metropolitan areas.

These professionals collect and analyze data using geospatial technologies to inform agricultural practices. They gather information on soil attributes, field boundaries, and yield performance, often utilizing field recorders and mapping software. They create detailed maps layering information such as soil types, crop yields, and application patterns to identify trends and areas needing specific attention. Based on this analysis, they develop site-specific management plans, recommending crop varieties, seeding rates, or targeted treatments to optimize resource use and minimize environmental impact. They also install, calibrate, and maintain various sensors and guidance systems, ensuring the accuracy of data collection and application processes. They communicate findings through reports and advise on technology upgrades.

ONET description:
Apply geospatial technologies, including geographic information systems (GIS) and Global Positioning System (GPS), to agricultural production or management activities, such as pest scouting, site-specific pesticide application, yield mapping, or variable-rate irrigation. May use computers to develop or analyze maps or remote sensing images to compare physical topography with data on soils, fertilizer, pests, or weather.

Element Name: Environmental Science and Protection Technicians, Including Health
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role conduct laboratory and field tests to assess environmental conditions and pinpoint pollution sources that may affect public health. They meticulously collect various samples, including gases, soil, and water, for thorough analysis. These professionals calibrate testing instruments to ensure accuracy and then perform complex calculations and measurements to determine pollutant concentrations. They meticulously record their findings, often creating detailed reports, summaries, or charts to interpret the data. Additionally, they inspect facilities for potential health and safety hazards, offering recommendations to mitigate risks and improve conditions. They also provide technical assistance and information to various stakeholders regarding environmental protection and safety measures, maintaining organized records of their work.

ONET description:
Perform laboratory and field tests to monitor the environment and investigate sources of pollution, including those that affect health, under the direction of an environmental scientist, engineer, or other specialist. May collect samples of gases, soil, water, and other materials for testing.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Collect samples of gases, soils, water, industrial wastewater, or asbestos products to conduct tests on pollutant levels or identify sources of pollution.'}, {'Task': 'Investigate hazardous conditions or spills or outbreaks of disease or food poisoning, collecting samples for analysis.'}, {'Task': 'Record test data and prepare reports, summaries, or charts that interpret test results.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare samples or photomicrographs for testing and analysis.'}, {'Task': 'Discuss test results and analyses with customers.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect workplaces to ensure the absence of health and safety hazards, such as high noise levels, radiation, or potential lighting hazards.'}, {'Task': 'Weigh, analyze, or measure collected sample particles, such as lead, coal dust, or rock, to determine concentration of pollutants.'}, {'Task': 'Calibrate microscopes or test instruments.'}, {'Task': 'Provide information or technical or program assistance to government representatives, employers, or the general public on the issues of public health, environmental protection, or workplace safety.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain files, such as hazardous waste databases, chemical usage data, personnel exposure information, or diagrams showing equipment locations.'}, {'Task': 'Set up equipment or stations to monitor and collect pollutants from sites, such as smoke stacks, manufacturing plants, or mechanical equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Develop or implement programs for monitoring of environmental pollution or radiation.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor emission control devices to ensure they are operating properly and comply with state and federal regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Make recommendations to control or eliminate unsafe conditions at workplaces or public facilities.'}, {'Task': 'Calculate amount of pollutant in samples or compute air pollution or gas flow in industrial processes, using chemical and mathematical formulas.'}, {'Task': 'Develop testing procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Perform statistical analysis of environmental data.'}, {'Task': 'Develop or implement site recycling or hazardous waste stream programs.'}, {'Task': 'Direct activities of workers in laboratory.'}, {'Task': 'Analyze potential environmental impacts of production process changes, and recommend steps to mitigate negative impacts.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role support scientific endeavors by using specialized instruments to gather data for exploration and production activities. They meticulously analyze various samples, such as mud and drill cuttings, to determine their composition and properties. Charting critical well or borehole characteristics like pressure and temperature is a key responsibility. They also compile, log, and record this operational data for further review and analysis. Preparing detailed notes, sketches, and geological maps are common duties, aiding in the visualization and understanding of subsurface conditions. Adjusting and maintaining testing equipment ensures the accuracy and reliability of collected information.

ONET description:
Assist scientists or engineers in the use of electronic, sonic, or nuclear measuring instruments in laboratory, exploration, and production activities to obtain data indicating resources such as metallic ore, minerals, gas, coal, or petroleum. Analyze mud and drill cuttings. Chart pressure, temperature, and other characteristics of wells or bore holes.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field regularly collect and analyze various samples, such as air and water, to assess radioactivity levels and identify contaminants. They meticulously monitor work areas, equipment, and personnel to determine radiation intensities and exposure levels using specialized instruments. A key responsibility involves calculating safe exposure times based on contamination readings and established limits, and promptly informing supervisors when these limits are approached. They provide initial responses to alarms and abnormal events, and can be called upon to decontaminate objects or manage radioactive waste. Additionally, they instruct others on safety procedures, demonstrate the use of protective gear, and document their findings and decontamination methods in reports.

ONET description:
Collect and test samples to monitor results of nuclear experiments and contamination of humans, facilities, and environment.

Tasks:

Element Name: Substance Abuse and Behavioral Disorder Counselors
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Develop and implement treatment plans for individuals facing dependencies or behavioral issues. Assess client needs through interviews and by reviewing records, making crucial decisions about program suitability. Counsel clients individually or in groups, providing guidance and support to help them overcome challenges and adjust to life changes. Collaborate with other professionals, such as medical staff and social workers, to coordinate care and ensure comprehensive support. Monitor client progress, adjusting treatment plans as needed and planning follow-up care. Advocate for clients in crisis situations and provide information and resources to clients and their families, fostering understanding and facilitating recovery. Maintain accurate records of services and progress.

ONET description:
Counsel and advise individuals with alcohol, tobacco, drug, or other problems, such as gambling and eating disorders. May counsel individuals, families, or groups or engage in prevention programs.

Element Name: Educational, Guidance, and Career Counselors and Advisors
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals actively engage with individuals by conducting in-depth interviews, utilizing assessments, and reviewing records to understand their abilities, interests, and needs. They provide guidance on educational paths, including course selection, program enrollment, and meeting graduation or admission requirements. Their responsibilities extend to offering support for personal, social, or behavioral challenges impacting educational or career pursuits, and crisis intervention when necessary. They also instruct individuals on career development techniques, facilitate the exploration of learning opportunities, and connect them with relevant resources and external services. Maintaining confidential records and preparing reports are integral parts of their role, alongside collaborating with colleagues on program development and promotion.

ONET description:
Advise and assist students and provide educational and vocational guidance services.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role assess and address emotional and behavioral challenges by employing therapeutic techniques and theories. They conduct interviews, observations, and assessments to gather information about clients and their situations. Based on this information, they develop and implement personalized treatment plans aimed at resolving issues within relationships and improving overall well-being. They guide clients in developing constructive strategies for problem-solving and encourage the application of new skills. Professionals also maintain detailed records of client progress and interventions, and make decisions regarding ongoing support or referrals to other specialists. They may also provide educational outreach and consultation on their areas of expertise.

ONET description:
Diagnose and treat mental and emotional disorders, whether cognitive, affective, or behavioral, within the context of marriage and family systems. Apply psychotherapeutic and family systems theories and techniques in the delivery of services to individuals, couples, and families for the purpose of treating such diagnosed nervous and mental disorders.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role focus on promoting optimal mental and emotional well-being through counseling and guidance. They actively listen to clients, encouraging them to express feelings and gain insight into their lives and relationships. A key responsibility involves assessing client conditions, developing personalized treatment plans, and modifying them as needed. They also perform crisis interventions, manage client records with strict confidentiality, and prepare detailed reports. Collaboration with other professionals is essential for comprehensive client care, including making referrals to community resources or specialists. Additionally, they may advocate for clients, coordinate services, and lead structured programs or workshops aimed at improving mental health and preventing issues like substance abuse.

ONET description:
Counsel and advise individuals and groups to promote optimum mental and emotional health, with an emphasis on prevention. May help individuals deal with a broad range of mental health issues, such as those associated with addictions and substance abuse; family, parenting, and marital problems; stress management; self-esteem; or aging.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field assess individuals' needs by analyzing personal histories, medical and educational records, and diagnostic evaluations. They then develop and implement tailored rehabilitation plans designed to enhance independence and employability. This involves conferring with clients to set goals, discussing available options, and creating strategies to overcome barriers to personal, social, or vocational success. They actively coordinate services, liaising with families, healthcare providers, and community agencies to ensure clients receive necessary support. Professionals also monitor client progress, facilitate job development and placement, and provide ongoing support to resolve issues and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented plans. Documentation and record-keeping are essential components of their daily activities.

ONET description:
Counsel individuals to maximize the independence and employability of persons coping with personal, social, and vocational difficulties that result from birth defects, illness, disease, accidents, aging, or the stress of daily life. Coordinate activities for residents of care and treatment facilities. Assess client needs and design and implement rehabilitation programs that may include personal and vocational counseling, training, and job placement.

Element Name: Child, Family, and School Social Workers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this role assess individuals, families, and groups to understand their challenges, such as behavioral issues, academic difficulties, or family crises. They develop and implement tailored service plans, collaborating with clients to monitor progress and adjust strategies as needed. These professionals act as crucial liaisons, connecting individuals with essential community resources like medical care, housing, or counseling services. They also document case histories, prepare reports, and provide guidance to parents and educators to foster well-being and improve functioning. Additionally, they may intervene in sensitive situations, offering support and coordinating services to address immediate needs and prevent escalation of problems.

ONET description:
Provide social services and assistance to improve the social and psychological functioning of children and their families and to maximize the family well-being and the academic functioning of children. May assist parents, arrange adoptions, and find foster homes for abandoned or abused children. In schools, they address such problems as teenage pregnancy, misbehavior, and truancy. May also advise teachers.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role provide crucial psychosocial support to people navigating significant health challenges, including chronic, acute, or terminal illnesses. They offer guidance and counseling to patients and their families, helping them understand symptoms, available options, and coping mechanisms. A key responsibility involves assessing individual needs and environmental barriers that impede progress. They connect individuals with essential community resources, such as financial aid, housing, or further education, to support recovery and well-being. This often includes case management, coordinating care plans, and adapting them as client status evolves. They may also advise family caregivers and, in some capacities, supervise other service providers.

ONET description:
Provide individuals, families, and groups with the psychosocial support needed to cope with chronic, acute, or terminal illnesses. Services include advising family caregivers. Provide patients with information and counseling, and make referrals for other services. May also provide case and care management or interventions designed to promote health, prevent disease, and address barriers to access to healthcare.

Element Name: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals assess and treat individuals facing challenges such as mental health conditions, emotional distress, or substance abuse. They conduct interviews and review records to evaluate a person's condition, often collaborating with other healthcare providers to develop and coordinate treatment plans. Day-to-day activities include providing individual and group counseling, monitoring client progress, and adjusting treatment strategies as needed. They also assist clients in accessing community resources, ensuring they receive necessary support for recovery. Additionally, these professionals may educate clients and their families about various conditions and available resources, and advocate for client needs.

ONET description:
Assess and treat individuals with mental, emotional, or substance abuse problems, including abuse of alcohol, tobacco, and/or other drugs. Activities may include individual and group therapy, crisis intervention, case management, client advocacy, prevention, and education.

[{'Task': 'Counsel clients in individual or group sessions to assist them in dealing with substance abuse, mental or physical illness, poverty, unemployment, or physical abuse.'}, {'Task': 'Collaborate with counselors, physicians, or nurses to plan or coordinate treatment, drawing on social work experience and patient needs.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor, evaluate, and record client progress with respect to treatment goals.'}, {'Task': 'Interview clients, review records, conduct assessments, or confer with other professionals to evaluate the mental or physical condition of clients or patients.'}, {'Task': 'Supervise or direct other workers who provide services to clients or patients.'}, {'Task': 'Modify treatment plans according to changes in client status.'}, {'Task': 'Assist clients in adhering to treatment plans, such as setting up appointments, arranging for transportation to appointments, or providing support.'}, {'Task': 'Educate clients or community members about mental or physical illness, abuse, medication, or available community resources.'}, {'Task': 'Counsel or aid family members to assist them in understanding, dealing with, or supporting the client or patient.'}, {'Task': 'Increase social work knowledge by reviewing current literature, conducting social research, or attending seminars, training workshops, or classes.'}, {'Task': 'Refer patient, client, or family to community resources for housing or treatment to assist in recovery from mental or physical illness, following through to ensure service efficacy.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this role identify health needs by analyzing data and conducting surveys, then develop and implement programs to promote healthy lifestyles. They create educational materials and conduct presentations for diverse audiences. These individuals collaborate with various organizations and community groups to establish goals and provide resources. They monitor and evaluate program effectiveness, making adjustments as necessary to ensure objectives are met. Additionally, they may manage staff, administer budgets, secure funding through grant applications, and maintain informational resources. Their work involves clear communication, both written and verbal, to inform individuals and the public about health issues and program offerings.

ONET description:

Use data to identify community needs prior to planning, implementing, monitoring, and evaluating programs designed to encourage healthy lifestyles, policies, and environments. May link health systems, health providers, insurers, and patients to address individual and population health needs. May serve as resource to assist individuals, other health professionals, or the community, and may administer fiscal resources for health education programs.

Element Name: Probation Officers and Correctional Treatment Specialists
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals provide essential support services to assist individuals in their rehabilitation and reintegration into society. They meticulously gather background information, interview individuals, and assess their progress toward established goals and rehabilitation plans. Key responsibilities include developing and monitoring adherence to specific stipulations, such as educational or employment requirements, and recommending appropriate actions or interventions. They also facilitate access to necessary services like mental health or substance abuse treatment. These specialists communicate regularly with individuals, their support networks, and relevant agencies, preparing detailed reports and offering guidance on legal and social matters. Their work involves critical decision-making, case management, and advocating for beneficial outcomes during court proceedings.

ONET description:
Provide social services to assist in rehabilitation of law offenders in custody or on probation or parole. Make recommendations for actions involving formulation of rehabilitation plan and treatment of offender, including conditional release and education and employment stipulations.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Prepare and maintain case folder for each assigned inmate or offender.'}, {'Task': 'Gather information about offenders\' backgrounds by talking to offenders, their families and friends, and other people who have relevant information.'}, {'Task': 'Interview probationers and parolees regularly to evaluate their progress in accomplishing goals and maintaining the terms specified in their probation contracts and rehabilitation plans.'}, {'Task': 'Discuss with offenders how such issues as drug and alcohol abuse and anger management problems might have played roles in their criminal behavior.'}, {'Task': 'Supervise people on community-based sentences, such as electronically monitored home detention, and provide field supervision of probationers by conducting curfew checks or visits to home, work, or school.'}, {'Task': 'Investigate alleged parole violations, using interviews, surveillance, and search and seizure.'}, {'Task': 'Recommend remedial action or initiate court action in response to noncompliance with terms of probation or parole.'}, {'Task': 'Arrange for medical, mental health, or substance abuse treatment services according to individual needs or court orders.'}, {'Task': 'Develop liaisons and networks with other parole officers, community agencies, correctional institutions, psychiatric facilities, and aftercare agencies to plan for helping offenders with life adjustments.'}, {'Task': 'Administer drug and alcohol tests, including random drug screens of offenders, to verify compliance with substance abuse treatment programs.'}, {'Task': 'Inform offenders or inmates of requirements of conditional release, such as office visits, restitution payments, or educational and employment stipulations.'}, {'Task': 'Participate in decisions about whether cases should go before courts and which court should hear them.'}, {'Task': 'Write reports describing offenders\' progress.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct prehearing and presentencing investigations and testify in court regarding offenders\' backgrounds and recommended sentences and sentencing conditions.'}, {'Task': 'Arrange for postrelease services, such as employment, housing, counseling, education, and social activities.'}, {'Task': 'Provide offenders or inmates with assistance in matters concerning detainers, sentences in other jurisdictions, writs, and applications for social assistance.'}, {'Task': 'Develop and prepare packets containing information about social service agencies, assistance organizations, and programs that might be useful for inmates or offenders.'}]

A significant part of the role includes connecting individuals with community services, benefits, or agencies that can offer further assistance. They act as advocates, helping people navigate interactions with healthcare providers and social services to meet their health needs. They also provide direct support, such as distributing educational materials or conducting screenings. Maintaining accurate records of interactions and progress is crucial. May deliver health-related preventive services such as blood pressure, glaucoma, and hearing screenings. May collect data to help identify community health needs.

Individuals in this role plan and oversee educational and outreach initiatives to further the goals of a religious organization. They develop study courses, select appropriate learning materials, and schedule various events like camps and conferences. A significant part of their work involves counseling individuals on personal, health, financial, and spiritual matters. They also recruit and train volunteers, manage program logistics, and publicize activities through various channels. Collaboration with colleagues and organizational leaders is key to setting objectives and encouraging participation. They analyze participation trends and program costs to inform decisions and may lead fundraising efforts, attending external events to gather new ideas and resources for their programs.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role analyze complex legal issues, interpreting statutes, regulations, and precedents to advise clients and determine probable case outcomes. They meticulously gather evidence by interviewing clients and witnesses, then develop strategic arguments and evaluate findings for the best course of action. A significant part of their day involves preparing, drafting, and reviewing various legal documents, such as contracts and wills. They also represent clients in legal proceedings and negotiate settlements or contractual agreements. This work requires strong critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills to effectively advocate for clients' rights and obligations in diverse legal matters, while also potentially supervising support staff and managing administrative duties.

ONET description:
Represent clients in criminal and civil litigation and other legal proceedings, draw up legal documents, or manage or advise clients on legal transactions. May specialize in a single area or may practice broadly in many areas of law.

Element Name: Administrative Law Judges, Adjudicators, and Hearing Officers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role preside over formal proceedings, listening to arguments and reviewing evidence to make impartial decisions. They analyze laws, regulations, and past rulings to determine liability, resolve disputes, and recommend or finalize outcomes for various claims. Responsibilities include managing hearings to ensure fairness, ruling on procedural matters like evidence admissibility, and documenting conclusions in written opinions. They communicate decisions to parties involved and explain appeal processes when necessary. Interactions involve conferring with individuals and organizations to gather information, issue official directives, and administer oaths. Their core function is to interpret and apply legal frameworks to reach informed judgments.

ONET description:
Conduct hearings to recommend or make decisions on claims concerning government programs or other government-related matters. Determine liability, sanctions, or penalties, or recommend the acceptance or rejection of claims or settlements.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Determine existence and amount of liability according to current laws, administrative and judicial precedents, and available evidence.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor and direct the activities of trials and hearings to ensure that they are conducted fairly and that courts administer justice while safeguarding the legal rights of all involved parties.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare written opinions and decisions.'}, {'Task': 'Authorize payment of valid claims and determine method of payment.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct hearings to review and decide claims regarding issues, such as social program eligibility, environmental protection, or enforcement of health and safety regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Research and analyze laws, regulations, policies, and precedent decisions to prepare for hearings and to determine conclusions.'}, {'Task': 'Review and evaluate data on documents, such as claim applications, birth or death certificates, or physician or employer records.'}, {'Task': 'Recommend the acceptance or rejection of claims or compromise settlements according to laws, regulations, policies, and precedent decisions.'}, {'Task': 'Rule on exceptions, motions, and admissibility of evidence.'}, {'Task': 'Explain to claimants how they can appeal rulings that go against them.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with individuals or organizations involved in cases to obtain relevant information.'}, {'Task': 'Issue subpoenas and administer oaths in preparation for formal hearings.'}]

Generated description:
These professionals facilitate constructive dialogue to resolve disagreements outside of traditional legal settings. They actively listen to all parties involved, carefully assessing their needs and interests to identify underlying concerns. Utilizing specialized techniques, they guide conversations, foster mutual understanding, and assist participants in reaching mutually acceptable agreements. Their work involves researching applicable rules and precedents, conducting meetings to clarify issues and set procedural terms, and evaluating presented information from various sources. They may also draft formal documentation, such as settlement agreements or written opinions, and make determinations based on the evidence and established principles. The primary goal is to enable parties to settle disputes amicably.

ONET description:
Facilitate negotiation and conflict resolution through dialogue. Resolve conflicts outside of the court system by mutual consent of parties involved.

[{'Task': 'Prepare written opinions or decisions regarding cases.'}, {'Task': 'Apply relevant laws, regulations, policies, or precedents to reach conclusions.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct hearings to obtain information or evidence relative to disposition of claims.'}, {'Task': 'Determine extent of liability according to evidence, laws, or administrative or judicial precedents.'}, {'Task': 'Rule on exceptions, motions, or admissibility of evidence.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with disputants to clarify issues, identify underlying concerns, and develop an understanding of their respective needs and interests.'}, {'Task': 'Use mediation techniques to facilitate communication between disputants, to further parties\' understanding of different perspectives, and to guide parties toward mutual agreement.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct initial meetings with disputants to outline the arbitration process, settle procedural matters, such as fees, or determine details, such as witness numbers or time requirements.'}, {'Task': 'Evaluate information from documents, such as claim applications, birth or death certificates, or physician or employer records.'}, {'Task': 'Research laws, regulations, policies, or precedent decisions to prepare for hearings.'}, {'Task': 'Issue subpoenas or administer oaths to prepare for formal hearings.'}, {'Task': 'Set up appointments for parties to meet for mediation.'}, {'Task': 'Recommend acceptance or rejection of compromise settlement offers.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare settlement agreements for disputants to sign.'}, {'Task': 'Authorize payment of valid claims.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role preside over legal proceedings, ensuring fairness and adherence to established rules. They meticulously review documents, listen attentively to arguments, and evaluate evidence to make critical decisions. A significant part of their day involves interpreting laws, advising participants on procedures, and ruling on the admissibility of information presented. They conduct hearings, listen to allegations, and determine the validity of charges. In criminal cases, they impose sentences based on statutes, while in civil matters, they award compensation. They also instruct juries, research complex legal questions, and document their findings in written decisions, ultimately administering justice.

ONET description:
Arbitrate, advise, adjudicate, or administer justice in a court of law. May sentence defendant in criminal cases according to government statutes or sentencing guidelines. May determine liability of defendant in civil cases. May perform wedding ceremonies.

[{'Task': 'Sentence defendants in criminal cases, on conviction by jury, according to applicable government statutes.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor proceedings to ensure that all applicable rules and procedures are followed.'}, {'Task': 'Instruct juries on applicable laws, direct juries to deduce the facts from the evidence presented, and hear their verdicts.'}, {'Task': 'Write decisions on cases.'}, {'Task': 'Read documents on pleadings and motions to ascertain facts and issues.'}, {'Task': 'Rule on admissibility of evidence and methods of conducting testimony.'}, {'Task': 'Preside over hearings and listen to allegations made by plaintiffs to determine whether the evidence supports the charges.'}, {'Task': 'Award compensation for damages to litigants in civil cases in relation to findings by juries or by the court.'}, {'Task': 'Advise attorneys, juries, litigants, and court personnel regarding conduct, issues, and proceedings.'}, {'Task': 'Research legal issues and write opinions on the issues.'}, {'Task': 'Interpret and enforce rules of procedure or establish new rules in situations where there are no procedures already established by law.'}, {'Task': 'Issue arrest warrants.'}, {'Task': 'Settle disputes between opposing attorneys.'}, {'Task': 'Impose restrictions upon parties in civil cases until trials can be held.'}, {'Task': 'Supervise other judges, court officers, and the court\'s administrative staff.'}]
