Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously review various legal and financial documents, including mortgages, contracts, and property records. They analyze these documents to determine ownership, identify restrictions, and assess potential encumbrances like delinquent taxes. A key part of their work involves verifying the accuracy and completeness of land-related information. They often compile detailed reports outlining findings and necessary actions to clear titles. Communication is essential, as they confer with various parties to exchange information and resolve discrepancies. They also update record-keeping systems and ensure all necessary data is accurately entered or maintained, preparing summaries of relevant instruments.

ONET description:
Search real estate records, examine titles, or summarize pertinent legal or insurance documents or details for a variety of purposes. May compile lists of mortgages, contracts, and other instruments pertaining to titles by searching public and private records for law firms, real estate agencies, or title insurance companies.

Professionals develop lesson plans, prepare teaching materials, and manage classroom environments to foster an atmosphere of respect and order. They assess student progress through various methods, provide feedback, and communicate with parents or guardians regarding academic and behavioral development. Collaboration with colleagues is essential for curriculum development and addressing student challenges. Additionally, professionals are responsible for maintaining accurate records, adhering to policies, and participating in professional development to enhance teaching practices and stay current with educational advancements.

ONET description:

Element Name: Adult Basic Education, Adult Secondary Education, and English as a Second Language Instructors
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Instructors guide learners by preparing and delivering lessons that cover foundational academic subjects, literacy, or a new language. They assess individual student needs and adapt teaching methods and materials accordingly, fostering an environment conducive to learning. This involves setting clear objectives, developing lesson plans, and utilizing diverse instructional techniques, including demonstrations and discussions. Instructors evaluate student progress through assignments, tests, and observations, providing feedback and support. They maintain records, enforce behavioral standards, and collaborate with colleagues to enhance educational programs. Additionally, they prepare learning spaces, manage classroom activities, and encourage students to pursue further educational opportunities. Continuous professional development through meetings and workshops is also a key aspect of their role.

ONET description:
Teach or instruct out-of-school youths and adults in basic education, literacy, or English as a Second Language classes, or in classes for earning a high school equivalency credential.

[{'Task': 'Observe and evaluate students\' work to determine progress and make suggestions for improvement.'}, {'Task': 'Observe students to determine qualifications, limitations, abilities, Generated description:
These professionals plan and deliver instruction to individuals or groups for personal enrichment. They adapt teaching methods and materials to suit diverse learning needs and interests, preparing students for ongoing development. Instructors carefully observe participants to understand their unique abilities and motivations, ensuring progress through regular monitoring and providing constructive feedback. They develop clear learning objectives, create comprehensive lesson plans, and prepare necessary materials and classroom environments. These individuals also administer assessments to evaluate understanding and issue grades. They collaborate with colleagues to refine instructional content and methods, aiming to enhance the learning experience. Additionally, they maintain accurate records and enforce applicable guidelines.

ONET description:
Teach or instruct individuals or groups for the primary purpose of self-enrichment or recreation, rather than for an occupational objective, educational attainment, competition, or fitness.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role temporarily step into classrooms to ensure educational continuity. They follow established lesson plans, manage student behavior by enforcing rules, and maintain order. Daily activities include taking attendance, distributing and collecting assignments, and answering student questions. They provide individualized or small group assistance, monitor student progress, and supervise learners during various activities. The role involves adapting instruction to meet diverse student needs and addressing academic or adjustment concerns. Effectively communicating instructions, fostering a positive learning environment, and utilizing available resources to supplement teaching are key responsibilities, all while adhering to predefined educational objectives.

ONET description:
Teach students on a short-term basis as a temporary replacement for a regular classroom teacher, typically using the regular teacher's lesson plan.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role work one-on-one or with small groups to enhance academic performance or prepare individuals for tests. They assess student needs, develop personalized learning plans, and create lesson materials. A significant part of their day involves actively instructing, reviewing subject matter, and teaching effective study and test-taking strategies. They monitor student progress, provide constructive feedback using positive reinforcement, and adjust teaching methods as needed. Communication is key, involving collaboration with students, parents, and educators to report on progress and discuss learning objectives. Maintaining confidential records of student performance and development is also a critical responsibility, alongside organizing the learning environment to maximize effectiveness.

ONET description:
Instruct individual students or small groups of students in academic subjects to support formal class instruction or to prepare students for standardized or admissions tests.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the critical task of appraising, organizing, and safeguarding permanent records and historically valuable documents. They develop classification systems to ensure materials are accessible and create detailed descriptions for easy retrieval. A significant part of their day involves providing assistance to individuals seeking information from these archives. They also manage digital records, maintain databases, and establish policies regarding public access. When necessary, they preserve documents by copying them into various formats. Researching the historical significance of materials, authenticating documents, and directing acquisition efforts are also key duties. Furthermore, they may coordinate outreach programs and select documents for publication or display, ensuring historical and informational integrity.

ONET description:
Appraise, edit, and direct safekeeping of permanent records and historically valuable documents. Participate in research activities based on archival materials.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the comprehensive management of collections, which may include items of artistic, historical, or scientific significance. They meticulously plan and execute the acquisition, preservation, and exhibition of these materials, often involving detailed research and authentication processes. Key duties include developing and maintaining cataloging systems, negotiating for the purchase or loan of items, and ensuring proper storage and environmental conditions. They also create and oversee public-facing activities, such as educational programs and exhibits, and communicate information about the collections. Furthermore, they contribute to institutional policy, financial planning, and staff supervision, while also engaging in scholarly writing and external outreach to foster support and collaboration.

ONET description:
Administer collections, such as artwork, collectibles, historic items, or scientific specimens of museums or other institutions. May conduct instructional, research, or public service activities of institution.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role meticulously examine and preserve objects, determining their condition and the best methods for repair and restoration. They meticulously clean and fabricate missing parts to restore items to their original appearance and prevent further deterioration. They also prepare objects for storage, research, or display, which involves carefully installing and arranging them. This work requires careful documentation, including photographing objects and entering data into databases. They may also conduct fieldwork, collaborate with experts when necessary, and advise on preservation procedures. Additionally, they might supervise others, and sometimes they share their knowledge by leading tours or teaching.

ONET description:
Restore, maintain, or prepare objects in museum collections for storage, research, or exhibit. May work with specimens such as fossils, skeletal parts, or botanicals; or artifacts, textiles, or art. May identify and record objects or install and arrange them in exhibits. Includes book or document conservators.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role manage and maintain collections of information, making them accessible to users. They acquire, catalog, and organize diverse materials, including digital resources. Key daily activities involve assisting individuals in locating and accessing information, often by teaching research skills and explaining available resources. They also evaluate materials for acquisition and deselection, manage circulation, and respond to inquiries. These individuals often plan and deliver educational programs, troubleshoot equipment, and collaborate with others to develop services and collections. They maintain accurate records and ensure the smooth operation of information access points, sometimes supervising staff and managing operational aspects.

ONET description:
Administer and maintain libraries or collections of information, for public or private access through reference or borrowing. Work in a variety of settings, such as educational institutions, museums, and corporations, and with various types of informational materials, such as books, periodicals, recordings, films, and databases. Tasks may include acquiring, cataloging, and circulating library materials, and user services such as locating and organizing information, providing instruction on how to access information, and setting up and operating a library's media equipment.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role assist patrons by locating materials and answering inquiries, referring complex questions to librarians. They manage the circulation process, checking items in and out, registering new users, and maintaining patron records. Responsibilities include organizing and shelving materials, identifying and repairing damaged items, and compiling data for reports. They may also manage library equipment, troubleshoot technical issues, and create promotional displays. Some roles involve supervising and training others, ensuring the smooth operation of library services and assisting users with various resources, including electronic databases and computers. They are also involved in maintaining accurate records of circulation and collections.

ONET description:
Assist librarians by helping readers in the use of library catalogs, databases, and indexes to locate books and other materials; and by answering questions that require only brief consultation of standard reference. Compile records; sort and shelve books or other media; remove or repair damaged books or other media; register patrons; and check materials in and out of the circulation process. Replace materials in shelving area (stacks) or files. Includes bookmobile drivers who assist with providing services in mobile libraries.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role provide guidance and education to people involved in agricultural activities or managing their households. They demonstrate best practices, share research findings, and develop outreach programs tailored to specific needs. This involves conducting classes, delivering lectures, and organizing community events on topics ranging from crop cultivation and livestock care to personal finance and nutrition. They also analyze data, conduct research, and prepare reports to inform their recommendations and identify community needs. Responsibilities include diagnosing and resolving production issues, advocating for agricultural producers, and maintaining detailed records of interactions and their outcomes to ensure effective support and continuous improvement.

ONET description:
Instruct and advise individuals and families engaged in agriculture, agricultural-related processes, or home management activities. Demonstrate procedures and apply research findings to advance agricultural and home management activities. May develop educational outreach programs. May instruct on either agricultural issues such as agricultural processes and techniques, pest management, and food safety, or on home management issues such as budgeting, nutrition, and child development.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role develop and refine educational content and programs by researching, evaluating, and recommending curricula and instructional methods. They coordinate the creation of learning materials, ensuring they align with current standards and technological advancements. A key part of their day involves planning and conducting training sessions to guide educators on new procedures, materials, and teaching aids. They also monitor teaching performance, offering advice and support to improve instructional techniques and student outcomes. This often includes advising staff on curriculum development and the effective implementation of educational programs. They may also be responsible for ensuring compliance with educational regulations and communicating program goals to stakeholders.

ONET description:
Develop instructional material, coordinate educational content, and incorporate current technology into instruction in order to provide guidelines to educators and instructors for developing curricula and conducting courses. May train and coach teachers. Includes educational consultants and specialists, and instructional material directors.

Element Name: Teaching Assistants, Preschool, Elementary, Middle, and Secondary School, Except Special Education
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role support lead educators by assisting students with learning activities and reinforcing instructional concepts. They work with students individually or in small groups, monitor their progress, and record relevant data. A key part of the job involves supervising students in various settings, including classrooms, playgrounds, and during field trips, while enforcing established rules and policies. This includes preparing and distributing learning materials, setting up demonstrations, and organizing educational displays. They also help manage classroom resources and ensure equipment is used properly and maintained. Additionally, they may teach social skills and organize recreational activities to foster holistic student development, collaborating closely with teachers to coordinate efforts.

ONET description:
Assist a preschool, elementary, middle, or secondary school teacher with instructional duties. Serve in a position for which a teacher has primary responsibility for the design and implementation of educational programs and services.

Tasks:

Generated description:
Individuals in this role support teachers by assisting students with special needs in academic, social, and life skills development. They work individually or in small groups to reinforce learning concepts and help students master assignments. A key responsibility involves implementing therapeutic regimens and behavior modification techniques under supervision. They also monitor student progress, record relevant data, and ensure students adhere to school policies and rules. This role requires instructing students on the use of equipment, preparing classrooms with learning materials, and supervising students in various settings, including field trips. They facilitate social and recreational activities, assist students with assistive devices, and promote the development of sensory-motor, language, cognitive, and memory skills through specialized strategies.

ONET description:
Assist a preschool, elementary, middle, or secondary school teacher to provide academic, social, or life skills to students who have learning, emotional, or physical disabilities. Serve in a position for which a teacher has primary responsibility for the design and implementation of educational programs and services.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role support instructional staff by creating and preparing teaching resources, including syllabi, visual aids, and supplementary notes. They also manage and organize course materials for distribution to students. A significant part of their day involves assessing student work by grading examinations, assignments, and papers, and maintaining accurate records of these evaluations. They lead discussion or laboratory sessions, and provide tutoring or mentorship to students requiring extra assistance. Additionally, they communicate with instructors to report any issues with assignments and meet with supervisors to discuss student progress and administrative tasks. They also prepare and administer examinations, and maintain regular availability to meet with students.

ONET description:
Assist faculty or other instructional staff in postsecondary institutions by performing instructional support activities, such as developing teaching materials, leading discussion groups, preparing and giving examinations, and grading examinations or papers.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role formulate visual concepts and approaches for various media. They confer with clients to understand project objectives, budget, and desired styles. Based on these discussions, they define design elements, specifying details like typography, graphics, and multimedia components. These professionals often lead teams, directing workers engaged in artwork and layout design. They coordinate with different departments to align creative activities and ensure project goals are met. Additionally, they review and approve developed materials, ensuring they adhere to established standards and specifications. They also manage project timelines and resources, and may attend production sessions to oversee the creation of visual elements.

ONET description:
Formulate design concepts and presentation approaches for visual productions and media, such as print, broadcasting, video, and film. Direct workers engaged in artwork or layout design.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role conceptualize and design unique handmade items, sketching initial ideas and creating prototypes. They meticulously select materials, considering properties like strength, texture, and weight, before shaping and joining them using various tools and techniques to form functional or decorative objects. This involves precisely cutting, molding, and fitting components according to established specifications. They often apply finishing touches to enhance the final product. Additionally, they may engage with customers to understand their needs, develop marketing strategies including pricing and display, and manage the logistics of advertising, packing, and exhibiting their creations.

ONET description:
Create or reproduce handmade objects for sale and exhibition using a variety of techniques, such as welding, weaving, pottery, and needlecraft.

Element Name: Fine Artists, Including Painters, Sculptors, and Illustrators
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role conceptualize and produce original works using a variety of media and methods. They integrate visual elements like line, color, and perspective to convey ideas, emotions, or moods, often employing tools such as pens, ink, watercolors, or digital software. A significant part of their work involves collaborating with clients and stakeholders to understand project requirements and ensure the final artwork meets expectations. They continuously develop their skills by studying new techniques and staying informed about artistic trends and activities through research and exposure to exhibitions and publications. Maintaining and marketing their portfolio is also crucial for showcasing their abilities and engaging with potential patrons.

ONET description:
Create original artwork using any of a wide variety of media and techniques.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Use materials such as pens and ink, watercolors, charcoal, oil, or computer software to create artwork.'}, {'Task': 'Integrate and develop visual elements, such as line, space, mass, color, and perspective, to produce desired effects, such as the illustration of ideas, emotions, or moods.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with clients, editors, writers, art directors, and other interested parties regarding the nature and content of artwork to be produced.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain portfolios of artistic work to demonstrate styles, interests, and abilities.'}, {'Task': 'Market artwork through brochures, mailings, or Web sites.'}, {'Task': 'Study different techniques to learn how to apply them to artistic endeavors.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor events, trends, and other circumstances, research specific subject areas, attend art exhibitions, and read art publications to develop ideas and keep current on art world activities.'}, {'Task': 'Photograph objects, places, or scenes for reference material.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously craft visual effects and animations by employing a range of digital tools and media. They conceptualize and build two-dimensional and three-dimensional imagery, often simulating motion or illustrating processes. A key part of their work involves making objects and characters appear realistic, which they achieve by carefully manipulating elements like light, color, texture, and shadow. They translate creative visions into dynamic visual sequences, often by creating storyboards that outline key scenes and character movements. This process requires strong critical thinking, complex problem-solving abilities, and a keen eye for detail to ensure the final product meets aesthetic and technical requirements. Judgement and decision making are critical throughout the development process.

ONET description:
Create special effects or animations using film, video, computers, or other electronic tools and media for use in products, such as computer games, movies, music videos, and commercials.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Design complex graphics and animation, using independent judgment, creativity, and computer equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Create basic designs, drawings, and illustrations for product labels, cartons, direct mail, or television.'}, {'Task': 'Participate in design and production of multimedia campaigns, handling budgeting and scheduling, and assisting with such responsibilities as production coordination, background design, and progress tracking.'}, {'Task': 'Create two-dimensional and three-dimensional images depicting objects in motion or illustrating a process, using computer animation or modeling programs.'}, {'Task': 'Make objects or characters appear lifelike by manipulating light, color, texture, shadow, and transparency, or manipulating static images to give the illusion of motion.'}, {'Task': 'Apply story development, directing, cinematography, and editing to animation to create storyboards that show the flow of the animation and map out key scenes and characters.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this field translate concepts into tangible products by developing and refining designs. They meticulously create visual representations, from initial sketches to detailed blueprints, utilizing various tools. A key aspect involves collaborating with diverse teams and clients to understand requirements, assess feasibility, and ensure designs meet specifications, budget constraints, and market demands. They research materials, production methods, and industry trends to inform their creative process. Furthermore, they evaluate designs for functionality, safety, and market appeal, often fabricating prototypes to test and demonstrate their ideas. They also monitor manufacturing processes to ensure quality and efficiency, contributing to continuous improvement and new product development.

ONET description:
Design and develop manufactured products, such as cars, home appliances, and children's toys. Combine artistic talent with research on product use, marketing, and materials to create the most functional and appealing product design.

Tasks:

Generated description:
Individuals in this role conceptualize and create original designs for clothing and accessories, often drawing inspiration from current trends. They translate these ideas into detailed sketches and written specifications, outlining colors, materials, and construction methods. A key part of their day involves evaluating prototypes, making adjustments to refine the aesthetic and fit. They collaborate with various stakeholders, including sales teams, management, and clients, to present and discuss design concepts. Selecting appropriate materials and production methods is crucial. They also stay informed about market preferences and emerging styles by attending events and reviewing publications. In some instances, they may guide production staff in creating samples and finished items.

They select and combine various natural and artificial materials to create custom designs or follow established patterns. Generated description:
Professionals in this field collaborate closely with clients to understand their needs, preferences, and project constraints, including budget and intended use. They develop conceptual designs, often rendering them through drawings or digital models, and present these proposals for approval. Responsibilities include selecting and coordinating materials, furnishings, and accessories, and ensuring that designs comply with relevant safety and accessibility standards. This involves detailed review of construction documents and on-site inspections.

Individuals in this role interpret and portray characters in various performance settings, bringing them to life through speech, gesture, and movement. They meticulously study scripts to understand characters, their motivations, and relationships, rehearsing lines and actions diligently. These professionals attend auditions to secure opportunities and often engage in promotional activities to support their productions. Their work aims to entertain, inform, or instruct audiences through creative and expressive performances.

They also manage budgets, schedules, and personnel, ensuring smooth workflow and adherence to quality standards. This involves problem-solving, making crucial judgments, and fostering collaboration among diverse contributors to bring productions to fruition according to established objectives and time constraints.

ONET description:

Generated description:
This role involves directing and coordinating the activities of teams engaged in creating broadcast content. Key responsibilities include planning and scheduling programming based on factors like audience data and broadcast time, and ensuring adherence to guidelines and quality standards. This position requires monitoring transmissions for schedule changes and overseeing the preparation and editing of broadcast material. Developing promotions, evaluating existing content for suitability, and managing personnel through hiring, performance evaluation, and work assignment are also critical functions. Collaboration with other departments, staff, and production teams is essential for addressing production, policy, or content-related issues. Additionally, this role may involve selecting and acquiring broadcast materials and obtaining necessary legal clearances.

ONET description:
Direct and coordinate activities of personnel engaged in preparation of radio or television station program schedules and programs, such as sports or news.

Their responsibilities extend to negotiating contracts and communicating audition opportunities, while also maintaining comprehensive records of performers' skills and availability for future projects.

Individuals in this role oversee the technical aspects of program production, ensuring smooth operations and adherence to quality standards. They manage and direct technical staff, assigning duties and providing training on equipment operation and maintenance. A key responsibility involves monitoring ongoing productions and broadcasts to verify compliance with policies and regulations, making adjustments as needed. They coordinate activities across different technical departments, acting as a crucial link between engineering and production teams. This includes scheduling the use of studio and editing facilities. They also collaborate with other departments to create promotional content and establish technical guidelines for programs. Decision-making often involves complex problem-solving related to equipment and operations.

Coordinate activities of technical departments, such as taping, editing, engineering, and maintenance, to produce radio or television programs.

They demonstrate methods, provide encouragement, and offer advice to enhance performance and prepare individuals or groups for events. Element Name: Umpires, Referees, and Other Sports Officials
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role ensure fair play by observing and enforcing the rules during athletic competitions. They meticulously monitor gameplay, identify any rule violations, and make decisive judgments regarding penalties or corrective actions. This involves clear communication, often through signals, to participants and fellow officials. They may also inspect venues and equipment to confirm adherence to established standards and safety protocols. A key aspect of the role includes resolving disputes or complaints, explaining regulations, and documenting events and decisions for relevant authorities. Collaboration with other officials, participants, and managers is essential for coordinating activities and addressing challenges effectively.

ONET description:
Officiate at competitive athletic or sporting events. Detect infractions of rules and decide penalties according to established regulations. Includes all sporting officials, referees, and competition judges.

Tasks:

Element Name: Broadcast Announcers and Radio Disc Jockeys
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for delivering information and entertainment through spoken word. They read from scripts or ad-lib to present news, commercials, or program details. A significant part of their day involves selecting and cueing musical content, identifying artists, and interacting with listeners through requests or interviews. They prepare for broadcasts by studying background material and may rewrite information to fit specific time slots. This work requires strong speaking and listening skills, along with the ability to manage time effectively and operate control consoles. They also conduct interviews, host events, and make promotional appearances, requiring critical thinking and social perceptiveness to engage audiences and represent their employers.

ONET description:
Speak or read from scripted materials, such as news reports or commercial messages, on radio, television, or other communications media. May play and queue music, announce artist or title of performance, identify station, or interview guests.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role gather and analyze information from various sources, including interviews, observations, and research, to investigate breaking news and develop compelling stories. They determine the most pertinent details, organize them into appropriate formats, and write or narrate news stories, reviews, or commentary for different communication mediums. This involves researching backgrounds, arranging interviews, and establishing relationships with credible sources. They may also revise their work to meet editorial standards or adjust for time and space constraints. Furthermore, they present news, introduce segments, and often interact with editors to prioritize topics or discuss positions on issues, ensuring accuracy and clarity in their final reports.

ONET description:
Narrate or write news stories, reviews, or commentary for print, broadcast, or other communications media such as newspapers, magazines, radio, or television. May collect and analyze information through interview, investigation, or observation.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field are responsible for the technical aspects of transmitting audio and video content. They set up, operate, and maintain electronic equipment essential for capturing, editing, and broadcasting programs. This involves closely monitoring incoming and outgoing signals, making precise adjustments to volume, strength, and clarity to ensure high-quality transmissions. They also manage the operation of transmission equipment, controlling the flow of broadcasts. Additionally, they perform routine maintenance, troubleshoot and repair equipment issues, and maintain detailed logs of operations and readings. Their work includes previewing content to confirm functionality before transmission and sometimes substituting programming when signal failures occur, ensuring continuous broadcasts.

ONET description:
Set up, operate, and maintain the electronic equipment used to acquire, edit, and transmit audio and video for radio or television programs. Control and adjust incoming and outgoing broadcast signals to regulate sound volume, signal strength, and signal clarity. Operate satellite, microwave, or other transmitter equipment to broadcast radio or television programs.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role assemble and operate equipment to capture, refine, and reproduce audio. They collaborate with creative teams to understand and achieve the desired sound for various projects, ensuring optimal clarity and balance. Day-to-day activities involve setting up and testing audio equipment, meticulously recording speech, music, and sound effects, and actively monitoring and adjusting volume levels and sound quality during sessions. They skillfully blend and edit separate audio elements, synchronize sound with visual content, and troubleshoot any technical issues that arise. Their responsibilities extend to maintaining equipment, preparing recording spaces, and managing recordings through editing, mixing, and final duplication processes.

ONET description:
Assemble and operate equipment to record, synchronize, mix, edit, or reproduce sound, including music, voices, or sound effects, for theater, video, film, television, podcasts, sporting events, and other productions.

Element Name: Camera Operators, Television, Video, and Film
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this role operate specialized cameras to capture visual content for various productions. They collaborate closely with directors and technical crew, discussing assignments, desired visual effects, and lighting needs to achieve specific artistic visions. Day-to-day activities involve setting up and adjusting camera positions and controls, including focus, exposure, and lighting, to frame shots effectively. They meticulously compose each scene, considering technical elements like lenses and settings to produce desired outcomes. Additionally, they monitor equipment for optimal performance, conducting tests and performing maintenance to ensure readiness for recording, whether for live broadcasts or pre-recorded segments. Problem-solving and adaptability are crucial for addressing on-site challenges and ensuring smooth operation throughout the recording process.

ONET description:
Operate television, video, or film camera to record images or scenes for television, video, or film productions.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Compose and frame each shot, applying the technical aspects of light, lenses, film, filters, and camera settings to achieve the effects sought by directors.'}, {'Task': 'Operate television or motion picture cameras to record scenes for television broadcasts, advertising, or motion pictures.'}, {'Task': 'Adjust positions and controls of cameras, printers, and related equipment to change focus, exposure, and lighting.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with directors, sound and lighting technicians, electricians, and other crew members to discuss assignments and determine filming sequences, desired effects, camera movements, and lighting requirements.'}, {'Task': 'Operate zoom lenses, changing images according to specifications and rehearsal instructions.'}, {'Task': 'Observe sets or locations for potential problems and to determine filming and lighting requirements.'}, {'Task': 'Set up and perform live shots for broadcast.'}, {'Task': 'Use cameras in any of several different camera mounts, such as stationary, track-mounted, or crane-mounted.'}, {'Task': 'Test, clean, maintain, and repair broadcast equipment, including testing microphones, to ensure proper working condition.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role review and assemble raw footage into a cohesive narrative. They meticulously select and arrange shots, ensuring smooth transitions and logical sequencing to tell a story effectively. This involves trimming segments, inserting audio elements like music and dialogue, and correcting errors. They operate specialized equipment to manipulate plot, score, sound, and graphics, often collaborating with other creative personnel. Additionally, they study scripts to understand project requirements and may oversee the work of others involved in the editing process. Their day-to-day activities focus on creative decision-making, technical execution, and ensuring the final product meets production standards.

ONET description:
Edit moving images on film, video, or other media. May work with a producer or director to organize images for final production. May edit or synchronize soundtracks with images.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field engage in patient care by assessing and treating the musculoskeletal system, primarily through manual adjustments of the spine and other body articulations. They diagnose health issues by carefully reviewing patient histories, conducting examinations, and interpreting diagnostic images like x-rays to identify problems and rule out other conditions. These practitioners maintain detailed patient records, advise on recommended treatment plans, and counsel individuals on lifestyle factors such as nutrition, exercise, and stress management to support overall well-being. They also collaborate with other health providers, referring patients when necessary, and may recommend supportive devices or further diagnostic procedures to ensure comprehensive care.

ONET description:
Assess, treat, and care for patients by manipulation of spine and musculoskeletal system. May provide spinal adjustment or address sacral or pelvic misalignment.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role conduct thorough examinations of teeth, gums, and surrounding oral tissues using various diagnostic tools, including imaging. They analyze findings to identify diseases, injuries, or abnormalities and formulate comprehensive treatment plans. Procedures involve administering local anesthetics, performing surgical interventions, filling cavities, treating nerve and pulp issues, and applying preventive measures like fluoride. They also design, fit, or fabricate dental prosthetics and provide detailed instructions to patients on maintaining oral hygiene and preventing dental problems. Additionally, they manage administrative tasks, potentially including staff supervision and processing of claims, and may contribute to broader dental health initiatives and educational material development.

ONET description:
Examine, diagnose, and treat diseases, injuries, and malformations of teeth and gums. May treat diseases of nerve, pulp, and other dental tissues affecting oral hygiene and retention of teeth. May fit dental appliances or provide preventive care.

Generated description:
These professionals assess conditions affecting the hard and soft tissues of the face and mouth, diagnosing problems and developing treatment plans. They collaborate with other healthcare providers to ensure comprehensive care. A significant part of their day involves performing complex surgical procedures to address diseases, injuries, or defects. This can include removing impacted teeth, treating infections, or reconstructing facial and jaw structures. They also administer anesthetics and manage post-operative recovery. Decisions are often complex, requiring critical thinking and expert judgment to restore function and improve appearance, while also providing emergency treatment for facial trauma and managing conditions of the oral cavity.

ONET description:
Perform surgery and related procedures on the hard and soft tissues of the oral and maxillofacial regions to treat diseases, injuries, or defects. May diagnose problems of the oral and maxillofacial regions. May perform surgery to improve function or appearance.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field examine individuals to identify and diagnose abnormalities in jaw development and tooth alignment. They meticulously review patient records, including dental histories, models, photographs, and X-rays, to formulate comprehensive treatment plans. These plans often involve designing and fabricating specialized appliances to correct misalignments and restore proper function. They then fit and adjust these appliances within patients' mouths, ensuring optimal positioning and relationship of teeth and jaws. Communication is key as they explain proposed treatments, provide cost estimates, and guide patients on adherence to their plans. They also coordinate care with other healthcare providers and may instruct support staff on orthodontic procedures.

ONET description:
Examine, diagnose, and treat dental malocclusions and oral cavity anomalies. Design and fabricate appliances to realign teeth and jaws to produce and maintain normal function and to improve appearance.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role assess patients to identify oral health issues and diseases. They design, fabricate, and fit artificial replacements for missing teeth and oral tissues to restore function, health, and appearance. This involves taking detailed measurements and impressions of patients' mouths to create custom-fitted devices. They collaborate with other healthcare providers to address complex oral health concerns and work with individuals requiring rehabilitation due to injury, disease, or congenital conditions. Adjustments and modifications are made to ensure proper fit and comfort, and they may also perform repairs on existing devices. Additionally, they utilize various techniques to improve the aesthetics of teeth, such as bonding and bleaching.

ONET description:
Diagnose, treat, rehabilitate, design, and fit prostheses that maintain oral function, health, and appearance for patients with clinical conditions associated with teeth, oral and maxillofacial tissues, or the jaw.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field assess individual health needs and existing dietary plans to develop and implement personalized nutrition strategies. They evaluate medical data to inform recommendations and counsel individuals and groups on healthy eating habits to enhance overall well-being. These professionals collaborate with healthcare providers to understand specific client requirements and restrictions. They consider cultural backgrounds when designing meal plans, often creating specialized recipes and menus. Furthermore, they may conduct research, document findings, and develop educational materials and training programs on nutrition and health for various audiences, ensuring comprehensive dissemination of knowledge and adherence to nutritional guidance.

ONET description:
Plan and conduct food service or nutritional programs to assist in the promotion of health and control of disease. May supervise activities of a department providing quantity food services, counsel individuals, or conduct nutritional research.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously examine the eyes and visual system to identify and diagnose impairments, diseases, and abnormalities. They analyze findings from tests and observations to formulate comprehensive treatment plans, which may include prescribing corrective lenses and other vision aids. When permitted, they also prescribe medications to address specific eye conditions. These professionals remove foreign objects from eyes, provide pre- and post-operative care for patients undergoing eye surgeries, and educate individuals on crucial aspects of visual hygiene and safety. They also offer specialized vision therapy and rehabilitation services, consulting with other healthcare providers when necessary for more complex medical needs.

ONET description:
Diagnose, manage, and treat conditions and diseases of the human eye and visual system. Examine eyes and visual system, diagnose problems or impairments, prescribe corrective lenses, and provide treatment. May prescribe therapeutic drugs to treat specific eye conditions.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously review and dispense prescribed medications, ensuring accuracy and identifying necessary components. They carefully assess the identity, strength, and purity of drugs. A key responsibility involves providing patients with comprehensive information on medication usage, potential interactions, side effects, and proper storage. They also collaborate with other healthcare providers to monitor and evaluate drug effectiveness and offer expert advice on medication selection and application. This role includes managing medication inventories, ordering supplies, and maintaining detailed records, adhering strictly to legal and quality requirements. Furthermore, they may guide individuals in managing specific health conditions and advise on product selection, always prioritizing patient safety and optimal treatment outcomes.

ONET description:
Dispense drugs prescribed by physicians and other health practitioners and provide information to patients about medications and their use. May advise physicians and other health practitioners on the selection, dosage, interactions, and side effects of medications.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role gather and record comprehensive patient health histories, conduct thorough physical examinations, and interpret diagnostic test results. They collaborate with supervising physicians to develop treatment plans, making tentative diagnoses and prescribing appropriate therapies or medications. This involves performing therapeutic procedures like wound care and administering treatments. They also instruct and counsel patients on health maintenance and prescribed regimens, manage patient records, and order necessary medical supplies. Additionally, they may assist during complex procedures, supervise technical staff, and conduct patient rounds, ensuring continuity of care and reporting findings.

ONET description:
Provide healthcare services typically performed by a physician, under the supervision of a physician. Conduct complete physicals, provide treatment, and counsel patients. May, in some cases, prescribe medication. Must graduate from an accredited educational program for physician assistants.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role collaborate with physicians to administer treatments before, during, and after procedures. They meticulously prepare and calibrate essential equipment and verify that all necessary supplies, medications, and gases are readily available. Throughout a patient's treatment, they actively monitor vital signs and physiological responses, making critical judgments and decisions to ensure patient well-being. In emergency scenarios, they immediately implement life-support interventions, including advanced resuscitation techniques. They also engage in continuous learning through professional development activities to stay current with advancements in their field, ensuring the highest quality of care.

ONET description:
Assist anesthesiologists in the administration of anesthesia for surgical and non-surgical procedures. Monitor patient status and provide patient care during surgical treatment.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role diagnose and treat a variety of conditions affecting the feet and ankles. They conduct physical examinations, review medical histories, and interpret diagnostic test results to identify issues. Based on these assessments, they develop treatment plans which may include prescribing medications, fitting prosthetic devices, recommending physical therapy, or performing surgical procedures. A key aspect of this role involves educating patients on proper foot care and preventative techniques to avoid future complications. They also monitor for signs of broader systemic health issues and refer individuals to other medical professionals when necessary. Some administrative duties, such as record-keeping and resource management, are also part of the daily workflow.

ONET description:
Diagnose and treat diseases and deformities of the human foot.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role assess and evaluate patients' physical and mental capabilities to establish rehabilitation objectives. They plan, organize, and lead therapy programs designed to help individuals regain or develop vocational, homemaking, and daily living skills, fostering independence. This involves selecting and adapting therapeutic activities, modifying environments, and teaching necessary skills to overcome limitations. They monitor patient progress, document findings, and communicate with rehabilitation teams and caregivers to coordinate care. Additionally, they may develop adaptive tools, conduct health promotion activities, and provide training to other medical staff and students. Their work focuses on empowering individuals to manage their conditions and improve their quality of life.

ONET description:
Assess, plan, and organize rehabilitative programs that help build or restore vocational, homemaking, and daily living skills, as well as general independence, to persons with disabilities or developmental delays. Use therapeutic techniques, adapt the individual's environment, teach skills, and modify specific tasks that present barriers to the individual.

Element Name: Low Vision Therapists, Orientation and Mobility Specialists, and Vision Rehabilitation Therapists
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this field assess individuals with visual impairments to understand their functional capabilities and personal objectives. They develop tailored rehabilitation and instructional plans, often in collaboration with the individuals and other specialists. A significant part of their role involves teaching a wide range of skills, including independent travel techniques, the use of various mobility and adaptive devices, communication strategies, and essential daily living activities like self-care and home management. They also instruct individuals on how to utilize sensory information for navigation and daily tasks. Throughout the process, they monitor progress, adjust plans as needed, provide support and education to relevant groups, and maintain thorough documentation of assessments and outcomes.

ONET description:
Provide therapy to patients with visual impairments to improve their functioning in daily life activities. May train patients in activities such as computer use, communication skills, or home management skills.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Teach cane skills, including cane use with a guide, diagonal techniques, and two-point touches.'}, {'Task': 'Recommend appropriate mobility devices or systems, such as human guides, dog guides, long canes, electronic travel aids (ETAs), and other adaptive mobility devices (AMDs).'}, {'Task': 'Train clients with visual impairments to use mobility devices or systems, such as human guides, dog guides, electronic travel aids (ETAs), and other adaptive mobility devices (AMDs).'}, {'Task': 'Develop rehabilitation or instructional plans collaboratively with clients, based on results of assessments, needs, and goals.'}, {'Task': 'Write reports or complete forms to document assessments, training, progress, or follow-up outcomes.'}, {'Task': 'Train clients to use tactile, auditory, kinesthetic, olfactory, and proprioceptive information.'}, {'Task': 'Assess clients\' functioning in areas such as vision, orientation and mobility skills, social and emotional issues, cognition, physical abilities, and personal goals.'}, {'Task': 'Teach clients to travel independently, using a variety of actual or simulated travel situations or exercises.'}, {'Task': 'Teach self-advocacy skills to clients.'}, {'Task': 'Provide consultation, support, or education to groups such as parents and teachers.'}, {'Task': 'Teach independent living skills or techniques, such as adaptive eating, medication management, diabetes management, and personal management.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor clients\' progress to determine whether changes in rehabilitation plans are needed.'}, {'Task': 'Identify visual impairments related to basic life skills in areas such as self care, literacy, communication, health management, home management, and meal preparation.'}, {'Task': 'Design instructional programs to improve communication, using devices such as slates and styluses, braillers, keyboards, adaptive handwriting devices, talking book machines, digital books, and optical character readers (OCRs).'}, {'Task': 'Train clients to use adaptive equipment, such as large print, reading stands, lamps, writing implements, software, and electronic devices.'}, {'Task': 'Participate in professional development activities, such as reading literature, continuing education, attending conferences, and collaborating with colleagues.'}, {'Task': 'Obtain, distribute, or maintain low vision devices.'}, {'Task': 'Collaborate with specialists, such as rehabilitation counselors, speech pathologists, and occupational therapists, to provide client solutions.'}, {'Task': 'Refer clients to services, such as eye care, health care, rehabilitation, and counseling, to enhance visual and life functioning or when condition exceeds scope of practice.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this field assess individuals to understand their physical condition and identify limitations or areas for improvement. They develop and implement individualized treatment plans focused on enhancing mobility, reducing pain, and restoring function. This involves administering various therapeutic exercises, manual techniques, and the application of specific physical agents. They continuously monitor patient progress, adjusting interventions as needed to achieve optimal outcomes. Collaboration is key, as they confer with patients, other healthcare providers, and sometimes families to coordinate care and ensure the continuation of beneficial practices. They also document all assessments, treatment progress, and outcomes, and provide education on self-care and injury prevention.

ONET description:
Assess, plan, organize, and participate in rehabilitative programs that improve mobility, relieve pain, increase strength, and improve or correct disabling conditions resulting from disease or injury.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role administer prescribed doses of radiation to patients, following specific treatment plans and safety protocols. They meticulously review patient diagnoses and prescriptions, ensuring accurate patient identification before each session. A key part of their day involves preparing and operating specialized equipment, including setting controls and adjusting settings to regulate radiation dosage. They also create and utilize immobilization and protection devices tailored to each patient's needs. Throughout treatment, they monitor patients, provide reassurance, and report any unusual reactions to physicians. These professionals maintain detailed records of dosages, equipment settings, and patient responses, and often serve as a crucial link between physicians, physicists, and other support staff, while also educating patients and their families about the process and care.

ONET description:
Provide radiation therapy to patients as prescribed by a radiation oncologist according to established practices and standards. Duties may include reviewing prescription and diagnosis; acting as liaison with physician and supportive care personnel; preparing equipment, such as immobilization, treatment, and protection devices; and maintaining records, reports, and files. May assist in dosimetry procedures and tumor localization.

They instruct participants on techniques, monitor their progress and reactions, and adjust treatment plans as necessary. These professionals collaborate with a treatment team, documenting observations and preparing reports. They also counsel and encourage individuals to engage in therapeutic leisure activities, foster new skill development, and prepare discharge plans to support ongoing recovery and community integration.

ONET description:
Plan, direct, or coordinate medically-approved recreation programs for patients in hospitals, nursing homes, or other institutions. Activities include sports, trips, dramatics, social activities, and crafts. May assess a patient condition and recommend appropriate recreational activity.

Professionals in this field examine animals to diagnose diseases and injuries, often collecting samples for analysis and interpreting diagnostic imaging. They develop and administer treatments, which may include prescribing medications, performing surgical procedures, or inoculating against illnesses. They also handle sensitive situations, such as discussing euthanasia or animal deaths, and educate people about zoonotic diseases. Continuous learning is essential to stay updated on medical advancements. They meticulously monitor fetal development, document comprehensive patient histories and physical examination findings, and develop individualized health care management plans. These professionals order and interpret diagnostic tests, prescribe medications within regulatory limits, and initiate emergency interventions when necessary. They also educate patients and their families about various aspects of care and family planning, explaining procedures clearly. Collaboration is key, as they consult or refer patients to specialists when needed, and they contribute to establishing practice guidelines and conducting research to advance care standards.

They administer tests using specialized instruments to determine the nature and degree of impairment, and maintain detailed patient records. A key responsibility involves planning and executing treatment programs, which may include fitting, dispensing, and repairing assistive devices. Collaboration with other healthcare professionals is frequent to ensure comprehensive care. Additionally, some individuals may conduct research, develop screening programs, or educate students and the public on related topics.

They administer various forms of pain relief, carefully monitoring patients' vital signs and overall condition throughout the process. They collaborate with other medical professionals to plan and coordinate care, ensuring patient comfort and accessibility for surgical teams. After procedures, they evaluate patients' recovery status and make decisions regarding their subsequent care or discharge. They also maintain detailed records of administered substances and patient responses.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field examine microscopic samples, organs, and bodily fluids to diagnose diseases and understand medical conditions. They perform complex laboratory tests, analyze results, and interpret findings to identify the causes and significance of various ailments. These experts document their findings by writing detailed reports summarizing analyses and conclusions. They collaborate closely with other medical professionals, communicating critical results and offering insights into treatments and disease progression. Additionally, they may perform autopsies to determine the cause of death and engage in ongoing learning to stay updated on medical advancements. They also supervise laboratory operations and staff, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in diagnostic processes.

ONET description:
Diagnose diseases and conduct lab tests using organs, body tissues, and fluids. Includes medical examiners.

Individuals in this role conduct thorough examinations to diagnose and treat a wide range of eye conditions, injuries, and diseases affecting various eye structures. They develop personalized treatment plans, often involving medications or surgical procedures, to address patient needs and goals. This includes performing complex surgeries and laser procedures to correct vision or manage disorders. They also provide essential postoperative care and prescribe corrective lenses or other therapeutic treatments. In addition to direct patient care, they consult with other professionals, educate patients on vision health, and maintain detailed medical records. When necessary, they refer patients to specialists for conditions beyond their scope of practice, ensuring comprehensive care coordination.

Diagnose and perform surgery to treat and help prevent disorders and diseases of the eye. May also provide vision services for treatment including glasses and contacts.

Professionals in this field evaluate and diagnose visual system disorders, focusing on issues with eye movement and binocular vision. They perform various diagnostic tests to assess visual acuity, motility, and other functions, interpreting the results to develop nonsurgical treatment plans. These plans may include interventions like corrective lenses, vision exercises, or other therapeutic approaches. They provide clear instructions and explanations to patients and their families regarding diagnoses and treatment strategies. Collaboration is key, as they work with other specialists to manage conditions and often assist in diagnostic procedures. Additionally, they may conduct screenings, train others in clinical methods, and participate in research.

Diagnose and treat visual system disorders such as binocular vision and eye movement impairments.

They meticulously analyze bodily fluids, such as blood and urine, for specific chemical contents and cellular components, often utilizing microscopic techniques. These professionals communicate complex technical information regarding test results to healthcare providers and may guide or train other laboratory personnel. Their work is essential for accurate medical decision-making.

Individuals in this role meticulously examine biological specimens to analyze chromosomes, identifying structural abnormalities. They prepare specimens for examination, conduct various technical analyses, and stain slides to make chromosomes visible. Using microscopes and imaging systems, they count chromosomes, detect anomalies, and document findings. They also manage quality control, maintain equipment, and select appropriate culturing and analysis methods. Their work involves carefully inputting specimen and analysis details into laboratory systems, summarizing test results, and reporting them. They may also communicate issues with specimens and suggest remediation, while adhering to strict laboratory practices and potentially supervising staff or developing training programs.

ONET description:
Analyze chromosomes or chromosome segments found in biological specimens, such as amniotic fluids, bone marrow, solid tumors, and blood to aid in the study, diagnosis, classification, or treatment of inherited or acquired genetic diseases. Conduct analyses through classical cytogenetic, fluorescent in situ hybridization (FISH) or array comparative genome hybridization (aCGH) techniques.

Prepare, administer, and measure radioactive isotopes in therapeutic, diagnostic, and tracer studies using a variety of radioisotope equipment. Prepare stock solutions of radioactive materials and calculate doses to be administered by radiologists. Subject patients to radiation. Individuals in this role operate specialized equipment to capture diagnostic images. They carefully position patients and adjust equipment to obtain precise views, explaining procedures and ensuring patient comfort and safety throughout. They meticulously review captured images, redoing any that do not meet quality standards. They maintain detailed patient records, prepare imaging equipment, and may assist physicians with more complex examinations. Additionally, they troubleshoot equipment issues and ensure all procedures comply with established guidelines, contributing to accurate diagnoses through their technical skills and patient care.

Take x-rays and CAT scans or administer nonradioactive materials into patient's bloodstream for diagnostic or research purposes. Includes radiologic technologists and technicians who specialize in other scanning modalities.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role operate specialized imaging equipment to capture diagnostic images. They meticulously prepare patients for procedures by conducting interviews, explaining processes, and ensuring comfort and safety. This involves carefully positioning patients and attaching necessary monitoring devices. They operate complex machinery, calibrate controls, and test equipment to ensure optimal performance. Decision-making is crucial as they select appropriate imaging techniques and troubleshoot technical issues to maintain image quality. They may administer contrast agents and document all aspects of the examination, communicating findings and procedural details to other medical professionals. These individuals also manage supplies and may instruct others on equipment operation.

ONET description:
Operate Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scanners. Monitor patient safety and comfort, and view images of area being scanned to ensure quality of pictures. May administer gadolinium contrast dosage intravenously. May interview patient, explain MRI procedures, and position patient on examining table. May enter into the computer data such as patient history, anatomical area to be scanned, orientation specified, and position of entry.

Professionals in this role are responsible for creating detailed radiation treatment plans. They meticulously analyze imaging data to outline critical structures and determine the precise parameters for radiation delivery. This involves complex calculations to ensure prescribed doses are accurate and safe, minimizing exposure to healthy tissues. They design and, in some cases, fabricate specialized devices to aid in the precise application of radiation. Furthermore, they collaborate closely with oncology team members, providing expert consultation on the treatment strategies and the use of specific equipment. They also oversee the implementation of these plans, ensuring accuracy and documenting all procedures performed.

ONET description:
Generate radiation treatment plans, develop radiation dose calculations, communicate and supervise the treatment plan implementation, and consult with members of radiation oncology team.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role receive and verify prescription requests, ensuring all necessary information is complete and accurate. They accurately enter patient and prescription data into computer systems and maintain detailed patient profiles, including medication histories. These professionals are responsible for preparing medications by measuring, mixing, counting, and labeling according to physician orders. They also manage inventory, receiving and storing supplies, checking for outdated items, and notifying supervisors of stock needs. Additionally, they assist individuals by answering questions, locating items, and referring complex issues to a pharmacist. Maintaining a clean and organized work environment and ensuring proper storage and security of medications are key responsibilities.

ONET description:
Prepare medications under the direction of a pharmacist. May measure, mix, count out, label, and record amounts and dosages of medications according to prescription orders.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role provide direct care and support to individuals experiencing mental or emotional conditions. They closely monitor the physical and emotional state of patients, meticulously documenting and reporting any changes or concerns to healthcare professionals. Responsibilities include assisting patients with daily living activities, such as personal hygiene and maintaining clean living spaces. They actively engage patients in therapeutic activities, encouraging participation in rehabilitation and social programs designed to foster independence and improve interpersonal skills. This may involve leading therapy sessions, administering medications as directed, and employing various communication techniques to influence behavior and provide emotional support. They also collaborate with other practitioners to develop treatment plans and ensure patient progress.

ONET description:
Care for individuals with mental or emotional conditions or disabilities, following the instructions of physicians or other health practitioners. Monitor patients' physical and emotional well-being and report to medical staff. May participate in rehabilitation and treatment programs, help with personal hygiene, and administer oral or injectable medications.

Generated description:
These professionals support surgical procedures by preparing the operating environment and assisting the surgical team. They meticulously maintain sterile conditions, manage and count surgical supplies, instruments, and equipment to ensure accuracy and safety. Their duties include setting up the operating room, preparing patients for surgery, and ensuring all necessary tools and materials are readily available. During operations, they provide direct technical assistance by handing instruments, holding retractors, and performing other tasks as directed. They also monitor equipment functionality and patient status, and are responsible for post-operative tasks such as preparing dressings and cleaning the operating area for subsequent use.

ONET description:
Assist in operations, under the supervision of surgeons, registered nurses, or other surgical personnel. May help set up operating room, prepare and transport patients for surgery, adjust lights and equipment, pass instruments and other supplies to surgeons and surgeons' assistants, hold retractors, cut sutures, and help count sponges, needles, supplies, and instruments.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role perform a variety of essential tasks focused on animal health and well-being. They conduct laboratory tests using collected samples to aid in diagnosis and treatment, and prepare and administer medications and treatments as directed. They also assist with surgical procedures, monitor animals during recovery, and provide critical care, including administering anesthesia and performing emergency procedures. Maintaining sterile instruments and equipment, managing inventories of medical supplies, and preparing animals for various treatments are also key responsibilities. Additionally, they may interact with clients to discuss an animal's condition and provide guidance on care, ensuring accurate record-keeping and maintaining a clean and safe environment.

ONET description:
Perform medical tests in a laboratory environment for use in the treatment and diagnosis of diseases in animals. Prepare vaccines and serums for prevention of diseases. Prepare tissue samples, take blood samples, and execute laboratory tests, such as urinalysis and blood counts. Clean and sterilize instruments and materials and maintain equipment and machines. May assist a veterinarian during surgery.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role assist medical professionals by performing various clinical examinations and tests related to eye health. They meticulously document patient medical histories and conduct a range of assessments, including measuring visual acuity, intraocular pressure, and ocular motility. They operate specialized equipment to gather anatomical and functional measurements of the eye and surrounding tissues, and assess refractive conditions. Additionally, they administer prescribed medications, sterilize instruments, and maintain equipment. They also provide patient instruction on the care and use of corrective lenses and follow up with patients regarding their recovery. Their work involves precise data collection and direct patient interaction to support diagnostic and treatment processes.

ONET description:
Assist ophthalmologists by performing ophthalmic clinical functions. May administer eye exams, administer eye medications, and instruct the patient in care and use of corrective lenses.

Element Name: Licensed Practical and Licensed Vocational Nurses
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role provide essential direct care to patients experiencing illness, injury, or disability. A significant part of their day involves closely monitoring patients' conditions, meticulously recording vital signs, and documenting any changes or adverse reactions. They administer prescribed medications and fluids, assist with daily living activities like bathing and dressing, and perform various treatments. Collaboration is key, as they work with other healthcare professionals to assess patient needs, plan care, and evaluate the effectiveness of interventions. They also manage patient comfort, respond to calls, and maintain accurate records of intake, output, and treatments performed, often preparing patients for medical procedures and explanations.

ONET description:
Care for ill, injured, or convalescing patients or persons with disabilities in hospitals, nursing homes, clinics, private homes, group homes, and similar institutions. May work under the supervision of a registered nurse. Licensing required.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Observe patients, charting and reporting changes in patients\' conditions, such as adverse reactions to medication or treatment, and taking any necessary action.'}, {'Task': 'Measure and record patients\' vital signs, such as height, weight, temperature, blood pressure, pulse, or respiration.'}, {'Task': 'Administer prescribed medications or start intravenous fluids, noting times and amounts on patients\' charts.'}, {'Task': 'Provide basic patient care or treatments, such as taking temperatures or blood pressures, dressing wounds, treating bedsores, giving enemas or douches, rubbing with alcohol, massaging, or performing catheterizations.'}, {'Task': 'Answer patients\' calls and determine how to assist them.'}, {'Task': 'Supervise nurses\' aides or assistants.'}, {'Task': 'Evaluate nursing intervention outcomes, conferring with other healthcare team members as necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Work as part of a healthcare team to assess patient needs, plan and modify care, and implement interventions.'}, {'Task': 'Record food and fluid intake and output.'}, {'Task': 'Assemble and use equipment, such as catheters, tracheotomy tubes, or oxygen suppliers.'}, {'Task': 'Collect samples, such as blood, urine, or sputum from patients, and perform routine laboratory tests on samples.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare or examine food trays for conformance to prescribed diet.'}, {'Task': 'Help patients with bathing, dressing, maintaining personal hygiene, moving in bed, or standing and walking.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare patients for examinations, tests, or treatments and explain procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Apply compresses, ice bags, or hot water bottles.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this role engage directly with clients, utilizing optical prescriptions to design, measure, fit, and adapt eyewear. They meticulously take precise measurements of facial and eye features, coordinating these with prescription details to ensure optimal vision and comfort. This involves assisting clients in selecting frames that complement their features and style. They also provide guidance on the proper use and care of contact lenses and spectacles, and adjust finished eyewear for a perfect fit. Furthermore, they prepare detailed work orders for lens fabrication, verify the accuracy of completed eyewear, and manage client records, including prescriptions and payments. They may also be involved in merchandising and maintaining displays.

ONET description:
Design, measure, fit, and adapt lenses and frames for client according to written optical prescription or specification. Assist client with inserting, removing, and caring for contact lenses. Assist client with selecting frames. Measure customer for size of eyeglasses and coordinate frames with facial and eye measurements and optical prescription. Prepare work order for optical laboratory containing instructions for grinding and mounting lenses in frames. Verify exactness of finished lens spectacles. Adjust frame and lens position to fit client. May shape or reshape frames. Includes contact lens opticians.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field examine and interview individuals to understand their specific needs and factors influencing the fit of external devices. They then design and construct or modify orthopedic braces and prosthetic limbs or body parts based on medical prescriptions and patient measurements. Using selected materials and components, they fabricate these devices, often creating plaster casts to guide the construction. After fitting, testing, and evaluating the devices on patients, they make necessary adjustments for optimal fit, function, and comfort. They also provide instructions to patients on device usage and care, maintain detailed patient records, and may repair or rebuild existing appliances. Collaboration with medical professionals ensures accurate device specifications.

ONET description:
Design, measure, fit, and adapt orthopedic braces, appliances or prostheses, such as limbs or facial parts for patients with disabling conditions.
