Individuals in this role assess hearing capabilities by administering and interpreting various tests. They then select and fit appropriate devices to address hearing needs, ensuring optimal performance. This involves creating custom molds and modifying existing ones to fit precisely. They also explain how these devices function and provide guidance on effective communication strategies for individuals experiencing hearing loss and their families. Regular maintenance and repair of devices are also part of their duties to ensure continued functionality. Staying updated on advancements in the field through continuous learning and professional engagement is essential to provide the best possible care and solutions.

Select and fit hearing aids for customers. Administer and interpret tests of hearing. Assess hearing instrument efficacy. Take ear impressions and prepare, design, and modify ear molds.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role perform specialized tests to evaluate nervous system function. They prepare patients by explaining procedures, answering questions, and attaching electrodes to specific body locations. They operate and monitor diagnostic equipment, adjusting settings to capture accurate readings. These professionals collect and record physiological data, identifying and noting any artifacts or interferences that may affect the results. They manage and calibrate equipment, troubleshooting malfunctions as necessary. After completing tests, they compile and summarize technical data, submitting reports to physicians to aid in diagnosis. They may also assist in training others or participate in research initiatives.

Conduct electroneurodiagnostic (END) tests such as electroencephalograms, evoked potentials, polysomnograms, or electronystagmograms. May perform nerve conduction studies.

These professionals assist medical specialists by performing a variety of eye examinations and diagnostic tests to gather essential patient information. They meticulously measure visual acuity, intraocular pressure, and various ocular dimensions, utilizing specialized equipment to collect precise data. They also administer prescribed medications and assist in minor surgical procedures, ensuring sterile techniques are followed and instruments are prepared. Patient education is a key responsibility, covering eye conditions, treatment plans, and the proper use of corrective lenses or medications. Additionally, they document patient histories, photograph eye conditions for records, and may guide or train other support personnel. They also follow up with patients to monitor their recovery.

Assist with minor surgical procedures, applying aseptic techniques and preparing instruments. May perform eye exams, administer eye medications, and instruct patients in care and use of corrective lenses.

Professionals in this role analyze individual and family medical histories to assess the risk of inherited conditions. They interpret complex laboratory results and communicate findings clearly to patients and other healthcare providers. A key responsibility involves discussing testing options, including their associated risks and benefits, to empower informed decision-making. These professionals provide crucial emotional and psychological support, addressing concerns related to potential diagnoses and their implications. They also document consultations, develop educational materials, and may contribute to research initiatives by collecting data or designing studies. Staying current with advancements in the field is essential, involving continuous learning through literature and professional engagement.

ONET description:
Assess individual or family risk for a variety of inherited conditions, such as genetic disorders and birth defects. Provide information to other healthcare providers or to individuals and families concerned with the risk of inherited conditions. Advise individuals and families to support informed decisionmaking and coping methods for those at risk. May help conduct research related to genetic conditions or genetic counseling.

Generated description:
These professionals collaborate closely with surgeons, ensuring all necessary equipment and supplies are prepared and readily accessible for procedures. They meticulously maintain a sterile environment by covering patients and managing the operative field to provide clear visualization. Throughout the operation, they assist by passing instruments, controlling bleeding, and performing tasks such as suctioning or irrigating. They also play a role in patient positioning, monitoring vital signs, and assisting with wound closure using various methods. Post-procedure, they prepare and apply dressings and assess the operative site. Communication with the surgical team regarding the procedure, patient status, and any necessary adjustments is crucial.

ONET description:
Assist in operations, under the supervision of surgeons. May, in accordance with state laws, help surgeons to make incisions and close surgical sites, manipulate or remove tissues, implant surgical devices or drains, suction the surgical site, place catheters, clamp or cauterize vessels or tissue, and apply dressings to surgical site.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role provide comprehensive care throughout pregnancy, labor, and the postpartum period. They conduct regular health assessments, monitor vital signs and fetal well-being, and manage pregnancy-related conditions. They obtain detailed health histories, interpret test results, and develop individualized care plans. Responsibilities include assisting with childbirth, performing necessary medical interventions for both mother and infant, and providing essential post-birth care. Communication and counseling are key, as they educate patients on pregnancy, labor, and newborn care, while also referring to specialists when needed. They maintain accurate records and ensure a safe, clean environment for birth.

ONET description:
Provide prenatal care and childbirth assistance.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role monitor patient health, observing vital signs like pulse and respiration, and administer prescribed medications or treatments. They assist with daily living activities, including bathing, dressing, grooming, and ambulation, ensuring patient comfort and hygiene. Responsibilities also extend to meal preparation, light housekeeping, and laundry to support the patient's environment. They maintain detailed records of patient care and progress, communicating observations to supervisors or case managers. This role involves providing emotional support, engaging in conversation to maintain mental alertness, and instructing patients and their families on care techniques or adapting to specific health conditions. They may also guide patients through prescribed exercises or errands.

ONET description:
Monitor the health status of an individual with disabilities or illness, and address their health-related needs, such as changing bandages, dressing wounds, or administering medication. Work is performed under the direction of offsite or intermittent onsite licensed nursing staff. Provide assistance with routine healthcare tasks or activities of daily living, such as feeding, bathing, toileting, or ambulation. May also help with tasks such as preparing meals, doing light housekeeping, and doing laundry depending on the patient's abilities.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role provide essential support by assisting care recipients with daily living activities, including personal hygiene, feeding, and mobility. They also manage household tasks like meal preparation, light cleaning, and laundry, ensuring a comfortable and safe environment. Responsibilities include observing and documenting client progress, reporting any significant changes to supervisors. They collaborate with care teams during reviews to assess needs and plan ongoing services. Communication assistance, instruction on various life skills, and providing companionship are also key duties. They administer basic health-related tasks under supervision and help individuals adapt to new lifestyles during challenging periods.

ONET description:
Provide personalized assistance to individuals with disabilities or illness who require help with personal care and activities of daily living support (e.g., feeding, bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, and ambulation). May also provide help with tasks such as preparing meals, doing light housekeeping, and doing laundry. Work is performed in various settings depending on the needs of the care recipient and may include locations such as their home, place of work, out in the community, or at a daytime nonresidential facility.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role provide essential support for patient well-being under the supervision of licensed nursing staff. They actively monitor patients' health status, noting and reporting any changes or symptoms to medical professionals. Daily responsibilities include assisting patients with personal care, such as bathing, dressing, and feeding, as well as helping with mobility and ambulation. They are responsible for maintaining a clean and sanitary patient environment, changing linens, and managing patient supplies. Additionally, they communicate with patients to offer support and ensure their needs are met, respond to call signals, and document vital signs and fluid intake or output. They may also assist with preparing food trays and transporting patients.

ONET description:
Provide or assist with basic care or support under the direction of onsite licensed nursing staff. Perform duties such as monitoring of health status, feeding, bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, or ambulation of patients in a health or nursing facility. May include medication administration and other health-related tasks. Includes nursing care attendants, nursing aides, and nursing attendants.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role focus on patient mobility and environmental support. They assist in safely moving patients between locations using specialized equipment, ensuring patients reach appointments for treatments or procedures. Daily tasks include managing and cleaning patient care equipment, maintaining sanitation standards through disinfection, and ensuring necessary supplies and equipment are available and transported where needed. They respond to urgent situations, such as medical or safety alerts, and contribute to a clean and organized environment by managing linens and equipment. This involves careful handling of patient needs and coordinating movement efficiently.

ONET description:
Transport patients to areas such as operating rooms or x-ray rooms using wheelchairs, stretchers, or moveable beds. May maintain stocks of supplies or clean and transport equipment. Psychiatric orderlies are included in Psychiatric Aides.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role provide direct care and support to patients experiencing emotional or mental health challenges. They closely monitor patient behavior, reporting any concerns to the nursing and medical staff. A significant part of their day involves assisting patients with essential daily living activities, such as bathing and dressing, and ensuring they adhere to routines. They also facilitate patient engagement by organizing and leading educational, recreational, or social activities. This involves observing, listening, and offering emotional support, as well as maintaining a safe and orderly environment. They meticulously document patient information, vital signs, and progress. In situations requiring immediate intervention, they may need to physically assist or restrain patients to ensure safety.

ONET description:
Assist mentally impaired or emotionally disturbed patients, working under direction of nursing and medical staff. May assist with daily living activities, lead patients in educational and recreational activities, or accompany patients to and from examinations and treatments. May restrain violent patients. Includes psychiatric orderlies.

They collaborate with patients, families, and other healthcare professionals, communicating observations and updating care plans as needed. Additionally, they may prepare and maintain therapy equipment, assist patients with personal care, and perform administrative tasks such as scheduling and record-keeping, always striving to foster a positive and constructive approach to treatment and recovery.

Professionals in this role manage both administrative and clinical responsibilities to support patient care. They meticulously record patient histories, vital signs, and test results, ensuring accurate documentation. Clinically, they prepare patients for examinations, administer medications and injections, draw blood, and collect specimens for laboratory analysis. They also explain treatment procedures and physician instructions, making sure patients understand their care plans. Administratively, they schedule appointments, manage medical records, answer inquiries, and handle billing and insurance forms. They maintain sterile environments, manage supplies, and operate diagnostic equipment, all under the guidance of a physician, ensuring smooth operations and effective patient support.

Administrative duties may include scheduling appointments, maintaining medical records, billing, and coding information for insurance purposes. Professionals in this role are responsible for ensuring that essential equipment is ready for use. They meticulously clean and prepare instruments, then sterilize them using specialized equipment, carefully documenting each step and test result. A key part of their day includes monitoring equipment operations to guarantee it functions within prescribed standards and checking supplies for expiration dates to ensure safety and efficacy.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role meticulously listen to audio recordings of medical information dictated by healthcare providers. They accurately transcribe these dictations, which include patient histories, examinations, and operational reports, into written documents. A key responsibility involves carefully reviewing and editing the transcribed material for errors in spelling, grammar, and medical terminology, ensuring clarity and consistency. They often consult various resources to verify medical terms and expand abbreviations. These professionals also manage and organize medical records, ensuring all essential information is accurately captured and formatted for review, signature, and inclusion in patient files. They may also perform related clerical duties to support record-keeping processes.

ONET description:
Transcribe medical reports recorded by physicians and other healthcare practitioners using various electronic devices, covering office visits, emergency room visits, diagnostic imaging studies, operations, chart reviews, and final summaries. Transcribe dictated reports and translate abbreviations into fully understandable form. Edit as necessary and return reports in either printed or electronic form for review and signature, or correction.

Generated description:

They meticulously record incoming merchandise, ensure proper storage conditions, and identify items needing replenishment by monitoring inventory levels. Additionally, they accept items for further processing, collect necessary details, and communicate with colleagues or supervisors to address inquiries or resolve issues. Maintaining a clean and organized workspace is also a key part of their daily duties.

Element Name: Veterinary Assistants and Laboratory Animal Caretakers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role provide essential care for animals and support laboratory operations. Daily activities involve preparing and distributing food and water, and closely observing animals for any signs of distress, illness, or injury. They maintain sanitary conditions by cleaning and disinfecting living spaces, equipment, and work areas. Responsibilities include administering prescribed medications, assisting with routine medical treatments, and preparing diagnostic samples. These professionals meticulously document animal health records, breeding information, and behavioral observations. They also manage supplies, sterilize instruments, and may interact with clients regarding animal care, nutrition, or behavior, all while ensuring a safe and healthy environment for the animals under their charge.

ONET description:
Feed, water, and examine pets and other nonfarm animals for signs of illness, disease, or injury in laboratories and animal hospitals and clinics. Clean and disinfect cages and work areas, and sterilize laboratory and surgical equipment. May provide routine postoperative care, administer medication orally or topically, or prepare samples for laboratory examination under the supervision of veterinary or laboratory animal technologists or technicians, veterinarians, or scientists.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Hold or restrain animals during veterinary procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor animals recovering from surgery and notify veterinarians of any unusual changes or symptoms.'}, {'Task': 'Fill medication prescriptions.'}, {'Task': 'Clean and maintain kennels, animal holding areas, examination or operating rooms, or animal loading or unloading facilities to control the spread of disease.'}, {'Task': 'Examine animals to detect behavioral changes or clinical symptoms that could indicate illness or injury.'}, {'Task': 'Perform routine laboratory tests or diagnostic tests, such as taking or developing x-rays.'}, {'Task': 'Assist veterinarians in examining animals to determine the nature of illnesses or injuries.'}, {'Task': 'Administer medication, immunizations, or blood plasma to animals as prescribed by veterinarians.'}, {'Task': 'Collect laboratory specimens, such as blood, urine, or feces, for testing.'}, {'Task': 'Perform office reception duties, such as scheduling appointments or helping customers.'}, {'Task': 'Clean, maintain, and sterilize instruments or equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Record information relating to animal genealogy, feeding schedules, appearance, behavior, or breeding.'}, {'Task': 'Provide emergency first aid to sick or injured animals.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare surgical equipment and pass instruments or materials to veterinarians during surgical procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Educate or advise clients on animal health care, nutrition, or behavior problems.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare examination or treatment rooms by stocking them with appropriate supplies.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare feed for animals according to specific instructions, such as diet lists or schedules.'}, {'Task': 'Provide assistance with euthanasia of animals or disposal of corpses.'}, {'Task': 'Write reports, maintain research information, or perform clerical duties.'}, {'Task': 'Perform hygiene-related duties, such as clipping animals\' claws or cleaning and polishing teeth.'}, {'Task': 'Perform enemas, catheterizations, ear flushes, intravenous feedings, or gavages.'}, {'Task': 'Perform accounting duties, such as bookkeeping, billing customers for services, or maintaining inventories.'}, {'Task': 'Exercise animals or provide them with companionship.'}, {'Task': 'Place orders to restock inventory of hospital or laboratory supplies.'}, {'Task': 'Sell pet food or supplies to customers.'}, {'Task': 'Dust, spray, or bathe animals to control insect pests.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this role collect biological samples, primarily by drawing blood from individuals using various venipuncture methods. They meticulously prepare collection sites and equipment, ensuring sterility and adherence to protocols. After collection, they accurately label and process specimens, often entering related data into computer systems. They may also perform basic tests directly on samples, such as for iron levels. Communication is key, as they explain procedures to individuals, provide reassurance, and sometimes assist those experiencing adverse reactions. Maintaining a clean and organized workspace, proper disposal of biohazardous materials, and accurate documentation are critical daily responsibilities. They may also educate colleagues on collection techniques.

ONET description:
Draw blood for tests, transfusions, donations, or research. May explain the procedure to patients and assist in the recovery of patients with adverse reactions.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Dispose of contaminated sharps, in accordance with applicable laws, standards, and policies.'}, {'Task': 'Organize or clean blood-drawing trays, ensuring that all instruments are sterile and all needles, syringes, or related items are of first-time use.'}, {'Task': 'Draw blood from veins by vacuum tube, syringe, or butterfly venipuncture methods.'}, {'Task': 'Match laboratory requisition forms to specimen tubes.'}, {'Task': 'Dispose of blood or other biohazard fluids or tissue, in accordance with applicable laws, standards, or policies.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct standards tests, such as blood alcohol, blood culture, oral glucose tolerance, glucose screening, blood smears, or peak and trough drug levels tests.'}, {'Task': 'Collect specimens at specific time intervals for tests, such as those assessing therapeutic drug levels.'}, {'Task': 'Process blood or other fluid samples for further analysis by other medical professionals.'}, {'Task': 'Provide sample analysis results to physicians to assist diagnosis.'}, {'Task': 'Enter patient, specimen, insurance, or billing information into computer.'}, {'Task': 'Document route of specimens from collection to laboratory analysis and diagnosis.'}, {'Task': 'Draw blood from capillaries by dermal puncture, such as heel or finger stick methods.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct hemoglobin tests to ensure donor iron levels are normal.'}, {'Task': 'Transport specimens or fluid samples from collection sites to laboratories.'}, {'Task': 'Collect fluid or tissue samples, using appropriate collection procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Explain fluid or tissue collection procedures to patients.'}, {'Task': 'Train other medical personnel in phlebotomy or laboratory techniques.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this role support specialists in addressing communication and swallowing difficulties. They execute treatment plans, implement designated activities, and assist in screening or assessment processes. Day-to-day activities involve closely monitoring individuals' progress, documenting performance data, and preparing reports or visual aids to showcase achievements. They also select and ready instructional materials, manage records, and ensure necessary supplies are available. These individuals collaborate with specialists by preparing documentation, assisting with therapeutic exercises, and ensuring smooth operations of support duties. Their work focuses on facilitating communication skills and supporting the overall treatment objectives.

ONET description:
Assist speech-language pathologists in the assessment and treatment of speech, language, voice, and fluency disorders. Implement speech and language programs or activities as planned and directed by speech-language pathologists. Monitor the use of alternative communication devices and systems.

Generated description:
This role involves preparing and maintaining specialized equipment and instruments for medical procedures, ensuring a sterile environment is upheld. Individuals in this role meticulously clean, disinfect, and calibrate equipment according to established guidelines. They actively support medical professionals by assisting during procedures, monitoring patient vital signs, and positioning patients as directed. Responsibilities also include collecting specimens, performing safety checks on equipment, and managing inventories of supplies and instruments. Continuous learning is essential, requiring individuals to stay updated on advancements and share this knowledge with colleagues. Some may also be involved in basic equipment maintenance and repair to ensure optimal functionality.

ONET description:
Maintain a sterile field to provide support for physicians and nurses during endoscopy procedures. Prepare and maintain instruments and equipment. May obtain specimens.

They also manage important resources, including equipment and records, ensuring everything aligns with established standards and legal requirements. Collaboration with external entities and community engagement are also key aspects of their role, requiring clear communication and representation of their unit's objectives.

These professionals oversee and coordinate the activities of security personnel. Their day-to-day involves assigning individuals to posts and patrols, ensuring adherence to procedures, and monitoring performance. They investigate disturbances, respond to emergencies by contacting necessary services, and ensure premises are secure by controlling access and patrolling. A significant part of their role includes training staff on protective measures, emergency protocols, and organizational policies. They also handle the recruitment and hiring of new security team members. Documentation through report writing and maintaining logs of distributed items are regular duties. Additionally, they manage and inspect security equipment to ensure proper functionality and may develop security policies.

This role requires critical thinking to solve complex problems under pressure and make sound judgments to ensure safety and mitigate risks.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role systematically evaluate structures and properties to identify potential fire hazards and ensure adherence to established safety regulations. They meticulously examine buildings, looking for violations such as improper material storage or blocked exits. When fires or explosions occur, they conduct thorough investigations, carefully collecting and analyzing evidence, including physical debris and residue, to determine the origin and cause. Their work involves documenting findings through detailed reports and photographs, sometimes coordinating with other agencies and providing expert testimony in legal proceedings. They also play a role in public education, teaching fire safety and prevention, and may review building plans to ensure future compliance.

ONET description:
Inspect buildings to detect fire hazards and enforce local ordinances and state laws, or investigate and gather facts to determine cause of fires and explosions.

Element Name: Forest Fire Inspectors and Prevention Specialists
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this field regularly patrol areas to identify potential fire hazards and monitor weather conditions, documenting findings. They enforce regulations concerning forest use, sanitation, and fire prevention, sometimes restricting public access during critical periods. These specialists conduct inspections of forest tracts, logging sites, and campsites to ensure compliance and recommend preventative measures for accumulated waste or mishandling of combustibles. They also inspect and maintain firefighting equipment, documenting inventory and condition, and may requisition new supplies. Furthermore, they are responsible for educating the public on fire safety and delivering training on firefighting techniques. During active fires, they may relay crucial information, estimate fire characteristics, and coordinate responses.

ONET description:
Enforce fire regulations, inspect forest for fire hazards, and recommend forest fire prevention or control measures. May report forest fires and weather conditions.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Relay messages about emergencies, accidents, locations of crew and personnel, and fire hazard conditions.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct wildland firefighting training.'}, {'Task': 'Estimate sizes and characteristics of fires, and report findings to base camps by radio or telephone.'}, {'Task': 'Direct crews working on firelines during forest fires.'}, {'Task': 'Locate forest fires on area maps, using azimuth sighters and known landmarks.'}, {'Task': 'Extinguish smaller fires with portable extinguishers, shovels, and axes.'}, {'Task': 'Patrol assigned areas, looking for forest fires, hazardous conditions, and weather phenomena.'}, {'Task': 'Compile and report meteorological data, such as temperature, relative humidity, wind direction and velocity, and types of cloud formations.'}, {'Task': 'Examine and inventory firefighting equipment, such as axes, fire hoses, shovels, pumps, buckets, and fire extinguishers, to determine amount and condition.'}, {'Task': 'Educate the public about fire safety and prevention.'}, {'Task': 'Direct maintenance and repair of firefighting equipment, or requisition new equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain records and logbooks.'}, {'Task': 'Administer regulations regarding sanitation, fire prevention, violation corrections, and related forest regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Restrict public access and recreational use of forest lands during critical fire seasons.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect camp sites to ensure that campers are in compliance with forest use regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect forest tracts and logging areas for fire hazards such as accumulated wastes or mishandling of combustibles, and recommend appropriate fire prevention measures.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role maintain order and provide security within court facilities. They actively monitor proceedings, enforce rules of behavior, and ensure the safety of judges, jury members, and the public. This involves screening individuals and items entering the building to detect unauthorized materials. They escort individuals in custody and guard prisoners during court sessions, preventing unauthorized contact and maintaining secure environments. Additionally, they may assist the public with directions and ensure courtrooms are adequately supplied and secure before and during proceedings. They are responsible for identifying security risks and reporting the need for assistance, making critical decisions to uphold the integrity of the legal process.

ONET description:
Maintain order in courts of law.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for maintaining order and security within correctional facilities. They meticulously monitor prisoner behavior and activities, ensuring adherence to established rules and procedures to prevent escapes or disturbances. This involves conducting regular head counts, inspecting security features like locks and gates, and searching individuals and cells for unauthorized items. They document prisoner information, incidents, and daily logs, and may escort prisoners to various locations. Additionally, they manage disputes among prisoners, facilitate communication, and coordinate daily schedules for inmates, including work and visitation. They also handle logistical tasks such as serving meals or issuing supplies, and may provide basic counseling and respond to inquiries.

ONET description:
Guard inmates in penal or rehabilitative institutions in accordance with established regulations and procedures. May guard prisoners in transit between jail, courtroom, prison, or other point. Includes deputy sheriffs and police who spend the majority of their time guarding prisoners in correctional institutions.

Generated description:
These professionals conduct investigations to address suspected violations of laws. They meticulously examine crime scenes, noting and documenting evidence such as footprints, tire tracks, and stains. They collect and preserve evidence, including fingerprints, ensuring proper handling and analysis. Investigators interview and obtain statements from complainants, witnesses, and suspects, using critical thinking to assess information. They analyze reports, examine records, and collaborate with other agencies to gather intelligence on suspects. Based on findings, they determine the scope of investigations, identify necessary evidence, and prepare reports detailing their conclusions. They also prepare charges, serve warrants, and may participate in arrests, while meticulously documenting all progress and submitting findings.

ONET description:
Conduct investigations related to suspected violations of federal, state, or local laws to prevent or solve crimes.

[{'Task': 'Check victims for signs of life, such as breathing and pulse.'}, {'Task': 'Obtain facts or statements from complainants, witnesses, and accused persons and record interviews, using Generated description:
Professionals in this role are responsible for meticulously documenting and preserving evidence. They carefully examine scenes, using specialized techniques to identify and collect trace evidence like fingerprints. They photograph scenes and evidence, ensuring clear visual records. Maintaining detailed logs and reports is crucial, requiring accurate written documentation of findings and procedures. This involves classifying and processing collected materials, often using specific chemicals and equipment. They collaborate with colleagues and legal professionals, sharing information and providing technical advice. Furthermore, they prepare and store evidence for legal proceedings, which may include testifying in court and presenting their findings. This work requires careful attention to detail, adherence to strict protocols, and effective communication skills.

ONET description:
Collect evidence at crime scene, classify and identify fingerprints, and photograph evidence for use in criminal and civil cases.

Individuals in this role systematically collect and evaluate information from diverse sources, including databases and public records, to identify patterns and trends. They analyze data to understand activities, establish connections between individuals and organizations, and map out relationships. They collaborate with colleagues and representatives from other entities to share insights and coordinate efforts. Using this analysis, they anticipate future activities and potential threats. A significant part of their work involves protecting wildlife and natural environments. They compile and analyze biological data, document their findings, and may issue warnings or citations. Their responsibilities include seizing illegal items, arranging for the disposition of confiscated wildlife, and recommending adjustments to management programs and regulations to maintain ecological balance.

Patrol assigned area to prevent fish and game law violations. Investigate reports of damage to crops or property by wildlife. Compile biological data.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role patrol assigned areas, either on foot or by vehicle, to monitor compliance with parking regulations. They identify vehicles that are parked improperly and issue citations or warnings as necessary. Communication is key, as they use electronic devices to access vehicle information, respond to dispatch calls via radio or phone, and relay information about violations. They also provide guidance to the public on parking rules and directions. Maintaining equipment, reporting hazardous conditions, and preparing records are regular duties. In some cases, they arrange for towing and may appear in court for contested citations. They also perform basic vehicle checks and, when needed, assist in training new staff or controlling traffic.

ONET description:

Generated description:
These professionals maintain public order and safety by enforcing laws and ordinances. They patrol assigned areas, respond to calls for assistance, and investigate suspicious activities, accidents, and potential violations. Their duties include directing traffic, issuing citations, and apprehending suspects, often involving communication with dispatchers and other personnel. They document incidents by recording facts and preparing reports, and may provide first aid. They also interact with the public, sometimes informing them of services or conducting educational programs. In legal proceedings, they may present evidence or act as witnesses, and serve legal documents or escort individuals in custody.

Perform a combination of the following duties: patrol a specific area; direct traffic; issue traffic summonses; investigate accidents; apprehend and arrest suspects, or serve legal processes of courts. Includes police officers working at educational institutions.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role meticulously examine individuals, conveyances, and goods to ensure adherence to regulations. They review travel documents, interview travelers to assess admissibility and eligibility for entry, and inspect baggage and cargo for prohibited items or undeclared goods. When violations are identified, they detain individuals and secure illicit items, initiating legal proceedings or collecting applicable duties and taxes. These individuals explain complex rules to stakeholders, maintain detailed records of inspections and findings, and may provide testimony in legal settings. Their work involves critical thinking, careful observation, and clear communication to uphold compliance and security standards.

They meticulously document findings in reports and may testify in legal proceedings. Decision-making relies on critical thinking and problem-solving to piece together complex scenarios. The core responsibility is to provide clients with accurate, well-supported findings derived from thorough investigations and careful analysis.

Element Name: Gambling Surveillance Officers and Gambling Investigators
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this role meticulously observe operations, utilizing various monitoring tools to detect irregularities and ensure compliance with established guidelines. They meticulously review recorded activities and maintain detailed logs of their observations. A key part of their day involves identifying potential threats to assets and promptly reporting any violations or suspicious behaviors to supervisors through written or verbal communication. They also assess the functionality of surveillance equipment to ensure it operates correctly. Furthermore, they may be responsible for training new observers and acting as security liaisons for both management and individuals within the establishment. This requires keen attention to detail, critical thinking, and effective communication.

ONET description:
Observe gambling operation for irregular activities such as cheating or theft by either employees or patrons. Investigate potential threats to gambling assets such as money, chips, and gambling equipment. Act as oversight and security agent for management and customers.

Element Name: Lifeguards, Ski Patrol, and Other Recreational Protective Service Workers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role continuously monitor designated recreational areas, observing participants for safety and potential hazards. They actively patrol their assigned zones, ensuring compliance with rules and identifying unsafe conditions or illegal activities. When necessary, they intervene to provide assistance, administer first aid or CPR, and coordinate with emergency services for more serious situations. They also communicate important information regarding weather or safety regulations. Some may maintain specific facilities, such as water quality, or inspect equipment for potential risks. Record-keeping of incidents and conditions is also a part of their duties, alongside instructing participants on safety procedures or activities.

ONET description:
Monitor recreational areas, such as pools, beaches, or ski slopes, to provide assistance and protection to participants.

[{'Task': 'Patrol or monitor recreational areas, such as trails, slopes, or swimming areas, on foot, in vehicles, or from towers.'}, {'Task': 'Rescue distressed persons, using rescue techniques and equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Contact emergency medical personnel in case of serious injury.'}, {'Task': 'Examine injured persons and administer first aid or cardiopulmonary resuscitation, if necessary, using training and medical supplies and equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Warn recreational participants of inclement weather, unsafe areas, or illegal conduct.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain quality of pool water by testing chemical levels.'}, {'Task': 'Complete and maintain records of weather and beach conditions, emergency medical treatments performed, and other relevant incident information.'}, {'Task': 'Instruct participants in skiing, swimming, or other recreational activities and provide safety precaution information.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect recreational equipment, such as rope tows, T-bars, J-bars, or chair lifts, for safety hazards and damage or wear.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect recreational facilities for cleanliness.'}]

They actively monitor passenger flow, manage access points, and communicate important information to passengers regarding security procedures and item disposition. In situations involving security breaches or potential dangers, they escalate concerns to supervisors or directly contact law enforcement to ensure safety and order.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field are responsible for safeguarding assets and minimizing losses. They actively investigate potential internal and external theft, as well as fraud, by monitoring activities and conducting audits. A key part of their role involves implementing and overseeing procedures designed to reduce property and financial damage. This includes inspecting premises for security risks, ensuring physical security systems are functional, and documenting all incidents and investigations through detailed written reports. They collaborate with various departments and sometimes external agencies to address security concerns, recommend improvements, and ensure compliance with established protocols. They may also train personnel on loss prevention techniques and respond to critical incidents, always making decisions based on thorough analysis and critical thinking.

ONET description:
Implement procedures and systems to prevent merchandise loss. Conduct audits and investigations of employee activity. May assist in developing policies, procedures, and systems for safeguarding assets.

Element Name: First-Line Supervisors of Food Preparation and Serving Workers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These individuals oversee teams involved in food preparation and service. They guide and train workers on established procedures for food handling, sanitation, and safety. They manage daily operations by assigning tasks, monitoring performance, and ensuring quality standards are met. This includes observing work, evaluating procedures, and providing feedback. They also handle customer interactions, resolve complaints, and manage financial transactions and inventory control. Decisions involve optimizing workflows, addressing operational challenges like waste, and implementing improvements to enhance efficiency and safety. They ensure compliance with standards by inspecting supplies and work areas, and make recommendations for procedural enhancements.

ONET description:
Directly supervise and coordinate activities of workers engaged in preparing and serving food.

Tasks:

Element Name: Dining Room and Cafeteria Attendants and Bartender Helpers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role support food service operations by ensuring dining areas are prepared and clean for patrons. They meticulously set tables with linens, silverware, and other necessary items, ensuring adequate supplies are always available. Day-to-day activities involve clearing tables of used dishes and debris, wiping down surfaces, and removing trash. They also assist in replenishing service areas with food and beverages, such as filling dispensers and stocking condiments. These professionals actively contribute to a smooth dining experience by anticipating needs, delivering requested items, and maintaining the overall cleanliness and organization of the service environment, responding promptly to spills or other disruptions.

ONET description:
Facilitate food service. Clean tables; remove dirty dishes; replace soiled table linens; set tables; replenish supply of clean linens, silverware, glassware, and dishes; supply service bar with food; and serve items such as water, condiments, and coffee to patrons.

Element Name: Hosts and Hostesses, Restaurant, Lounge, and Coffee Shop
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are the first point of contact for patrons, extending welcomes and guiding them to appropriate seating. They manage reservations and inquiries via telephone, ensuring efficient table allocation to balance service loads. A key responsibility involves inspecting dining and service areas to maintain cleanliness and proper setup, including restrooms. They communicate with kitchen and service staff to coordinate dining details and address patron needs, often speaking with guests to ensure satisfaction, resolve concerns, or highlight specialties. In some instances, they may assist with serving food, preparing to-go orders, or managing dining room staff to uphold service standards.

ONET description:

occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals oversee and coordinate the daily activities of cleaning and maintenance personnel. They develop work schedules, assign tasks, and monitor performance to ensure that standards are met. This involves inspecting completed work, evaluating the condition of facilities, and determining necessary services or repairs. They also manage inventory, order supplies and equipment, and maintain records of operations and personnel. Additionally, they instruct staff on procedures and equipment use, investigate complaints, and confer with employees to resolve performance issues and discuss policies. They may also recommend improvements to services and operational efficiency, and take corrective actions to address problems.

ONET description:
Directly supervise and coordinate work activities of cleaning personnel in hotels, hospitals, offices, and other establishments.

occupation_text:

These professionals oversee and coordinate the daily activities of groundskeeping and landscaping teams. They review contracts to determine specific requirements for services, equipment, and personnel, and often interact with clients to provide estimates and answer questions about methods and pricing. A key responsibility is scheduling work for crews, adjusting based on priorities, resource availability, or environmental conditions. They monitor operations to ensure adherence to standards, deadlines, and quality specifications, and may directly assist with tasks when needed. Furthermore, they manage team performance, conduct training, maintain records, and ensure that necessary supplies and equipment are available and in good working order.

ONET description:
Directly supervise and coordinate activities of workers engaged in landscaping or groundskeeping activities. Work may involve reviewing contracts to ascertain service, machine, and workforce requirements; answering inquiries from potential customers regarding methods, material, and price ranges; and preparing estimates according to labor, material, and machine costs.

Element Name: Janitors and Cleaners, Except Maids and Housekeeping Cleaners
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for maintaining the cleanliness and orderliness of various environments. Their daily duties involve a range of cleaning activities, including sweeping, mopping, vacuuming, and scrubbing floors. They also handle tasks such as washing walls and glass surfaces, and regularly removing waste. Preparation of cleaning solutions using specific chemicals and equipment is a key part of their work, ensuring surfaces are properly treated without damage. They manage supplies, monitor equipment, and report the need for significant repairs to management. Additionally, they may contribute to safety by securing areas and ensuring proper use of equipment.

ONET description:
Keep buildings in clean and orderly condition. Perform heavy cleaning duties, such as cleaning floors, shampooing rugs, washing walls and glass, and removing rubbish. Duties may include tending furnace and boiler, performing routine maintenance activities, notifying management of need for repairs, and cleaning snow or debris from sidewalk.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for maintaining clean and orderly environments by performing a variety of light cleaning duties. They systematically clean rooms, hallways, and other common areas, ensuring health standards are met. Apply or release chemical solutions or toxic gases and set traps to kill or remove pests and vermin that infest buildings and surrounding areas.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the care and upkeep of outdoor areas. They utilize a variety of hand and power tools to perform tasks such as mowing, trimming, and pruning. They also engage in planting and watering, applying necessary treatments like fertilizers or pest control substances. Duties include maintaining lawn health through mulching, weeding, and aeration, as well as clearing debris like leaves. Workers typically perform a variety of tasks, which may include any combination of the following: sod laying, mowing, trimming, planting, watering, fertilizing, digging, raking, sprinkler installation, and installation of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units.

They meticulously mix chemicals according to precise formulas, ensuring the correct concentrations for effective results. Their day involves operating and maintaining application equipment, from filling tanks to connecting hoses and nozzles adapted to specific terrains and needs. They carefully direct sprays over designated areas, considering factors like weather and site conditions to achieve accurate coverage. A key part of their work includes diagnosing plant issues to select the most appropriate treatments. They also perform routine maintenance on their machinery to guarantee operational efficiency and safety.

ONET description:
Mix or apply pesticides, herbicides, fungicides, or insecticides through sprays, dusts, vapors, soil incorporation, or chemical application on trees, shrubs, lawns, or crops. Usually requires specific training and state or federal certification.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously assess trees to identify issues such as disease or pests, and then safely remove dead or hazardous branches. They utilize specialized climbing gear and various cutting tools to access and manage tree canopies, often working at significant heights. Their responsibilities include shaping trees for aesthetic or health purposes and ensuring clearance around essential infrastructure. They also operate equipment for processing debris, maintain tools and machinery, and supervise or train junior team members. Additionally, they manage the removal of cut materials and may advise the public on tree care practices, demonstrating critical thinking and problem-solving skills to ensure safety and tree vitality.

ONET description:
Using sophisticated climbing and rigging techniques, cut away dead or excess branches from trees or shrubs to maintain right-of-way for roads, sidewalks, or utilities, or to improve appearance, health, and value of tree. Prune or treat trees or shrubs using handsaws, hand pruners, clippers, and power pruners. Works off the ground in the tree canopy and may use truck-mounted lifts.

Element Name: First-Line Supervisors of Gambling Services Workers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals oversee and coordinate the daily activities of service workers. They observe operations, ensuring adherence to rules and regulations while monitoring for issues like cheating or disruptive behavior. They interact with patrons, addressing complaints, answering questions, and ensuring satisfactory service. These supervisors also manage immediate operational needs, which may include resetting equipment, performing minor repairs, and verifying payouts. They are responsible for staff oversight, including performance evaluations and ensuring proper staffing levels for games and stations. Additionally, they manage patron interactions, respond to incidents, and may distribute amenities based on play.

ONET description:
Directly supervise and coordinate activities of workers in assigned gambling areas. May circulate among tables, observe operations, and ensure that stations and games are covered for each shift. May verify and pay off jackpots. May reset slot machines after payoffs and make repairs or adjustments to slot machines or recommend removal of slot machines for repair. May plan and organize activities and services for guests in hotels/casinos.

Element Name: First-Line Supervisors of Personal Service Workers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role oversee and coordinate the daily activities of service personnel. They ensure that operations run smoothly by assigning tasks, creating work schedules, and arranging breaks to maintain adequate staffing. These supervisors train new hires on procedures and policies, monitor performance to uphold quality standards, and inspect work areas and equipment. They also handle various personnel matters, including recruiting, hiring, resolving employee complaints, and administering disciplinary actions when necessary. Furthermore, they interact with management to stay informed of operational changes and address customer feedback to improve service delivery. Their responsibilities also extend to requisitioning necessary supplies and equipment.

ONET description:
Supervise and coordinate activities of personal service workers.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field evaluate animals to assess their temperaments and aptitudes for specific training purposes. They develop and implement training programs to shape desired behaviors for various applications, including performance, security, and assistance. This involves using verbal cues and other signals to communicate commands and conditioning animals to respond appropriately. They also acclimate animals to human interaction, monitor their physical and behavioral conditions, and maintain records of their progress, diet, and health. Additionally, they may provide general care such as feeding, exercising, and maintaining living environments, ensuring the animals are well-prepared for their designated roles or competitions.

ONET description:
Train animals for riding, harness, security, performance, or obedience, or for assisting persons with disabilities. Accustom animals to human voice and contact, and condition animals to respond to commands. Train animals according to prescribed standards for show or competition. May train animals to carry pack loads or work as part of pack team.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the daily care and well-being of animals. This includes preparing and distributing food and water, administering medications, and observing animals for any signs of illness or injury, intervening with treatments or contacting veterinary professionals as needed. They also maintain a clean and sanitary environment by disinfecting enclosures and equipment. Grooming tasks such as washing, brushing, and nail trimming are performed regularly. Additionally, these professionals engage in activities to ensure animals remain physically and mentally healthy, including exercise and interaction. They meticulously record observations, treatments, and animal status, and may also respond to inquiries and provide guidance on animal care to others.

ONET description:
Feed, water, groom, bathe, exercise, or otherwise provide care to promote and maintain the well-being of pets and other animals that are not raised for consumption, such as dogs, cats, race horses, ornamental fish or birds, zoo animals, and mice. Work in settings such as kennels, animal shelters, zoos, circuses, and aquariums. May keep records of feedings, treatments, and animals received or discharged. May clean, disinfect, and repair cages, pens, or fish tanks.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role manage games of chance, ensuring fair play and adherence to established rules. They interact with patrons, exchanging currency for playing chips and verifying bets before each round. A key responsibility involves dealing cards or operating equipment, then accurately calculating and distributing winnings or collecting losses. They also inspect game materials for proper condition and may work collaboratively with other team members. Answering questions about game procedures and policies, while maintaining a welcoming demeanor, is also part of their duties. They must meticulously track transactions and manage table operations, including opening and closing procedures for cash and equipment.

ONET description:
Operate table games. Stand or sit behind table and operate games of chance by dispensing the appropriate number of cards or blocks to players, or operating other gambling equipment. Distribute winnings or collect players' money or chips. May compare the house's hand against players' hands.

Element Name: Gambling and Sports Book Writers and Runners
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for processing and managing patron wagers. They accurately record and verify the amounts patrons wish to bet, ensuring all transactions are correctly logged. When patrons win, these individuals calculate and distribute the winnings, or direct them to appropriate personnel for payout. They also play a role in operating games by announcing numbers and ensuring fair play. Throughout their day, they interact with patrons, answer questions about rules and policies, and monitor game activities. Their duties require attention to detail in financial transactions, clear communication, and adherence to established procedures to maintain smooth operations.

ONET description:

Element Name: Ushers, Lobby Attendants, and Ticket Takers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are the primary point of contact for patrons arriving at various events. They meticulously verify admission, collecting tickets and passes while ensuring authenticity. A key responsibility involves guiding attendees, helping them locate their seats, and providing directions to essential facilities like restrooms. They offer assistance to patrons with special needs and manage access, denying entry to those without proper documentation or who may pose a concern. In emergencies, they provide clear instructions and guidance. These professionals also address patron inquiries, assist in locating lost items or individuals, and generally maintain a welcoming and orderly environment. Their interactions focus on service, problem-solving, and ensuring a positive experience for everyone.

ONET description:
Assist patrons at entertainment events by performing duties, such as collecting admission tickets and passes from patrons, assisting in finding seats, searching for lost articles, and helping patrons locate such facilities as restrooms and telephones.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role meticulously prepare deceased individuals for final disposition, ensuring compliance with all legal and sanitary regulations. Their day-to-day activities involve carefully cleansing and disinfecting bodies, performing restorative cosmetic work to create a lifelike appearance, and skillfully closing incisions. They meticulously manage the circulatory system to introduce preservation fluids and pack orifices to prevent leakage.  These individuals maintain detailed records of personal effects and the procedures performed. They also interact with families to understand their needs, arrange for transportation of the deceased, and coordinate aspects of funeral services, sometimes acting as pallbearers or assisting with processions.  Attention to detail and adherence to established protocols are paramount in their work.

ONET description:
Prepare bodies for interment in conformity with legal requirements.

Individuals in this role coordinate and oversee funeral arrangements, acting as a central point of contact for grieving families. They manage the logistical aspects of a funeral, from the initial removal of the deceased to the final interment or cremation. This involves consulting with families to understand their wishes regarding service details, such as obituary notices and casket selection, and providing guidance on available options. They also handle necessary documentation and schedule various aspects of the service, including grave openings and clergy participation. Additionally, these professionals offer comfort and support to the bereaved, arrange transportation for attendees and the deceased, and ensure all services are conducted with dignity and respect.

They manage the transportation of luggage, ensuring items are moved safely and efficiently to designated areas, rooms, or vehicles. This involves receiving and marking baggage, and physically transferring items by hand or using equipment. Responsibilities extend to greeting individuals, escorting them to their destinations, and explaining how certain features operate. Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the daily care and development of children within a private residence. They prioritize creating a safe environment by identifying and removing hazards and establishing clear rules. A significant part of their day involves instructing children in healthy habits, personal hygiene, and appropriate social behaviors, while also managing rest and nap schedules. They plan and prepare nutritious meals and snacks, engage children in age-appropriate educational and recreational activities like reading and arts and crafts, and provide homework assistance. They monitor children's health, administer medication as directed, and perform first aid if necessary. Additionally, they manage household tasks directly related to the children's needs, transport them to various appointments and activities, and regularly communicate with parents about the child's progress and daily events, developmental milestones.

ONET description:
Care for children in private households and provide support and expertise to parents in satisfying children's physical, emotional, intellectual, and social needs. Duties may include meal planning and preparation, laundry and clothing care, organization of play activities and outings, discipline, intellectual stimulation, language activities, and transportation.

Element Name: Exercise Trainers and Group Fitness Instructors
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role assess participants' current physical condition, abilities, and requirements to design tailored exercise plans. They demonstrate and explain proper techniques, including breathing and the use of various equipment, while actively monitoring participants during activities. Instructors offer modifications to accommodate different fitness levels and ensure exercises are performed safely and effectively to maximize benefits. They observe participants' progress, making necessary adjustments to their programs. Additionally, these professionals may provide guidance on nutrition and lifestyle choices, enforce safety regulations, and administer basic first aid for minor injuries. They also maintain and manage necessary equipment.

ONET description:
Instruct or coach groups or individuals in exercise activities for the primary purpose of personal fitness. Demonstrate techniques and form, observe participants, and explain to them corrective measures necessary to improve their skills. Develop and implement individualized approaches to exercise.

Tasks:

These professionals oversee daily operations within residential facilities, ensuring a safe and orderly environment for residents. They actively monitor living spaces and resident behavior, responding to incidents and enforcing established regulations. They coordinate with colleagues and support staff to address resident issues, mediating conflicts and offering guidance. A key responsibility involves assessing and requisitioning necessary supplies and maintenance for the facility. Furthermore, they often develop and implement programs designed to support residents' well-being and personal development, while also maintaining records and preparing reports on activities and resource needs.

ONET description:
Coordinate activities in resident facilities in secondary school and college dormitories, group homes, or similar establishments. Element Name: First-Line Supervisors of Retail Sales Workers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
This role involves overseeing the daily operations of a sales team, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and adherence to quality standards. Responsibilities include directing and supervising employees, assigning tasks, and scheduling work hours. Key duties also encompass managing inventory, tracking sales and purchases, and preparing reports for higher management. This position requires monitoring sales activities, examining merchandise for accuracy in pricing and display, and sometimes performing sales or operational tasks alongside staff. Additionally, enforcing operational policies, safety regulations, and resolving customer inquiries are crucial aspects of the job. The role also contributes to strategic planning by estimating demand and collaborating on methods to enhance sales and business growth.

ONET description:
Directly supervise and coordinate activities of retail sales workers in an establishment or department. Duties may include management functions, such as purchasing, budgeting, accounting, and personnel work, in addition to supervisory duties.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Provide customer service by greeting and assisting customers and responding to customer inquiries and complaints.'}, {'Task': 'Direct and supervise employees engaged in sales, inventory-taking, reconciling cash receipts, or in performing services for customers.'}, {'Task': 'Examine merchandise to ensure that it is correctly priced and displayed and that it functions as advertised.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor sales activities to ensure that customers receive satisfactory service and quality goods.'}, {'Task': 'Instruct staff on how to handle difficult and complicated sales.'}, {'Task': 'Assign employees to specific duties.'}, {'Task': 'Keep records of purchases, sales, and requisitions.'}, {'Task': 'Perform work activities of subordinates, such as cleaning and organizing shelves and displays and selling merchandise.'}, {'Task': 'Plan and prepare work schedules and keep records of employees\' work schedules and time cards.'}, {'Task': 'Review inventory and sales records to prepare reports for management and budget departments.'}, {'Task': 'Inventory stock and reorder when inventory drops to a specified level.'}, {'Task': 'Establish and implement policies, goals, objectives, and procedures for the department.'}, {'Task': 'Examine products purchased for resale or received for storage to assess the condition of each product or item.'}, {'Task': 'Enforce safety, health, and security rules.'}, {'Task': 'Estimate consumer demand and determine the types and amounts of goods to be sold.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with company officials to develop methods and procedures to increase sales, expand markets, and promote business.'}]

Element Name: Gambling Change Persons and Booth Cashiers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
This role involves managing financial transactions and ensuring accurate record-keeping. A primary responsibility is exchanging various forms of currency and credit for customers, including tokens and chips. Individuals in this position must meticulously count money and audit cash drawers to maintain financial integrity. They are also responsible for verifying customer identification, particularly to confirm age eligibility. A key aspect of the job is upholding security protocols to protect assets. Furthermore, this role requires reconciling daily transaction summaries to ensure all financial records are balanced and accurate at the end of each period. Attention to detail and adherence to established procedures are critical.

ONET description:
Exchange coins, tokens, and chips for patrons' money. May issue payoffs and obtain customer's signature on receipt. May operate a booth in the slot machine area and furnish change persons with money bank at the start of the shift, or count and audit money in drawers.

Element Name: Securities, Commodities, and Financial Services Sales Agents
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals actively monitor markets and analyze factors affecting price movements to identify purchase or sale opportunities. They interview clients to understand their financial status, objectives, and needs, then discuss financial options and develop personalized plans. They advise clients on investments, explaining market terms and trading practices. These agents execute buy or sell transactions on behalf of clients, ensuring accuracy and compliance. They negotiate prices, keep detailed records of transactions, and report trading results. Additionally, they inform clients and colleagues about market conditions, financial options, and corporate positions, maintaining strong communication to foster informed decision-making and achieve financial goals.

ONET description:
Buy and sell securities or commodities in investment and trading firms, or provide financial services to businesses and individuals. May advise customers about stocks, bonds, mutual funds, commodities, and market conditions.

Generated description:

In some cases, they may also assist clients in resolving unforeseen travel-related issues, ensuring a smooth experience.

Element Name: Sales Representatives, Wholesale and Manufacturing, Technical and Scientific Products
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this role engage with potential and existing customers to understand their requirements and demonstrate how technical products can fulfill those needs. They analyze customer needs and leverage their in-depth product knowledge to emphasize features and benefits, preparing persuasive presentations and proposals. Interactions often involve quoting prices, negotiating terms, and finalizing sales contracts. They maintain detailed customer records, answer inquiries regarding products and services, and provide ongoing support. Continuous learning is essential, requiring them to study new product documentation and stay informed about market trends and industry developments. They also collaborate with colleagues, manage administrative tasks like reporting, and ensure customer satisfaction through effective problem-solving and timely communication regarding deliveries and warranties.

ONET description:
Sell goods for wholesalers or manufacturers where technical or scientific knowledge is required in such areas as biology, engineering, chemistry, and electronics, normally obtained from at least 2 years of postsecondary education.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role engage with individuals to understand their energy needs and propose suitable solutions. They analyze site conditions and client requirements to select appropriate equipment and design customized energy packages. This involves calculating potential energy production, estimating costs, and preparing detailed proposals or presentations. They also provide comprehensive information regarding pricing, financing options, incentives, and product specifications. Generating new leads, nurturing existing relationships, and assessing site suitability for equipment installation are key responsibilities. They communicate technical details effectively, negotiate terms, and ensure customers have all necessary information to make informed decisions about their energy systems.

Element Name: Sales Representatives, Wholesale and Manufacturing, Except Technical and Scientific Products
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this role engage with potential and existing customers to present and sell a variety of goods. They actively listen to understand customer needs, offering tailored recommendations and product demonstrations. Responsibilities include explaining product features, quoting prices and terms, and preparing sales contracts. Building relationships is key, as they also provide post-sale support and address any customer concerns. These individuals maintain awareness of market trends, competitor activities, and new product developments to inform their sales strategies. They also handle administrative duties such as reporting, record-keeping, and managing sales budgets, ensuring efficient operation of their sales activities.

ONET description:
Sell goods for wholesalers or manufacturers to businesses or groups of individuals. Work requires substantial knowledge of items sold.

[{'Task': 'Answer customers\' questions about products, prices, availability, product uses, and credit terms.'}, {'Task': 'Recommend products to customers, based on customers\' needs and interests.'}, {'Task': 'Estimate or quote prices, credit or contract terms, warranties, and delivery dates.'}, {'Task': 'Consult with clients after sales or contract signings to resolve problems and to provide ongoing support.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare sales contracts and order forms.'}, {'Task': 'Provide customers with product samples and catalogs.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor market conditions, product innovations, and competitors\' products, prices, and sales.'}, {'Task': 'Perform administrative duties, such as preparing sales budgets and reports, keeping sales records, and filing expense account reports.'}, {'Task': 'Contact regular and prospective customers to demonstrate products, explain product features, and solicit orders.'}, {'Task': 'Identify prospective customers by using business directories, following leads from existing clients, participating in organizations and clubs, and attending trade shows and conferences.'}]

Generated description:
These professionals engage audiences by demonstrating products or services to generate interest and encourage purchases. They explain features, answer questions, and provide information to meet customer needs, sometimes offering incentives to persuade potential buyers. They also track and report on demonstration activities, such as audience engagement or distributed materials, and may handle sales transactions. Maintaining an organized workspace and collaborating with team members to manage large groups are also key responsibilities. They adapt their approach based on customer interactions and product knowledge.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role facilitate property transactions by connecting buyers and sellers. They manage operations, oversee staff, and ensure business processes run smoothly. A significant part of their day involves evaluating properties, determining competitive pricing, and generating listings with detailed descriptions and financing information. They actively engage in negotiations, mediating discussions on price and terms to reach mutually agreeable settlements. These individuals also manage contracts, monitor deadlines, and coordinate with various parties to ensure all aspects of a sale or rental are handled correctly and on time. Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of relevant laws, market conditions, and financial options is crucial for their decision-making and client guidance.

ONET description:
Operate real estate office, or work for commercial real estate firm, overseeing real estate transactions. Other duties usually include selling real estate or renting properties and arranging loans.

This involves consulting with lenders and other professionals to meet agreement terms before closing. Additionally, they promote properties through various channels, maintain knowledge of market trends, and build professional networks to facilitate transactions.

Generated description:
These professionals handle financial exchanges with customers, processing various transactions and providing currency for services. They may evaluate creditworthiness by reviewing applications and checking references, authorizing credit or check cashing. A key responsibility involves managing cash and inventory, including acquiring necessary funds, distributing chips or tokens, and exchanging them for currency. Accuracy is paramount, requiring meticulous record-keeping, daily reconciliation of transactions, and verification of financial reports to balance accounts. Maintaining security and confidentiality of customer information and financial activities is also essential. They also assist in training new team members and can answer customer inquiries regarding operations.

ONET description:
In a gambling establishment, conduct financial transactions for patrons. Accept patron's credit application and verify credit references to provide check-cashing authorization or to establish house credit accounts. May reconcile daily summaries of transactions to balance books. May sell gambling chips, tokens, or tickets to patrons, or to other workers for resale to patrons. May convert gambling chips, tokens, or tickets to currency upon patron's request. May use a cash register or computer to record transaction.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role meticulously organize and maintain physical and digital records. They receive and sort various documents, classifying them according to established systems, whether alphabetical, numerical, or by content. A key responsibility involves accurately filing these materials into designated storage locations. When requested, they efficiently locate, retrieve, and deliver specific information to authorized individuals, often making copies. They also manage the lifecycle of records by adding new materials, updating existing entries, and removing outdated documents through destruction or transfer to inactive storage. Additionally, they may answer inquiries about records, maintain logs of file activity, and contribute to improving or implementing new organizational systems.

ONET description:
File correspondence, cards, invoices, receipts, and other records in alphabetical or numerical order or according to the filing system used. Locate and remove material from file when requested.
