Element Name: Hotel, Motel, and Resort Desk Clerks
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role manage guest interactions and lodging arrangements, focusing on providing attentive service. They greet guests, process registrations, and assign accommodations, ensuring a smooth arrival experience. Key responsibilities include handling reservations, issuing access credentials, and managing guest accounts. They communicate guest needs or issues to relevant staff, coordinate services, and accurately process payments for services rendered. This role also involves answering inquiries, providing information about amenities and local attractions, and maintaining organized records of room status and financial transactions. Additionally, they may handle guest messages and assist with arrangements for additional services to enhance the guest's stay.

ONET description:
Accommodate hotel, motel, and resort patrons by registering and assigning rooms to guests, issuing room keys or cards, transmitting and receiving messages, keeping records of occupied rooms and guests' accounts, making and confirming reservations, and presenting statements to and collecting payments from departing guests.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Greet, register, and assign rooms to guests of hotels or motels.'}, {'Task': 'Contact housekeeping or maintenance staff when guests report problems.'}, {'Task': 'Issue room keys and escort instructions to bellhops.'}, {'Task': 'Make and confirm reservations.'}, {'Task': 'Verify customers\' credit, and establish how the customer will pay for the accommodation.'}, {'Task': 'Keep records of room availability and guests\' accounts, manually or using computers.'}, {'Task': 'Post charges, such as those for rooms, food, liquor, or telephone calls, to ledgers, manually or by using computers.'}, {'Task': 'Review accounts and charges with guests during the check out process.'}, {'Task': 'Record guest comments or complaints, referring customers to managers as necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Compute bills, collect payments, and make change for guests.'}, {'Task': 'Transmit and receive messages, using telephones or telephone switchboards.'}, {'Task': 'Answer inquiries pertaining to hotel services, guest registration, and travel directions, or make recommendations regarding shopping, dining, or entertainment.'}, {'Task': 'Advise housekeeping staff when rooms have been vacated and are ready for cleaning.'}, {'Task': 'Perform bookkeeping activities, such as balancing accounts and conducting nightly audits.'}, {'Task': 'Clean and maintain lobby and common areas, such as restocking supplies and watering plants.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare for basic food service, such as setting up continental breakfast or coffee and tea supplies.'}, {'Task': 'Date-stamp, sort, and rack incoming mail and messages.'}, {'Task': 'Arrange tours, taxis, or restaurant reservations for customers.'}, {'Task': 'Deposit guests\' valuables in hotel safes or safe-deposit boxes.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role manage the circulation of library materials, including sorting, shelving, issuing, and receiving items such as books and digital media. They assist patrons by locating materials, answering inquiries, and registering them to borrow resources. This involves maintaining accurate patron and item records, processing new materials, and managing overdue items and fines. They also support librarians with collection maintenance, prepare reports, and may instruct patrons on using library systems and equipment. Additionally, they handle various clerical duties, perform basic repairs on materials, and contribute to the organization and presentation of library resources and displays.

ONET description:
Compile records, and sort, shelve, issue, and receive library materials such as books, electronic media, pictures, cards, slides and microfilm. Locate library materials for loan and replace material in shelving area, stacks, or files according to identification number and title. Register patrons to permit them to borrow books, periodicals, and other library materials.

Element Name: Human Resources Assistants, Except Payroll and Timekeeping
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously maintain and update employee records, ensuring all personal and professional data is accurately documented. They process a variety of personnel-related paperwork, including information on recruitment, training, and employee absences. This involves recording details such as earnings, performance, and reasons for termination. They also answer questions about policies, benefits, and eligibility, and may assist with administering benefit programs. Furthermore, they prepare materials for new employee orientations and compile reports on personnel activities. These professionals are responsible for retrieving and providing information from employee files to authorized individuals and organizations, ensuring confidentiality and accuracy.

ONET description:
Compile and keep personnel records. Record data for each employee, such as address, weekly earnings, absences, amount of sales or production, supervisory reports, and date of and reason for termination. May prepare reports for employment records, file employment records, or search employee files and furnish information to authorized persons.

Element Name: Reservation and Transportation Ticket Agents and Travel Clerks
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role manage reservations and provide travel-related information. They interact with customers to understand their needs, confirm travel arrangements, and assign available spaces on various transportation methods. This involves using computer systems to maintain inventory and process bookings. They also assemble and issue necessary documents, such as tickets and itineraries, and compute associated costs. Additionally, they assist customers with inquiries about schedules, policies, and travel requirements, ensuring passengers are directed appropriately and receive necessary information. They may also help trace lost items and provide information about connections and other travel details, focusing on clear communication and efficient service delivery to meet client preferences and ensure smooth journeys.

ONET description:
Make and confirm reservations for transportation or lodging, or sell transportation tickets. May check baggage and direct passengers to designated concourse, pier, or track; deliver tickets and contact individuals and groups to inform them of package tours; or provide tourists with travel or transportation information.

[{'Task': 'Examine passenger documentation to determine destinations and to assign boarding passes.'}, {'Task': 'Trace lost, delayed, or misdirected baggage for customers.'}, {'Task': 'Check baggage and cargo and direct passengers to designated locations for loading.'}, {'Task': 'Provide boarding or disembarking assistance to passengers needing special assistance.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with customers to determine their service requirements and travel preferences.'}, {'Task': 'Announce arrival and departure information, using public address systems.'}, {'Task': 'Determine whether space is available on travel dates requested by customers, assigning requested spaces when available.'}, {'Task': 'Assemble and issue required documentation, such as tickets, travel insurance policies, or itineraries.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain computerized inventories of available passenger space and provide information on space reserved or available.'}, {'Task': 'Inform clients of essential travel information, such as travel times, transportation connections, or medical and visa requirements.'}, {'Task': 'Answer inquiries regarding information, such as schedules, accommodations, procedures, or policies.'}, {'Task': 'Plan routes, itineraries, and accommodation details, and compute fares and fees, using schedules, rate books, and computers.'}, {'Task': 'Make and confirm reservations for transportation and accommodations, using telephones, faxes, mail, and computers.'}, {'Task': 'Keep information facilities clean during operation.'}]

They may also offer guidance and instructions to callers based on established emergency procedures, while monitoring various communication channels for developing situations.

Element Name: Dispatchers, Except Police, Fire, and Ambulance
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals coordinate and direct the movement of resources, such as personnel, equipment, and vehicles. They receive requests and process work orders, determining the necessary resources for each job. Using communication tools like radios and telephones, they transmit assignments and relay critical information to field teams. Their responsibilities include preparing schedules, monitoring progress, and managing resources to ensure efficient operations. They also address inquiries, troubleshoot issues, and arrange for necessary repairs to maintain service continuity. Their day involves constant communication, decision-making to solve problems, and strategic planning to optimize workflow and adapt to changing conditions or unexpected events.

ONET description:
Schedule and dispatch workers, work crews, equipment, or service vehicles for conveyance of materials, freight, or passengers, or for normal installation, service, or emergency repairs rendered outside the place of business. Duties may include using radio, telephone, or computer to transmit assignments and compiling statistics and reports on work progress.

[{'Task': 'Schedule or dispatch workers, work crews, equipment, or service vehicles to appropriate locations, according to customer requests, specifications, or needs, using radios or telephones.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare daily work and run schedules.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with customers or supervising personnel to address questions, problems, or requests for service or equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Relay work orders, messages, or information to or from work crews, supervisors, or field inspectors, using telephones or two-way radios.'}, {'Task': 'Receive or prepare work orders.'}, {'Task': 'Record and maintain files or records of customer requests, work or services performed, charges, expenses, inventory, or other dispatch information.'}, {'Task': 'Arrange for necessary repairs to restore service and schedules.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor personnel or equipment locations and utilization to coordinate service and schedules.'}, {'Task': 'Determine types or amounts of equipment, vehicles, materials, or personnel required, according to work orders or specifications.'}, {'Task': 'Advise personnel about traffic problems, such as construction areas, accidents, congestion, weather conditions, or other hazards.'}]

They also play a role in maintaining equipment by performing minor repairs or preventative maintenance. When encountering access issues, such as impediments or damaged meters, they report these problems and may schedule follow-up visits. Additionally, they are responsible for updating customer information and addressing basic inquiries about services and charges.

They meticulously examine letters and parcels to ensure proper postage and condition, calculating costs based on various factors and applying the correct payment. Includes postal service clerks employed by USPS contractors.

Element Name: Postal Service Mail Sorters, Processors, and Processing Machine Operators
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the efficient processing and distribution of mail. They carefully examine, sort, and direct incoming and outgoing correspondence and packages according to established procedures. A significant part of their day involves operating specialized machinery designed for mail processing and sorting, which may require minor adjustments or troubleshooting to ensure smooth operation. They also perform manual sorting for items that require special attention or cannot be processed by machines. Maintaining accurate records of items handled and ensuring adherence to operational guidelines are key responsibilities. Effective monitoring of equipment and processes helps to maintain workflow and identify any issues requiring intervention.

ONET description:
Prepare incoming and outgoing mail for distribution for the United States Postal Service (USPS). Examine, sort, and route mail. Load, operate, and occasionally adjust and repair mail processing, sorting, and canceling machinery. Keep records of shipments, pouches, and sacks, and perform other duties related to mail handling within the postal service. Includes postal service mail sorters and processors employed by USPS contractors.

Tasks:

They also confer with supervisors and other staff to monitor progress and discuss adjustments. Element Name: Weighers, Measurers, Checkers, and Samplers, Recordkeeping
occupation_text:
Generated description:
This role involves meticulously verifying and documenting the quantity, quality, and characteristics of incoming and outgoing materials. Professionals accurately weigh, measure, and inspect items against established standards, identifying any discrepancies or defects. They prepare and attach identification labels and collect product samples for further analysis. Key responsibilities include maintaining detailed records of these measurements, weights, and quality checks, ensuring the accuracy of shipping, receiving, and production logs. They also communicate findings and instructions to colleagues, manage their workspace, and ensure all recording equipment is functioning correctly to support precise recordkeeping operations.

ONET description:
Weigh, measure, and check materials, supplies, and equipment for the purpose of keeping relevant records. Duties are primarily clerical by nature. Includes workers who collect and keep record of samples of products or materials.

occupation_text:
Generated description:
This role involves providing comprehensive administrative support to executives. Key daily activities include managing complex schedules, arranging travel, and coordinating meetings. Responsibilities extend to preparing various documents such as reports, correspondence, and financial statements using office software. This position also entails handling incoming and outgoing communications, greeting visitors, and conducting research to compile data for presentations. Duties may also involve overseeing office services, managing records, maintaining databases, performing basic financial tasks, and potentially guiding lower-level staff. Effective organization, communication, and problem-solving are crucial for success in managing daily operations and information flow.

ONET description:

Their role includes operating office equipment, troubleshooting minor issues, and maintaining organized supply levels, often requiring them to adapt to new technologies and assist colleagues with them.

Element Name: Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals meticulously review and process new and existing insurance policies and claims. They verify the accuracy and completeness of information by collecting necessary details from policyholders and reviewing relevant documents and records. A key part of their day involves updating policy information and company records to reflect any changes. They often calculate claim amounts and ensure all documentation is properly prepared, filed, or transmitted for further action or payment. Additionally, they serve customers by providing basic information, corresponding with policyholders and agents to gather missing data, and informing them of their account status or any modifications. Accurate data entry and retrieval using computer systems are fundamental to their daily operations.

ONET description:
Process new insurance policies, modifications to existing policies, and claims forms. Obtain information from policyholders to verify the accuracy and completeness of information on claims forms, applications and related documents, and company records. Update existing policies and company records to reflect changes requested by policyholders and insurance company representatives.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Prepare insurance claim forms or related documents, and review them for completeness.'}, {'Task': 'Calculate amount of claim.'}, {'Task': 'Post or attach information to claim file.'}, {'Task': 'Transmit claims for payment or further investigation.'}, {'Task': 'Contact insured or other involved persons to obtain missing information.'}, {'Task': 'Review insurance policy to determine coverage.'}, {'Task': 'Process and record new insurance policies and claims.'}, {'Task': 'Organize or work with detailed office or warehouse records, using computers to enter, access, search or retrieve data.'}, {'Task': 'Provide customer service, such as limited instructions on proceeding with claims or referrals to auto repair facilities or local contractors.'}, {'Task': 'Correspond with insured or agent to obtain information or to inform them of account status or changes.'}, {'Task': 'Review and verify data, such as age, name, address, and principal sum and value of property, on insurance applications and policies.'}, {'Task': 'Compare information from application to criteria for policy reinstatement, and approve reinstatement when criteria are met.'}, {'Task': 'Examine letters from policyholders or agents, original insurance applications, and other company documents to determine if changes are needed and effects of changes.'}, {'Task': 'Transcribe data to worksheets, and enter data into computer for use in preparing documents and adjusting accounts.'}, {'Task': 'Notify insurance agent and accounting department of policy cancellation.'}]

Element Name: Mail Clerks and Mail Machine Operators, Except Postal Service
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously prepare and process mail. They begin by verifying incoming items for correct addressing and postage, then open, time-stamp, and sort them for distribution. For outgoing mail, they address envelopes, seal them, and affix the correct postage. This includes folding, stuffing, and ensuring materials are ready for dispatch. They also manage the collection of outgoing items and the transfer of sorted mail to designated areas. Maintaining necessary records and ensuring items are in suitable condition for processing are also key responsibilities. They make decisions regarding the best method for sending mail and ensure all parcels and letters meet processing standards.

ONET description:
Prepare incoming and outgoing mail for distribution. Time-stamp, open, read, sort, and route incoming mail; and address, seal, stamp, fold, stuff, and affix postage to outgoing mail or packages. Duties may also include keeping necessary records and completed forms.

[{'Task': 'Wrap packages or bundles by hand, or by using tying machines.'}, {'Task': 'Verify that items are addressed correctly, marked with the proper postage, and in suitable condition for processing.'}, {'Task': 'Remove containers of sorted mail or parcels and transfer them to designated areas according to established procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Sort and route incoming mail, and collect outgoing mail, using carts as necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Affix postage to packages or letters by hand, or stamp materials, using postage meters.'}, {'Task': 'Determine manner in which mail is to be sent, and prepare it for delivery to mailing facilities.'}, {'Task': 'Accept and check containers of mail or parcels from large volume mailers, couriers, and contractors.'}, {'Task': 'Seal or open envelopes, by hand or by using machines.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role manage a wide range of administrative and clerical tasks to ensure smooth office operations. They interact with various people, answering telephones, addressing inquiries, and relaying messages. Key responsibilities include processing and organizing information, maintaining records, and managing correspondence, both physical and digital. This involves compiling, sorting, filing, and updating data using various systems. They also handle routine office equipment, manage supplies, and coordinate schedules or appointments. The work requires attention to detail when proofreading documents, computing data, and ensuring accuracy in all record-keeping and communication activities.

Perform duties too varied and diverse to be classified in any specific office clerical occupation, requiring knowledge of office systems and procedures. Clerical duties may be assigned in accordance with the office procedures of individual establishments and may include a combination of answering telephones, bookkeeping, typing or word processing, office machine operation, and filing.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role primarily operate and maintain various types of office machines, ensuring efficient production of documents and materials. They begin by reviewing job orders to understand production requirements, including quantity and materials. Subsequently, they set up machines by adjusting settings like speed and ink flow, and load them with necessary supplies. Throughout the process, they closely monitor machine operation, making adjustments as needed and performing routine cleaning and minor repairs. After completion, they sort, assemble, and proofread the work, record production details, and deliver or file the finished products. They also manage supply levels and can be responsible for processing payments or billing information.

ONET description:
Operate one or more of a variety of office machines, such as photocopying, photographic, and duplicating machines, or other office machines.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously review written materials to identify and indicate errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, and arrangement. They carefully compare information against original sources or other records to detect inconsistencies and ensure accuracy. After marking corrections, they may consult with authors or editors to discuss necessary changes. They also verify that all previously made corrections have been implemented accurately. In some instances, they might write original content such as headlines or captions. The work involves consulting reference materials and utilizing various digital resources to maintain high standards of textual integrity and adherence to established guidelines.

ONET description:
Read transcript or proof type setup to detect and mark for correction any grammatical, typographical, or compositional errors. Excludes workers whose primary duty is editing copy. Includes proofreaders of braille.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Mark copy to indicate and correct errors in type, arrangement, grammar, punctuation, or spelling, using standard printers\' marks.'}, {'Task': 'Read corrected copies or proofs to ensure that all corrections have been made.'}, {'Task': 'Correct or record omissions, errors, or inconsistencies found.'}, {'Task': 'Compare information or figures on one record against same data on other records, or with original copy, to detect errors.'}, {'Task': 'Route proofs with marked corrections to authors, editors, typists, or typesetters for correction or reprinting.'}, {'Task': 'Consult reference books or secure aid of readers to check references with rules of grammar and composition.'}, {'Task': 'Consult with authors and editors regarding manuscript changes and suggestions.'}, {'Task': 'Archive documents, conduct research, and read copy, using the internet and various computer programs.'}, {'Task': 'Write original content, such as headlines, cutlines, captions, and cover copy.'}]

Element Name: First-Line Supervisors of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These individuals directly oversee and coordinate the work of teams involved in agricultural, forestry, and aquacultural activities. They assign tasks such as animal care, equipment operation, and land management, ensuring that safety regulations are consistently followed and providing necessary training. They monitor conditions, inspect crops and equipment, and make decisions regarding cultivation, harvesting, and maintenance. These supervisors communicate with management to plan procedures, evaluate conditions, and manage resources, including scheduling work crews and transportation. They also maintain records, track inventory, and may be involved in purchasing supplies and overseeing facility upkeep and repairs.

ONET description:
Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of agricultural, forestry, aquacultural, and related workers.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Assign tasks such as feeding and treatment of animals, and cleaning and maintenance of animal quarters.'}, {'Task': 'Record the numbers and types of fish or shellfish reared, harvested, released, sold, and shipped.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor workers to ensure that safety regulations are followed, warning or disciplining those who violate safety regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Observe animals for signs of illness, injury, or unusual behavior, notifying veterinarians or managers as warranted.'}, {'Task': 'Observe fish and beds or ponds to detect diseases, monitor fish growth, determine quality of fish, or determine completeness of harvesting.'}, {'Task': 'Train workers in tree felling or bucking, operation of tractors or loading machines, yarding or loading techniques, or safety regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Treat animal illnesses or injuries, following experience or instructions of veterinarians.'}, {'Task': 'Train workers in spawning, rearing, cultivating, and harvesting methods, and in the use of equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Train workers in techniques such as planting, harvesting, weeding, or insect identification and in the use of safety measures.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with managers to evaluate weather or soil conditions, to develop plans or procedures, or to discuss issues such as changes in fertilizers, herbicides, or cultivating techniques.'}, {'Task': 'Communicate with forestry personnel regarding forest harvesting or forest management plans, procedures, or schedules.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect crops, fields, or plant stock to determine conditions and need for cultivating, spraying, weeding, or harvesting.'}, {'Task': 'Coordinate dismantling, moving, and setting up equipment at new work sites.'}, {'Task': 'Coordinate the selection and movement of logs from storage areas, according to transportation schedules or production requirements.'}, {'Task': 'Schedule work crews, equipment, or transportation for several different work locations.'}, {'Task': 'Drive or operate farm machinery, such as trucks, tractors, or self-propelled harvesters, to transport workers or supplies or to cultivate or harvest fields.'}, {'Task': 'Perform both supervisory and management functions, such as accounting, marketing, and personnel work.'}, {'Task': 'Transport or arrange for transport of animals, equipment, food, animal feed, and other supplies to and from work sites.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect buildings, fences, fields or ranges, supplies, and equipment to determine work to be performed.'}, {'Task': 'Read inventory records, customer orders, or shipping schedules to determine required activities.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect facilities to determine maintenance needs.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with managers to determine production requirements, conditions of equipment and supplies, and work schedules.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare and maintain time or payroll reports, as well as details of personnel actions, such as performance evaluations, hires, promotions, or disciplinary actions.'}, {'Task': 'Requisition or purchase supplies, such as insecticides, machine parts or lubricants, or tools.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor or oversee construction projects, such as horticultural buildings or irrigation systems.'}, {'Task': 'Issue equipment, such as farm implements, machinery, ladders, or containers to workers, and collect equipment when work is complete.'}, {'Task': 'Calculate or monitor budgets for maintenance or development of collections, grounds, or infrastructure.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously examine various agricultural products and related operational processes. They assess processing equipment and facilities, as well as activities in resource extraction, to ensure adherence to established health, quality, and safety standards. This involves interpreting and enforcing governing regulations and legal mandates. They actively communicate required standards to personnel, often explaining compliance requirements. A key part of their day includes monitoring operations and critically evaluating them for safety and conformity. They make judgments and decisions based on their observations, ensuring that products and practices meet established criteria before they are approved or allowed to proceed.

ONET description:
Inspect agricultural commodities, processing equipment, and facilities, and fish and logging operations, to ensure compliance with regulations and laws governing health, quality, and safety.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Inspect food products and processing procedures to determine whether products are safe to eat.'}, {'Task': 'Interpret and enforce government acts and regulations and explain required standards to agricultural workers.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously observe animals to identify reproductive cycles and signs of health issues. They make critical decisions when selecting animals and specimens for breeding, carefully considering genetic lineage and desired traits to achieve specific offspring characteristics. This involves detailed record-keeping of animal growth, diets, and reproductive events. They also manage animal living conditions by maintaining enclosures and ensuring access to food and water. Additionally, they administer basic care for minor health concerns and arrange professional veterinary assistance when needed. This role requires careful attention to detail in both observation and documentation to ensure successful outcomes in animal reproduction and welfare.

ONET description:
Select and breed animals according to their genealogy, characteristics, and offspring. May require knowledge of artificial insemination techniques and equipment use. May involve keeping records on heats, birth intervals, or pedigree.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Feed and water animals, and clean and disinfect pens, cages, yards, and hutches.'}, {'Task': 'Observe animals in heat to detect approach of estrus and exercise animals to induce or hasten estrus, if necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Treat minor injuries and ailments and contact veterinarians to obtain treatment for animals with serious illnesses or injuries.'}, {'Task': 'Purchase and stock supplies of feed and medicines.'}, {'Task': 'Select animals to be bred, and semen specimens to be used, according to knowledge of animals, genealogies, traits, and desired offspring characteristics.'}, {'Task': 'Examine animals to detect symptoms of illness or injury.'}, {'Task': 'Build hutches, pens, and fenced yards.'}, {'Task': 'Record animal characteristics such as weights, growth patterns, and diets.'}, {'Task': 'Brand, tattoo, or tag animals to allow animal identification.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously examine agricultural products, making critical judgments based on established criteria. They assess items by evaluating attributes like size, weight, color, and overall condition. Products are carefully handled, with inferior or defective items separated and discarded. Acceptable items are then placed into containers, often with specific grade markings. This process ensures that products meet quality standards for further handling, processing, or distribution. Attention to detail is paramount throughout the sorting and grading activities to maintain consistency and conformity to specifications.

ONET description:
Grade, sort, or classify unprocessed food and other agricultural products by size, weight, color, or condition.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Place products in containers according to grade and mark grades on containers.'}, {'Task': 'Weigh products or estimate their weight, visually or by feel.'}, {'Task': 'Discard inferior or defective products or foreign matter, and place acceptable products in containers for further processing.'}, {'Task': 'Grade and sort products according to factors such as color, species, length, width, appearance, feel, smell, and quality to ensure correct processing and usage.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role operate and control specialized machinery to support various agricultural activities. They are responsible for preparing soil for planting, managing crop cultivation, and executing harvests. This includes tasks such as driving and maneuvering equipment, attaching implements like plows or harvesters, and operating controls to manage functions like spraying solutions or planting seeds. They also monitor equipment performance, identify malfunctions through observation and listening, and perform necessary adjustments, repairs, or maintenance. Additionally, they may handle the loading and unloading of materials, ensuring the smooth progression of production cycles and responding to operational needs.

ONET description:
Drive and control equipment to support agricultural activities such as tilling soil; planting, cultivating, and harvesting crops; feeding and herding livestock; or removing animal waste. May perform tasks such as crop baling or hay bucking. May operate stationary equipment to perform post-harvest tasks such as husking, shelling, threshing, and ginning.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Load and unload crops or containers of materials, manually or using conveyors, handtrucks, forklifts, or transfer augers.'}, {'Task': 'Mix specified materials or chemicals, and dump solutions, powders, or seeds into planter or sprayer machinery.'}, {'Task': 'Spray fertilizer or pesticide solutions to control insects, fungus and weed growth, and diseases, using hand sprayers.'}, {'Task': 'Observe and listen to machinery operation to detect equipment malfunctions.'}, {'Task': 'Manipulate controls to set, activate, and adjust mechanisms on machinery.'}, {'Task': 'Operate or tend equipment used in agricultural production, such as tractors, combines, and irrigation equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Adjust, repair, and service farm machinery and notify supervisors when machinery malfunctions.'}, {'Task': 'Attach farm implements such as plows, discs, sprayers, or harvesters to tractors, using bolts and hand tools.'}]

Element Name: Farmworkers and Laborers, Crop, Nursery, and Greenhouse
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are actively involved in the cultivation and harvesting of various crops. Their daily duties include planting seeds, tending to plants through weeding and pruning, and preparing the soil by tilling and applying necessary substances. They also operate machinery for these processes. After harvest, they meticulously clean, sort, and pack the produce. This work often involves using hand tools and may extend to repairing equipment and structures, and managing irrigation systems. They are responsible for monitoring crop progress and ensuring quality control. Additionally, they may guide and oversee the work of temporary staff during peak periods, contributing to the overall success of agricultural operations.

ONET description:
Manually plant, cultivate, and harvest vegetables, fruits, nuts, horticultural specialties, and field crops. Use hand tools, such as shovels, trowels, hoes, tampers, pruning hooks, shears, and knives. Duties may include tilling soil and applying fertilizers; transplanting, weeding, thinning, or pruning crops; applying pesticides; or cleaning, grading, sorting, packing, and loading harvested products. May construct trellises, repair fences and farm buildings, or participate in irrigation activities.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Record information about crops, such as pesticide use, yields, or costs.'}, {'Task': 'Direct and monitor the work of casual and seasonal help during planting and harvesting.'}, {'Task': 'Participate in the inspection, grading, sorting, storage, and post-harvest treatment of crops.'}, {'Task': 'Harvest plants, and transplant or pot and label them.'}, {'Task': 'Repair and maintain farm vehicles, implements, and mechanical equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Harvest fruits and vegetables by hand.'}, {'Task': 'Set up and operate irrigation equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Inform farmers or farm managers of crop progress.'}, {'Task': 'Identify plants, pests, and weeds to determine the selection and application of pesticides and fertilizers.'}, {'Task': 'Operate tractors, tractor-drawn machinery, and self-propelled machinery to plow, harrow and fertilize soil, or to plant, cultivate, spray and harvest crops.'}, {'Task': 'Load agricultural products into trucks, and drive trucks to market or storage facilities.'}, {'Task': 'Clean work areas, and maintain grounds and landscaping.'}]

Element Name: Farmworkers, Farm, Ranch, and Aquacultural Animals
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the daily care and well-being of living creatures. This involves providing essential sustenance like food and water, and ensuring it is readily available. They monitor the animals' health, observing for any signs of illness or injury, and may administer treatments or contact specialists for more complex medical needs. Tasks also include managing animal movement, such as guiding them to different areas or loading them for transport. Maintaining the cleanliness and functionality of living quarters and equipment is crucial, requiring regular cleaning and repairs. Additionally, they may apply identification marks to animals and keep records to track their condition and characteristics. This work requires careful observation, diligent attention to detail, and the ability to perform a variety of physical tasks.

ONET description:
Attend to live farm, ranch, open range or aquacultural animals that may include cattle, sheep, swine, goats, horses and other equines, poultry, rabbits, finfish, shellfish, and bees. Attend to animals produced for animal products, such as meat, fur, skins, feathers, eggs, milk, and honey. Duties may include feeding, watering, herding, grazing, milking, castrating, branding, de-beaking, weighing, catching, and loading animals. May maintain records on animals; examine animals to detect diseases and injuries; assist in birth deliveries; and administer medications, vaccinations, or insecticides as appropriate. May clean and maintain animal housing areas. Includes workers who shear wool from sheep and collect eggs in hatcheries.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Feed and water livestock and monitor food and water supplies.'}, {'Task': 'Herd livestock to pastures for grazing or to scales, trucks, or other enclosures.'}, {'Task': 'Examine animals to detect illness, injury, or disease, and to check physical characteristics, such as rate of weight gain.'}, {'Task': 'Provide medical treatment, such as administering medications and vaccinations, or arrange for veterinarians to provide more extensive treatment.'}, {'Task': 'Mark livestock to identify ownership and grade, using brands, tags, paint, or tattoos.'}, {'Task': 'Drive trucks, tractors, and other equipment to distribute feed to animals.'}, {'Task': 'Segregate animals according to weight, age, color, and physical condition.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect, maintain, and repair equipment, machinery, buildings, pens, yards, and fences.'}, {'Task': 'Move equipment, poultry, or livestock from one location to another, manually or using trucks or carts.'}, {'Task': 'Clean stalls, pens, and equipment, using disinfectant solutions, brushes, shovels, water hoses, or pumps.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for locating, trapping, and gathering wild animals and aquatic plants and creatures. This involves selecting appropriate tools and methods for setting traps or using various equipment for harvesting. They must monitor conditions, including weather and equipment status, making decisions to ensure operations are conducted safely and effectively. Tasks include operating vessels and navigational instruments, maintaining equipment, and performing minor repairs. They also ensure harvested items meet required standards and manage the loading and unloading of supplies and equipment. This work often requires travel to remote areas and direct interaction with the environment to achieve collection goals.

ONET description:
Hunt, trap, catch, or gather wild animals or aquatic animals and plants. May use nets, traps, or other equipment. May haul catch onto ship or other vessel.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Steer vessels and operate navigational instruments.'}, {'Task': 'Remove catches from fishing equipment and measure them to ensure compliance with legal size.'}, {'Task': 'Direct fishing or hunting operations, and supervise crew members.'}, {'Task': 'Interpret weather and vessel conditions to determine appropriate responses.'}, {'Task': 'Travel on foot, by vehicle, or by equipment such as boats, snowmobiles, helicopters, snowshoes, or skis to reach hunting areas.'}, {'Task': 'Select, bait, and set traps, and lay poison along trails, according to species, size, habits, and environs of birds or animals and reasons for trapping them.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain engines, fishing gear, and other on-board equipment and perform minor repairs.'}, {'Task': 'Connect accessories such as floats, weights, flags, lights, or markers to nets, lines, or traps.'}, {'Task': 'Wash decks, conveyors, knives, and other equipment, using brushes, detergents, and water.'}, {'Task': 'Harvest marine life for human or animal consumption, using diving or dredging equipment, traps, barges, rods, reels, or tackle.'}, {'Task': 'Oversee the purchase of supplies, gear, and equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Load and unload vessel equipment and supplies, by hand or using hoisting equipment.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role perform essential manual labor to develop, maintain, and protect natural areas. They actively participate in planting and nurturing young vegetation and contribute to pest and disease management to safeguard plant health. A key responsibility involves constructing structures designed to manage water flow, prevent soil erosion, and retain vital nutrients. They also engage in fire management, which may include fighting active fires or conducting controlled burns under supervision. This work requires conferring with colleagues to coordinate efforts, discuss operational needs, and ensure safety protocols are followed, all while monitoring equipment for proper functioning and performing related tasks.

ONET description:
Under supervision, perform manual labor necessary to develop, maintain, or protect areas such as forests, forested areas, woodlands, wetlands, and rangelands through such activities as raising and transporting seedlings; combating insects, pests, and diseases harmful to plant life; and building structures to control water, erosion, and leaching of soil. Includes forester aides, seedling pullers, tree planters, and gatherers of nontimber forestry products such as pine straw.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Check equipment to ensure that it is operating properly.'}, {'Task': 'Fight forest fires or perform prescribed burning tasks under the direction of fire suppression officers or forestry technicians.'}, {'Task': 'Perform fire protection or suppression duties, such as constructing fire breaks or disposing of brush.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with other workers to discuss issues, such as safety, cutting heights, or work needs.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this role assess trees, considering characteristics like twist, rot, and lean, to determine the safest and most effective cutting strategy. They use specialized equipment to make precise cuts, controlling the direction of the fall and minimizing damage to the tree and surrounding area. This involves clearing work sites, creating escape routes, and strategically placing wedges or jacks. After felling, they often measure and cut trees into specific lengths, ensuring quality and adherence to standards. They are responsible for maintaining their tools and equipment, including cleaning, lubricating, and sharpening them. Additionally, they identify and tag unsafe trees to prevent accidents.

ONET description:
Use axes or chainsaws to fell trees using knowledge of tree characteristics and cutting techniques to control direction of fall and minimize tree damage.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Stop saw engines, pull cutting bars from cuts, and run to safety as tree falls.'}, {'Task': 'Appraise trees for certain characteristics, such as twist, rot, and heavy limb growth, and gauge amount and direction of lean, to determine how to control the direction of a tree\'s fall with the least damage.'}, {'Task': 'Saw back-cuts, leaving sufficient sound wood to control direction of fall.'}, {'Task': 'Clear brush from work areas and escape routes, and cut saplings and other trees from direction of falls, using axes, chainsaws, or bulldozers.'}, {'Task': 'Measure felled trees and cut them into specified log lengths, using chain saws and axes.'}, {'Task': 'Assess logs after cutting to ensure that the quality and length are correct.'}, {'Task': 'Determine position, direction, and depth of cuts to be made, and placement of wedges or jacks.'}, {'Task': 'Control the direction of a tree\'s fall by scoring cutting lines with axes, sawing undercuts along scored lines with chainsaws, knocking slabs from cuts with single-bit axes, and driving wedges.'}, {'Task': 'Trim off the tops and limbs of trees, using chainsaws, delimbers, or axes.'}, {'Task': 'Select trees to be cut down, assessing factors such as site, terrain, and weather conditions before beginning work.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain and repair chainsaws and other equipment, cleaning, oiling, and greasing equipment, and sharpening equipment properly.'}, {'Task': 'Insert jacks or drive wedges behind saws to prevent binding of saws and to start trees falling.'}, {'Task': 'Tag unsafe trees with high-visibility ribbons.'}]

Generated description:
Operators utilize specialized vehicles and equipment to move and process harvested materials. They perform pre-operation inspections and routine maintenance to ensure safety and functionality, making critical decisions regarding equipment operation and control. Their daily activities involve navigating various terrains, manipulating materials with mounted accessories, and transporting them to designated areas. They also engage in tasks such as clearing land and road maintenance. Accurate record-keeping through job or shift reports is essential. Operators must continuously monitor equipment performance and troubleshoot any issues that arise, ensuring efficient and safe completion of their duties. They may also assess material quality against set standards.

ONET description:
Drive logging tractor or wheeled vehicle equipped with one or more accessories, such as bulldozer blade, frontal shear, grapple, logging arch, cable winches, hoisting rack, or crane boom, to fell tree; to skid, load, unload, or stack logs; or to pull stumps or clear brush. Includes operating stand-alone logging machines, such as log chippers.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Inspect equipment for safety prior to use, and perform necessary basic maintenance tasks.'}, {'Task': 'Control hydraulic tractors equipped with tree clamps and booms to lift, swing, and bunch sheared trees.'}, {'Task': 'Grade logs according to characteristics such as knot size and straightness, and according to established industry or company standards.'}, {'Task': 'Drive straight or articulated tractors equipped with accessories such as bulldozer blades, grapples, logging arches, cable winches, and crane booms to skid, load, unload, or stack logs, pull stumps, or clear brush.'}, {'Task': 'Drive crawler or wheeled tractors to drag or transport logs from felling sites to log landing areas for processing and loading.'}, {'Task': 'Fill out required job or shift report forms.'}, {'Task': 'Drive tractors for building or repairing logging and skid roads.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously inspect and evaluate raw materials, often involving precise measurements of volume, weight, and dimensions. They identify and assess material characteristics and defects, applying established criteria to determine grades. This requires careful observation and judgment to ascertain marketable value. They document findings, often using specialized tools or electronic devices to record data. This information is crucial for subsequent processes, ensuring materials are sorted, routed, or processed according to their assessed quality and grade. They may also apply identification marks to materials for tracking and grading purposes, making decisions about how to handle substandard or special-quality items.

ONET description:
Grade logs or estimate the marketable content or value of logs or pulpwood in sorting yards, millpond, log deck, or similar locations. Inspect logs for defects or measure logs to determine volume.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Evaluate log characteristics and determine grades, using established criteria.'}, {'Task': 'Record data about individual trees or load volumes into tally books or hand-held collection terminals.'}, {'Task': 'Measure felled logs or loads of pulpwood to calculate volume, weight, dimensions, and marketable value, using measuring devices and conversion tables.'}, {'Task': 'Paint identification marks of specified colors on logs to identify grades or species, using spray cans, or call out grades to log markers.'}, {'Task': 'Jab logs with metal ends of scale sticks, and inspect logs to ascertain characteristics or defects such as water damage, splits, knots, broken ends, rotten areas, twists, and curves.'}, {'Task': 'Identify logs of substandard or special grade so that they can be returned to shippers, regraded, recut, or transferred for other processing.'}]

Element Name: First-Line Supervisors of Construction Trades and Extraction Workers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
This role involves overseeing and coordinating the daily activities of construction and extraction teams. Key responsibilities include assigning tasks, ensuring work progresses according to specifications, and verifying safety protocols are followed. This position requires reading blueprints and planning procedures, as well as estimating material and personnel needs for upcoming projects. There is a significant focus on problem-solving, whether addressing production issues or equipment malfunctions, and collaborating with various personnel to resolve challenges. Additionally, individuals in this role are responsible for training new team members, ordering necessary supplies, and maintaining accurate operational records. They also contribute to personnel management by recommending actions such as promotions or hires.

ONET description:
Directly supervise and coordinate activities of construction or extraction workers.

Tasks:

These professionals oversee teams responsible for installing solar systems. They assess potential sites, determine design requirements, and ensure installations meet safety and code standards. They coordinate schedules, budgets, and resources, including personnel, equipment, and materials, to manage project timelines effectively. This involves estimating needs, preparing proposals, and purchasing or renting necessary items. They provide technical guidance to installation crews, troubleshoot issues, and monitor the progress of work, including that of subcontractors, to maintain project plans. Additionally, they arrange for necessary inspections and perform initial system testing to confirm functionality before customer implementation, always looking for ways to improve efficiency and reduce costs.

Direct work crews installing residential or commercial solar photovoltaic or thermal systems.

Generated description:
These professionals construct, assemble, maintain, and repair large-scale vessels. They meticulously study blueprints to understand dimensions and relationships between parts, often marking and laying out heavy metal sections. Using various hand and power tools, they position, align, and secure these sections, then shape and join them through methods like welding or bolting. Their work also involves inspecting components for defects, repairing or replacing faulty parts, and ensuring the integrity of joints and fittings. They conduct tests to confirm proper function and may direct cleaning operations. Attention to detail and precision are critical throughout the process to ensure the safe and effective operation of the equipment.

ONET description:
Construct, assemble, maintain, and repair stationary steam boilers and boiler house auxiliaries. Align structures or plate sections to assemble boiler frame tanks or vats, following blueprints. Work involves use of hand and power tools, plumb bobs, levels, wedges, dogs, or turnbuckles. Assist in testing assembled vessels. Direct cleaning of boilers and boiler furnaces. Inspect and repair boiler fittings, such as safety valves, regulators, automatic-control mechanisms, water columns, and auxiliary machines.

Generated description:
Workers in this role meticulously lay and bind various building materials using mortar to construct or repair structures. They begin by interpreting blueprints and drawings to plan their work, calculating angles and determining alignment. Using tools, they measure, mark, and create guidelines, breaking or cutting materials to size as needed. Workers carefully construct corners and lay courses, ensuring vertical and horizontal accuracy with levels and plumb lines. They apply mortar, remove excess, and finish joints for a uniform appearance. Throughout the process, they monitor their work for quality and may also be responsible for mixing materials and cleaning surfaces. Additionally, they inspect existing brickwork to identify and perform necessary repairs.

ONET description:
Lay and bind building materials, such as brick, structural tile, concrete block, cinder block, glass block, and terra-cotta block, with mortar and other substances, to construct or repair walls, partitions, arches, sewers, and other structures.

Generated description:
Workers in this role prepare and place stone for various construction projects. They begin by interpreting blueprints and laying out project foundations using measuring tools and guidelines. They mix and apply mortar, carefully setting and aligning stone pieces according to precise patterns. They also shape, trim, and cut stone using specialized equipment and hand tools to achieve desired forms. Responsibilities include finishing joints, cleaning excess materials, and ensuring a smooth, attractive final appearance. They also repair existing stone structures by replacing damaged sections or patching cracks. Throughout the process, they manage materials, operate tools safely, and monitor the quality of their work to meet project specifications.

ONET description:
Build stone structures, such as piers, walls, and abutments. Lay walks, curbstones, or special types of masonry for vats, tanks, and floors.

Generated description:
Individuals in this occupation interpret blueprints and project plans to determine necessary materials and dimensions. They meticulously measure and mark materials, then shape or cut them to specified measurements using various tools. They assemble and fasten materials to create frameworks, ensuring structures are plumb and level. This involves installing fixtures like windows, frames, and flooring, and repairing or replacing damaged sections. Safety protocols are strictly followed, and work areas are kept clean. They also maintain records of activities, document progress, and may schedule work crews. Decision-making involves selecting appropriate tools and methods for assembly, installation, and repair tasks, prioritizing structural integrity and adherence to plans.

ONET description:
Construct, erect, install, or repair structures and fixtures made of wood and comparable materials, such as concrete forms; building frameworks, including partitions, joists, studding, and rafters; and wood stairways, window and door frames, and hardwood floors. May also install cabinets, siding, drywall, and batt or roll insulation. Includes brattice builders who build doors or brattices (ventilation walls or partitions) in underground passageways.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role prepare surfaces by inspecting for imperfections and making necessary corrections to ensure a smooth foundation. They accurately measure and cut materials according to diagrams and specifications, calculating the quantity needed for the job. They meticulously lay out and install materials, joining edges as required for a seamless finish. They carefully trim and fit materials along edges and openings, ensuring secure attachment using various methods. Throughout the process, they manage resources, including the removal of old materials and furniture, and maintain a clean worksite. They also perform quality control checks, make adjustments for optimal appearance and durability, and complete the installation by fastening necessary hardware.

ONET description:
Lay and install carpet from rolls or blocks on floors. Install padding and trim flooring materials.

[{'Task': 'Inspect the surface to be covered to determine its condition, and correct any imperfections that might show through carpet or cause carpet to wear unevenly.'}, {'Task': 'Roll out, measure, mark, and cut carpeting to size with a carpet knife, following floor sketches and allowing extra carpet for final fitting.'}, {'Task': 'Join edges of carpet and seam edges where necessary, by sewing or by using tape with glue and heated carpet iron.'}, {'Task': 'Cut and trim carpet to fit along wall edges, openings, and projections, finishing the edges with a wall trimmer.'}, {'Task': 'Plan the layout of the carpet, allowing for expected traffic patterns and placing seams for best appearance and longest wear.'}, {'Task': 'Stretch carpet to align with walls and ensure a smooth surface, and press carpet in place over tack strips or use staples, tape, tacks or glue to hold carpet in place.'}, {'Task': 'Take measurements and study floor sketches to calculate the area to be carpeted and the amount of material needed.'}, {'Task': 'Install carpet on some floors using adhesive, following prescribed method.'}, {'Task': 'Clean up before and after installation, including vacuuming carpet and discarding remnant pieces.'}, {'Task': 'Measure, cut and install tackless strips along the baseboard or wall.'}, {'Task': 'Nail tack strips around area to be carpeted or use old strips to attach edges of new carpet.'}, {'Task': 'Cut carpet padding to size and install padding, following prescribed method.'}, {'Task': 'Fasten metal treads across door openings or where carpet meets flooring to hold carpet in place.'}, {'Task': 'Draw building diagrams and record dimensions.'}, {'Task': 'Move furniture from area to be carpeted and remove old carpet and padding.'}, {'Task': 'Cut and bind material.'}]

Element Name: Floor Layers, Except Carpet, Wood, and Hard Tiles
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this role prepare surfaces for new coverings by cleaning, smoothing, and ensuring they are firm and dry. They meticulously measure and mark guidelines, cutting materials to fit precisely around obstacles and for specific designs. Their day involves applying adhesives and then laying out, positioning, and adhering shock-absorbing, sound-deadening, or decorative coverings to floors and other surfaces. This requires careful attention to detail to keep courses straight and ensure tight joints. They also trim excess materials and roll or press the coverings to create a smooth, finished appearance. Responsibilities include removing old coverings and any necessary fixtures before beginning the installation process, and ensuring the final surface is free of excess adhesive.

ONET description:
Apply blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing, sound-deadening, or decorative coverings to floors.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Sweep, scrape, sand, or chip dirt and irregularities to clean base surfaces, correcting imperfections that may show through the covering.'}, {'Task': 'Cut flooring material to fit around obstructions.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect surface to be covered to ensure that it is firm and dry.'}, {'Task': 'Trim excess covering materials, tack edges, and join sections of covering material to form tight joint.'}, {'Task': 'Form a smooth foundation by stapling plywood or Masonite over the floor or by brushing waterproof compound onto surface and filling cracks with plaster, putty, or grout to seal pores.'}, {'Task': 'Measure and mark guidelines on surfaces or foundations, using chalk lines and dividers.'}, {'Task': 'Cut covering and foundation materials, according to blueprints and sketches.'}, {'Task': 'Roll and press sheet wall and floor covering into cement base to smooth and finish surface, using hand roller.'}, {'Task': 'Apply adhesive cement to floor or wall material to join and adhere foundation material.'}, {'Task': 'Determine traffic areas and decide location of seams.'}, {'Task': 'Lay out, position, and apply shock-absorbing, sound-deadening, or decorative coverings to floors, walls, and cabinets, following guidelines to keep courses straight and create designs.'}, {'Task': 'Remove excess cement to clean finished surface.'}, {'Task': 'Disconnect and remove appliances, light fixtures, and worn floor and wall covering from floors, walls, and cabinets.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role prepare and treat wooden surfaces to achieve a desired aesthetic and protective finish. They begin by inspecting the surface, meticulously scraping and sanding edges and difficult-to-reach areas to ensure a uniform smoothness. Using specialized equipment, they guide sanding machines over the entire surface until it is completely smooth, removing imperfections and old coatings. After ensuring the surface is clean and free of debris, they apply protective coatings and sealants. This involves careful application of materials and often multiple layers, with attention to detail to guarantee the quality and durability of the final outcome. They also monitor their work throughout the process to maintain high standards.

ONET description:
Scrape and sand wooden floors to smooth surfaces using floor scraper and floor sanding machine, and apply coats of finish.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Buff and vacuum floors to ensure their cleanliness prior to the application of finish.'}, {'Task': 'Scrape and sand floor edges and areas inaccessible to floor sanders, using scrapers, disk-type sanders, and sandpaper.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect floors for smoothness.'}, {'Task': 'Attach sandpaper to rollers of sanding machines.'}, {'Task': 'Guide sanding machines over surfaces of floors until surfaces are smooth.'}, {'Task': 'Apply filler compound and coats of finish to floors to seal wood.'}, {'Task': 'Remove excess glue from joints, using knives, scrapers, or wood chisels.'}]

Generated description:
This role involves carefully preparing surfaces, often by removing old materials or applying coatings, before applying durable tiles and stones. Professionals measure and mark areas according to plans, ensuring precise layouts and patterns for a desired aesthetic. They mix and apply adhesives or mortars, cut materials to fit specific spaces and around obstacles, and then meticulously set them in place. Levels and straightedges are used to ensure alignment. Tasks also include finishing joints, applying sealants to protect surfaces, and sometimes repairing or replacing damaged sections. This work requires attention to detail, problem-solving for complex layouts, and coordinating actions for accurate installation.

ONET description:
Apply hard tile, stone, and comparable materials to walls, floors, ceilings, countertops, and roof decks.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Align and straighten tile using levels, squares, and straightedges.'}, {'Task': 'Finish and dress the joints and wipe excess grout from between tiles, using damp sponge.'}, {'Task': 'Cut and shape tile to fit around obstacles and into odd spaces and corners, using hand and power cutting tools.'}, {'Task': 'Determine and implement the best layout to achieve a desired pattern.'}, {'Task': 'Mix, apply, and spread plaster, concrete, mortar, cement, mastic, glue or other adhesives to form a bed for the tiles, using brush, trowel and screed.'}, {'Task': 'Study blueprints and examine surface to be covered to determine amount of material needed.'}, {'Task': 'Measure and mark surfaces to be tiled, following blueprints.'}, {'Task': 'Lay and set mosaic tiles to create decorative wall, mural, and floor designs.'}, {'Task': 'Apply mortar to tile back, position the tile, and press or tap with trowel handle to affix tile to base.'}, {'Task': 'Mix and apply mortar or cement to edges and ends of drain tiles to seal halves and joints.'}, {'Task': 'Apply a sealer to make grout stain- and water-resistant.'}, {'Task': 'Level concrete and allow to dry.'}, {'Task': 'Measure and cut metal lath to size for walls and ceilings, using tin snips.'}, {'Task': 'Install and anchor fixtures in designated positions, using hand tools.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare surfaces for tiling by attaching lath or waterproof paper, or by applying a cement mortar coat to a metal screen.'}, {'Task': 'Remove and replace cracked or damaged tile.'}, {'Task': 'Cut tile backing to required size, using shears.'}, {'Task': 'Remove any old tile, grout and adhesive using chisels and scrapers and clean the surface carefully.'}, {'Task': 'Cut, surface, polish, and install marble and granite or install pre-cast terrazzo, granite or marble units.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for preparing, pouring, and finishing concrete surfaces. They begin by setting and aligning forms that will contain the concrete, ensuring they are correctly positioned for the desired pitch and depth. They then direct the placement and spreading of concrete, using tools to level and smooth the material. Throughout the process, they monitor environmental factors that might affect how the concrete cures. They also use specialized tools to shape edges, create expansion joints, and apply hardening or sealing compounds. Additionally, they may install fixtures, repair existing concrete by patching or grinding, and prepare surfaces for further treatment.

ONET description:
Smooth and finish surfaces of poured concrete, such as floors, walks, sidewalks, roads, or curbs using a variety of hand and power tools. Align forms for sidewalks, curbs, or gutters; patch voids; and use saws to cut expansion joints.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Check the forms that hold the concrete to see that they are properly constructed.'}, {'Task': 'Set the forms that hold concrete to the desired pitch and depth, and align them.'}, {'Task': 'Spread, level, and smooth concrete, using rake, shovel, hand or power trowel, hand or power screed, and float.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor how the wind, heat, or cold affect the curing of the concrete throughout the entire process.'}, {'Task': 'Mold expansion joints and edges, using edging tools, jointers, and straightedge.'}, {'Task': 'Signal truck driver to position truck to facilitate pouring concrete, and move chute to direct concrete on forms.'}, {'Task': 'Direct the casting of the concrete and supervise laborers who use shovels or special tools to spread it.'}, {'Task': 'Produce rough concrete.'}, {'Task': 'Install anchor bolts, steel plates, door sills and other fixtures in freshly poured concrete or pattern or stamp the surface to provide a decorative finish.'}, {'Task': 'Wet Generated description:
Individuals in this role prepare and apply mixtures for durable and decorative surfaces. They meticulously measure and combine ingredients, ensuring proper consistency for application. Their work involves spreading, leveling, and smoothing these mixtures using various tools. They also install division strips to create designs or prevent cracking, and embed chips or other decorative elements into the surface. Once applied, they grind and polish the material to achieve the desired finish, sometimes using portable equipment for intricate areas. Finally, they clean, seal, and cure the surfaces, ensuring a smooth, uniform, and long-lasting result. This requires careful monitoring of materials and procedures, along with precise execution.

ONET description:
Apply a mixture of cement, sand, pigment, or marble chips to floors, stairways, and cabinet fixtures to fashion durable and decorative surfaces.

[{'Task': 'Measure designated amounts of ingredients for terrazzo or grout, according to standard formulas and specifications, using graduated containers and scales, and load ingredients into portable Generated description:
Individuals in this role perform essential physical labor at various work sites. They prepare the area by clearing debris, digging trenches, and compacting earth to specifications. They often operate and maintain a variety of tools and equipment, ensuring they are functioning properly and safely. These workers might signal operators to guide the movement of materials and machinery. They also read plans to understand work requirements, measure and mark areas for construction, and load or unload materials, distributing them as needed. Additionally, they may assist other craftspeople with their tasks, contributing to the overall project completion.

ONET description:
Perform tasks involving physical labor at construction sites. May operate hand and power tools of all types: air hammers, earth tampers, cement mixers, small mechanical hoists, surveying and measuring equipment, and a variety of other equipment and instruments. May clean and prepare sites, dig trenches, set braces to support the sides of excavations, erect scaffolding, and clean up rubble, debris, and other waste materials. May assist other craft workers.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Tend pumps, compressors, or generators to provide power for tools, machinery, or equipment or to heat or move materials, such as asphalt.'}, {'Task': 'Lubricate, clean, or repair machinery, equipment, or tools.'}, {'Task': 'Signal equipment operators to facilitate alignment, movement, or adjustment of machinery, equipment, or materials.'}, {'Task': 'Read plans, instructions, or specifications to determine work activities.'}, {'Task': 'Measure, mark, or record openings or distances to layout areas where construction work will be performed.'}, {'Task': 'Clean or prepare construction sites to eliminate possible hazards.'}, {'Task': 'Dig ditches or trenches, backfill excavations, or compact and level earth to grade specifications, using picks, shovels, pneumatic tampers, or rakes.'}, {'Task': 'Load, unload, or identify building materials, machinery, or tools, distributing them to the appropriate locations, according to project plans or specifications.'}]

Element Name: Paving, Surfacing, and Tamping Equipment Operators
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Operators use specialized equipment to apply paving materials like concrete and asphalt, or to compact various substances such as gravel and dirt. They manage the operation of machinery by starting, controlling levers, and guiding the equipment along defined paths. This involves filling machines with materials, regulating flow rates, and monitoring the distribution of substances to make adjustments. Operators also coordinate with material delivery vehicles, ensuring a steady supply. Beyond operation, they perform essential maintenance, including cleaning, inspecting, and repairing equipment, or reporting issues. They are responsible for setting up and dismantling equipment, and ensuring the compacted surfaces meet specific requirements. Some roles may also involve traffic control and the operation of auxiliary vehicles.

ONET description:
Operate equipment used for applying concrete, asphalt, or other materials to road beds, parking lots, or airport runways and taxiways or for tamping gravel, dirt, or other materials. Includes concrete and asphalt paving machine operators, form tampers, tamping machine operators, and stone spreader operators.

Generated description:
Operators utilize specialized heavy equipment to drive foundational elements into the ground. They meticulously maneuver controls to position leads and hammers, carefully hoisting and aligning components before activation. By operating power hammers or drophammers, they drive these elements to precise depths, ensuring structural integrity. Daily routines involve conducting thorough pre-operational checks to confirm equipment readiness, performing essential cleaning, lubrication, and refueling to maintain optimal performance. Operators must also monitor equipment function throughout operation, making adjustments as needed to ensure the work meets required specifications. This role demands a strong focus on equipment operation, control, and maintenance for successful project completion.

ONET description:
Operate pile drivers mounted on skids, barges, crawler treads, or locomotive cranes to drive pilings for retaining walls, bulkheads, and foundations of structures such as buildings, bridges, and piers.

[{'Task': 'Move hand and foot levers of hoisting equipment to position piling leads, hoist piling into leads, and position hammers over pilings.'}, {'Task': 'Move levers and turn valves to activate power hammers, or to raise and lower drophammers that drive piles to required depths.'}, {'Task': 'Drive pilings to provide support for buildings or other structures, using heavy equipment with a pile driver head.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct pre-operational checks on equipment to ensure proper functioning.'}, {'Task': 'Clean, lubricate, and refill equipment.'}]

Element Name: Operating Engineers and Other Construction Equipment Operators
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role control and operate various types of powered machinery used in construction and related activities. They maneuver equipment to excavate, move, and grade earth, prepare sites, or assist in constructing foundations and paving surfaces. This involves starting engines, using controls to manipulate attachments, and carefully aligning machines with project guidelines and signals from colleagues. They also identify potential hazards, such as underground utilities, and take steps to avoid them, ensuring compliance with safety standards. Additionally, they perform routine checks, make adjustments, and conduct basic repairs to maintain equipment functionality and document operational details.

ONET description:
Operate one or several types of power construction equipment, such as motor graders, bulldozers, scrapers, compressors, pumps, derricks, shovels, tractors, or front-end loaders to excavate, move, and grade earth, erect structures, or pour concrete or other hard surface pavement. May repair and maintain equipment in addition to other duties.

actions with other activities, positioning or moving loads in response to hand or audio signals from crew members.'}, {'Task': 'Align machines, cutterheads, or depth gauge makers with reference stakes scrapers, or swing booms.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this role carefully read specifications and blueprints to plan their installation work. They measure and mark surfaces, ensuring accuracy before cutting and fitting various materials onto frameworks. This involves precise measurement and cutting of panels or tiles to create openings for fixtures and to fit surrounding areas. They work with both structural components, assembling and installing metal or wooden framing, and finishing materials. Coordination with other trades is essential, particularly with those who finish seams. Responsibilities include inspecting surfaces for proper alignment and ensuring secure fastening of all installed components. In some cases, they may also prepare surfaces by removing old materials before beginning new installations.

ONET description:
Apply plasterboard or other wallboard to ceilings or interior walls of buildings. Apply or mount acoustical tiles or blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing materials to ceilings and walls of buildings to reduce or reflect sound. Materials may be of decorative quality. Includes lathers who fasten wooden, metal, or rockboard lath to walls, ceilings, or partitions of buildings to provide support base for plaster, fireproofing, or acoustical material.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role meticulously prepare surfaces for final finishing. They carefully examine materials, selecting appropriate compounds and tapes to ensure durability and adhesion. Day-to-day tasks involve precisely applying sealing compounds and embedding tape over joints, cracks, and fasteners using various tools. They spread, smooth, and feather these materials to create seamless transitions between surfaces, often applying multiple coats. Workers may also counter-sink fasteners, repair imperfections, and sand rough areas to achieve a uniformly smooth finish. They manage their workflow efficiently, often working at heights and ensuring all materials meet quality standards before proceeding to the next stage of surface preparation.

ONET description:
Seal joints between plasterboard or other wallboard to prepare wall surface for painting or papering.

[{'Task': 'Spread sealing compound between boards or panels or over cracks, holes, nail heads, or screw heads, using trowels, broadknives, or spatulas.'}, {'Task': 'Press paper tape over joints to embed tape into sealing compound and to seal joints.'}, {'Task': 'Apply additional coats to fill in holes and make surfaces smooth.'}, {'Task': 'Seal joints between plasterboard or other wallboard to prepare wall surfaces for painting or papering.'}, {'Task': 'Spread and smooth cementing material over tape, using trowels or floating machines to blend joints with wall surfaces.'}, {'Task': 'Sand or patch nicks or cracks in plasterboard or wallboard.'}, {'Task': 'Mix sealing compounds by hand or with portable electric mixers.'}, {'Task': 'Work on high ceilings, using scaffolding or other tools, such as stilts.'}, {'Task': 'Select the correct sealing compound or tape.'}, {'Task': 'Countersink nails or screws below surfaces of walls before applying sealing compounds, using hammers or screwdrivers.'}, {'Task': 'Remove extra compound after surfaces have been covered sufficiently.'}, {'Task': 'Install metal molding at wall corners to secure wallboard.'}, {'Task': 'Apply texturizing compounds or primers to walls or ceilings before final finishing, using trowels, brushes, rollers, or spray guns.'}, {'Task': 'Check adhesives to ensure that they will work and will remain durable.'}, {'Task': 'Sand rough spots of dried cement between applications of compounds.'}, {'Task': 'Use mechanical applicators that spread compounds and embed tape in one operation.'}]
