Generated description:
Individuals in this occupation plan and install electrical systems by interpreting blueprints and applying relevant codes. They assemble, connect, and test wiring, equipment, and fixtures, often working from heights or in confined spaces using various tools. They diagnose and troubleshoot malfunctions, performing repairs or replacements to ensure systems are safe and functional. This involves inspecting components for defects, advising on operational safety, and sometimes directing the work of others. They may also create preliminary sketches, estimate costs, and maintain records related to installations and repairs, ensuring all work complies with established standards and regulations.

ONET description:
Install, maintain, and repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures. Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes. May install or service street lights, intercom systems, or electrical control systems.

Generated description:
Workers in this role interpret blueprints and specifications to guide their work, determining the correct size, shape, and type of materials needed. They measure dimensions precisely and mark outlines for cutting glass accurately. Using specialized tools, they cut, fit, and install glass into various frameworks, ensuring proper alignment and secure placement with hardware and fastening materials. This involves preparing surfaces, fabricating or installing supporting structures, and assembling components. They also handle the transportation of materials, loading and unloading large pieces using lifting equipment when necessary. Removal of old or broken glass and preparation of the work area are also key responsibilities. Following safety procedures and using appropriate equipment are critical throughout the installation and finishing processes.

ONET description:
Install glass in windows, skylights, store fronts, and display cases, or on surfaces, such as building fronts, interior walls, ceilings, and tabletops.

Element Name: Insulation Workers, Floor, Ceiling, and Wall
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role apply insulating materials to various structures, focusing on floors, ceilings, and walls. Their daily activities involve carefully measuring and cutting insulation to fit specific areas using a range of tools. They then meticulously fit, wrap, staple, or glue these materials into place, ensuring even distribution and proper coverage. This process often requires reading blueprints to select the correct insulation type and understanding its properties. They also prepare surfaces by applying adhesives or fasteners, and may remove old insulation, adhering to safety protocols. Operating specialized equipment to apply blown insulation and sealing finished surfaces are also key responsibilities. Effective time management and attention to detail are crucial for successful application and completion of tasks.

ONET description:
Line and cover structures with insulating materials. May work with batt, roll, or blown insulation materials.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Measure and cut insulation for covering surfaces, using tape measures, handsaws, power saws, knives, or scissors.'}, {'Task': 'Fit, wrap, staple, or glue insulating materials to structures or surfaces, using hand tools or wires.'}, {'Task': 'Cover and line structures with blown or rolled forms of materials to insulate against cold, heat, or moisture, using saws, knives, rasps, trowels, blowers, or other tools and implements.'}, {'Task': 'Distribute insulating materials evenly into small spaces within floors, ceilings, or walls, using blowers and hose attachments, or cement mortars.'}, {'Task': 'Move controls, buttons, or levers to start blowers and regulate flow of materials through nozzles.'}, {'Task': 'Fill blower hoppers with insulating materials.'}, {'Task': 'Cover, seal, or finish insulated surfaces or access holes with plastic covers, canvas strips, sealants, tape, cement or asphalt mastic.'}, {'Task': 'Read blueprints, and select appropriate insulation, based on space characteristics and the heat retaining or excluding characteristics of the material.'}, {'Task': 'Remove old insulation, such as asbestos, following safety procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare surfaces for insulation application by brushing or spreading on adhesives, cement, or asphalt, or by attaching metal pins to surfaces.'}]

Workers in this role carefully read blueprints and specifications to understand project requirements. They measure and cut various insulating materials, selecting the appropriate type based on the need for heat retention or exclusion. Surface preparation involves applying adhesives or fasteners. They then apply, remove, and repair insulation on mechanical systems, fitting it around obstructions and shaping it as needed. This includes covering and sealing surfaces to protect the insulation from damage and environmental factors. Decisions are made regarding the amount and type of insulation required, as well as installation methods, considering factors like location and equipment use. Throughout the process, they monitor their work and ensure quality control.

Generated description:

They mix colors to achieve desired hues and consistencies and apply various finishes using brushes, rollers, or sprayers to structures and equipment. They may also perform tasks such as setting up ladders or scaffolding for access, and protecting surrounding areas with coverings. Generated description:
Individuals in this occupation prepare interior surfaces by cleaning, repairing imperfections, and applying sealants or adhesives to ensure proper adhesion. They measure and cut decorative materials according to job requirements. Then, they meticulously apply these materials to walls and ceilings, carefully aligning patterns and smoothing out wrinkles or bubbles with specialized tools. A key part of the role involves ensuring the finished work is neatly aligned, patterns match, and seams are invisible. They also remove old coverings, prepare surfaces, and set up necessary equipment. Throughout the process, they make decisions regarding material application, alignment, and final quality checks to achieve a smooth and visually appealing finish.

ONET description:
Cover interior walls or ceilings of rooms with decorative wallpaper or fabric, or attach advertising posters on surfaces such as walls and billboards. May remove old materials or prepare surfaces to be papered.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role prepare and install underground conduits for water and waste systems. They meticulously grade and level trenches according to specifications, often using various tools and equipment. This work requires careful monitoring of system operations and adherence to specifications for a safe and functional outcome.

Generated description:
These professionals install and repair systems that collect and circulate solar-heated water. They assess potential sites, ensuring structural integrity and optimal orientation for collectors. Their work involves mounting devices, installing collectors, and connecting various components like pumps, controllers, sensors, and water heaters using plumbing and electrical techniques. They meticulously apply sealants and weatherproofing to roof penetrations. After assembly, they test system functionality, check for leaks, and fill water tanks. They also perform routine maintenance and repairs to keep systems operational. Additionally, they are responsible for identifying potential hazards and demonstrating proper system operation, maintenance, and safety procedures to owners.

ONET description:
Install or repair solar energy systems designed to collect, store, and circulate solar-heated water for residential, commercial or industrial use.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role prepare and apply various coating materials to interior and exterior surfaces. They begin by cleaning and preparing surfaces, ensuring they are ready for application. This often involves setting up protective coverings and scaffolding. They mix plaster or stucco to the correct consistency, sometimes overseeing others who perform this task. Using specialized tools, they carefully apply multiple coats, working to achieve desired textures and finishes. They also install insulation systems and ensure the undercoat is properly textured to promote adhesion of subsequent layers. Throughout the process, they manage materials, maintain a clean worksite, and make judgments to ensure quality outcomes.

ONET description:
Apply interior or exterior plaster, cement, stucco, or similar materials. May also set ornamental plaster.

Generated description:
Workers in this occupation meticulously interpret blueprints and instructions to determine the precise quantities, sizes, shapes, and placements of reinforcement materials. They prepare these materials by cutting them to specific lengths and shapes, sometimes using specialized machines or torches. The core of their work involves carefully positioning and securing steel bars, rods, cables, or mesh within concrete forms. This is achieved by fastening them together using wire, pliers, or other tools, ensuring they are correctly spaced and held in place, often with blocks to maintain proper elevation. They operate various tools and machines to cut, bend, and position these structural components, ensuring the integrity of the final concrete structure through precise installation of reinforcing elements.

ONET description:
Position and secure steel bars or mesh in concrete forms in order to reinforce concrete. Use a variety of fasteners, rod-bending machines, blowtorches, and hand tools. Includes rod busters.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role prepare structures for covering by removing debris and setting up necessary access points. They assess roof conditions to determine appropriate repair or installation methods. Tasks include cutting and layering various materials, such as shingles, slate, asphalt, or membranes, to create waterproof and insulated surfaces. They also seal joints and exposed fasteners to prevent leaks. Some may spray protective coatings or install additional features like ventilation systems and skylights. This work requires careful measurement, material application, and adherence to safety protocols to ensure the structural integrity and protection of buildings.

ONET description:
Cover roofs of structures with shingles, slate, asphalt, aluminum, wood, or related materials. May spray roofs, sidings, and walls with material to bind, seal, insulate, or soundproof sections of structures.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role interpret blueprints and specifications to determine project requirements, including materials and assembly sequences. They meticulously measure and mark dimensions on various materials before cutting, shaping, and bending them using specialized equipment and hand tools. Following fabrication, they assemble components by fastening seams and joints through methods like welding or riveting. They also install fabricated parts into supportive frameworks, ensuring proper fit and function. Routine maintenance and repairs are performed on equipment. Occasionally, they may be responsible for supervising apprentices or new hires and transporting materials to work sites, ensuring all tasks are completed according to precise standards.

ONET description:
Fabricate, assemble, install, and repair sheet metal products and equipment, such as ducts, control boxes, drainpipes, and furnace casings. Work may involve any of the following: setting up and operating fabricating machines to cut, bend, and straighten sheet metal; shaping metal over anvils, blocks, or forms using hammer; operating soldering and welding equipment to join sheet metal parts; or inspecting, assembling, and smoothing seams and joints of burred surfaces. Includes sheet metal duct installers who install prefabricated sheet metal ducts used for heating, air conditioning, or other purposes.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role meticulously follow blueprints and specifications to erect structural frameworks. They prepare and position steel components, connecting them with precision using various tools and fasteners. This involves hoisting heavy members into place, ensuring accurate alignment with specialized equipment, and securing them for permanent joining. They may also fabricate custom metal parts and assemble prefabricated units. Responsibilities include coordinating with equipment operators, verifying the integrity of connections, and making necessary adjustments to ensure structural soundness and adherence to design plans. This work requires careful monitoring, critical thinking, and effective problem-solving to manage complex construction tasks safely and efficiently.

ONET description:
Raise, place, and unite iron or steel girders, columns, and other structural members to form completed structures or structural frameworks. May erect metal storage tanks and assemble prefabricated metal buildings.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field meticulously assemble and install systems designed to harness solar energy. They interpret site assessments and schematics to position and secure structural framing and energy-capturing components. This involves careful measurement, cutting, and bolting of materials to ensure structural integrity and optimal orientation. They also perform crucial electrical tasks, including verifying wiring, checking currents, and ensuring proper grounding and connections. Identifying and mitigating electrical, environmental, and safety hazards is paramount throughout the process. Furthermore, they test the functionality of installed systems, make necessary adjustments, and document their work to ensure compliance and performance.

ONET description:
Assemble, install, or maintain solar photovoltaic (PV) systems on roofs or other structures in compliance with site assessment and schematics. May include measuring, cutting, assembling, and bolting structural framing and solar modules. May perform minor electrical work such as current checks.

Element Name: Helpers--Brickmasons, Blockmasons, Stonemasons, and Tile and Marble Setters
occupation_text:
Generated description:
This role involves providing essential support to skilled tradespeople in construction and finishing. Responsibilities include mixing various construction materials according to specific formulas, preparing surfaces by removing old materials or cleaning, and transporting materials, tools, and equipment to and from work areas. The role also entails supplying specified materials to craftspeople and assisting in the installation or repair of surfaces. Individuals in this role will operate tools and machines to cut materials to size, apply finishing agents like grout or sealants, and maintain a clean and organized work environment. Attention to detail is crucial for preparing surfaces, removing excess materials, and ensuring all tools and materials are properly stored.

ONET description:
Help brickmasons, blockmasons, stonemasons, or tile and marble setters by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Mix mortar, plaster, and grout, manually or using machines, according to standard formulas.'}, {'Task': 'Erect scaffolding or other installation structures.'}, {'Task': 'Cut materials to specified sizes for installation, using power saws or tile cutters.'}, {'Task': 'Modify material moving, mixing, grouting, grinding, polishing, or cleaning procedures, according to installation or material requirements.'}, {'Task': 'Transport materials, tools, or machines to installation sites, manually or using conveyance equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Provide assistance in the preparation, installation, repair, or rebuilding of tile, brick, or stone surfaces.'}, {'Task': 'Locate and supply materials to masons for installation, following drawings or numbered sequences.'}, {'Task': 'Arrange or store materials, machines, tools, or equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Clean installation surfaces, equipment, tools, work sites, or storage areas, using water, chemical solutions, oxygen lances, or polishing machines.'}, {'Task': 'Move or position materials such as marble slabs, using cranes, hoists, or dollies.'}, {'Task': 'Remove excess grout or residue from tile or brick joints, using sponges or trowels.'}, {'Task': 'Apply grout between joints of bricks or tiles, using grouting trowels.'}, {'Task': 'Apply caulk, sealants, or other agents to installed surfaces.'}, {'Task': 'Remove damaged tile, brick, or mortar, and clean or prepare surfaces, using pliers, hammers, chisels, drills, wire brushes, or metal wire anchors.'}, {'Task': 'Correct surface imperfections or fill chipped, cracked, or broken bricks or tiles, using fillers, adhesives, or grouting materials.'}]

They also prepare surfaces by smoothing and sanding, and ensure the work area remains clean and safe by removing debris and maintaining equipment. Generated description:
These individuals support skilled professionals by performing various hands-on tasks. They prepare materials by measuring, cutting, bending, and stripping wires, and then assist in their installation. This involves drilling holes, pulling wires through conduits, and securing components using hand tools. They are responsible for maintaining a clean and organized work environment, ensuring tools and equipment are in good working order. They also transport necessary supplies and materials to work sites. Their duties include identifying and addressing issues like loose connections or worn parts, and disassembling and reassembling equipment as needed. They follow instructions to facilitate the completion of electrical installations and repairs.

ONET description:
Help electricians by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.

They are responsible for supplying and holding necessary tools and materials for the primary workers, anticipating needs and ensuring a smooth workflow. Additionally, they perform tasks such as filling minor imperfections in surfaces, contributing to the overall quality of the finished project. These duties require careful attention to instructions and a proactive approach to assisting the team.

They review blueprints and site layouts to ensure adherence to legal and safety requirements, often issuing permits for various construction activities. By employing specialized tools and measurement devices, they verify dimensions, alignment, and structural integrity, documenting their findings with detailed notes and photographic evidence. These professionals engage in critical decision-making to determine compliance, identify potential issues, and confer with relevant parties to explain findings and propose necessary corrective actions. They also monitor ongoing work to ensure proper execution and safety throughout the process.

Generated description:
This role involves conducting comprehensive assessments of various systems to evaluate energy consumption. Professionals examine building envelopes, mechanical systems, and process operations, collecting and analyzing field data, including energy bills and usage measurements. They identify opportunities for enhanced operational efficiency and reduced energy use, calculating potential savings and analyzing the technical feasibility of proposed measures. Recommendations for energy-efficient technologies or alternative sources are developed, along with reports detailing findings and potential cost savings. This includes identifying health or safety concerns, performing tests to locate air leaks, and ensuring proper installation and performance of new energy-efficient equipment. They also educate individuals on efficiency practices and answer related questions.

ONET description:
Conduct energy audits of buildings, building systems, or process systems. May also conduct investment grade audits of buildings or systems.

Element Name: Elevator and Escalator Installers and Repairers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this field install, assemble, maintain, and repair mechanical and electrical systems for vertical and horizontal transportation. They meticulously inspect wiring, control panels, and moving parts, ensuring proper alignment and clearance. When malfunctions occur, they troubleshoot and diagnose issues using specialized testing equipment, then disassemble units to repair or replace worn or broken components. They work from blueprints to understand system layouts and select appropriate tools and equipment for installation and repair tasks. Compliance with safety regulations and building codes is a critical aspect of their work, documented through detailed reports and logbooks. These individuals ensure the safe and efficient operation of complex equipment through skilled repair, maintenance, and adherence to specifications.

ONET description:
Assemble, install, repair, or maintain electric or hydraulic freight or passenger elevators, escalators, or dumbwaiters.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Inspect wiring connections, control panel hookups, door installations, and alignments and clearances of cars and hoistways to ensure that equipment will operate properly.'}, {'Task': 'Assemble, install, repair, and maintain elevators, escalators, moving sidewalks, and dumbwaiters, using hand and power tools, and testing devices such as test lamps, ammeters, and voltmeters.'}, {'Task': 'Disassemble defective units, and repair or replace parts such as locks, gears, cables, and electric wiring.'}, {'Task': 'Check that safety regulations and building codes are met, and complete service reports verifying conformance to standards.'}, {'Task': 'Locate malfunctions in brakes, motors, switches, and signal and control systems, using test equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Adjust safety controls, counterweights, door mechanisms, and components such as valves, ratchets, seals, and brake linings.'}, {'Task': 'Read and interpret blueprints to determine the layout of system components, frameworks, and foundations, and to select installation equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Connect car frames to counterweights, using steel cables.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain log books that detail all repairs and checks performed.'}, {'Task': 'Connect electrical wiring to control panels and electric motors.'}, {'Task': 'Test newly installed equipment to ensure that it meets specifications, such as stopping at floors for set amounts of time.'}, {'Task': 'Participate in additional training to keep skills up to date.'}, {'Task': 'Operate elevators to determine power demands, and test power consumption to detect overload factors.'}, {'Task': 'Install electrical wires and controls by attaching conduit along shaft walls from floor to floor and pulling plastic-covered wires through the conduit.'}, {'Task': 'Attach guide shoes and rollers to minimize the lateral motion of cars as they travel through shafts.'}, {'Task': 'Install outer doors and door frames at elevator entrances on each floor of a structure.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for constructing and repairing various types of barriers, walls, and gates. They begin by assessing project needs, which includes communicating with customers to understand their requirements and providing price estimates. A crucial part of their work involves carefully measuring and marking fence lines, then preparing the ground by digging postholes and ensuring the area is free from underground utilities. They meticulously set posts, ensuring they are plumb and secure, often by embedding them in concrete or compacted soil. Subsequently, they assemble and attach framing, stretch and secure fencing materials, and construct or repair gates. This process demands precision in cutting and fitting materials, using a variety of hand and power tools, and sometimes welding metal components.

ONET description:
Erect and repair fences and fence gates, using hand and power tools.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Establish the location for a fence, and gather information needed to ensure that there are no electric cables or water lines in the area.'}, {'Task': 'Set metal or wooden posts in upright positions in postholes.'}, {'Task': 'Measure and lay out fence lines and mark posthole positions, following instructions, drawings, or specifications.'}, {'Task': 'Align posts, by lines or sighting, and verify vertical alignment of posts, using plumb bobs or spirit levels.'}, {'Task': 'Attach rails or tension wire along bottoms of posts to form fencing frames.'}, {'Task': 'Dig postholes, using spades, posthole diggers, or power-driven augers.'}, {'Task': 'Attach fence rail supports to posts, using hammers and pliers.'}, {'Task': 'Assemble gates, and fasten gates into position, using hand tools.'}, {'Task': 'Mix and pour concrete around bases of posts, or tamp soil into postholes to embed posts.'}, {'Task': 'Make rails for fences, by sawing lumber or by cutting metal tubing to required lengths.'}, {'Task': 'Nail top and bottom rails to fence posts, or insert them in slots on posts.'}, {'Task': 'Discuss fencing needs with customers, and estimate and quote prices.'}, {'Task': 'Stretch wire, wire mesh, or chain link fencing between posts, and attach fencing to frames.'}, {'Task': 'Complete top fence rails of metal fences by connecting tube sections, using metal sleeves.'}, {'Task': 'Erect alternate panel, basket weave, and louvered fences.'}, {'Task': 'Insert metal tubing through rail supports.'}, {'Task': 'Nail pointed slats to rails to construct picket fences.'}, {'Task': 'Construct and repair barriers, retaining walls, trellises, and other types of fences, walls, and gates.'}, {'Task': 'Weld metal parts together, using portable gas welding equipment.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the safe identification, containment, removal, and disposal of hazardous substances. They meticulously prepare work areas by building containment structures and then use various tools and equipment to extract contaminated materials. This involves careful handling, packing, and loading of substances for transport and proper disposal, adhering strictly to safety protocols and regulations. They also clean contaminated equipment and sites, ensuring that all materials are managed responsibly and safely. Decision-making is critical in assessing risks, selecting appropriate methods, and operating machinery effectively to prevent further contamination and ensure environmental safety. Monitoring and quality control are ongoing throughout the process.

ONET description:
Identify, remove, pack, transport, or dispose of hazardous materials, including asbestos, lead-based paint, waste oil, fuel, transmission fluid, radioactive materials, or contaminated soil. Specialized training and certification in hazardous materials handling or a confined entry permit are generally required. May operate earth-moving equipment or trucks.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Build containment areas prior to beginning abatement or decontamination work.'}, {'Task': 'Remove asbestos or lead from surfaces, using hand or power tools such as scrapers, vacuums, or high-pressure sprayers.'}, {'Task': 'Identify asbestos, lead, or other hazardous materials to be removed, using monitoring devices.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare hazardous material for removal or storage.'}, {'Task': 'Comply with prescribed safety procedures or federal laws regulating waste disposal methods.'}, {'Task': 'Load or unload materials into containers or onto trucks, using hoists or forklifts.'}, {'Task': 'Clean contaminated equipment or areas for reuse, using detergents or solvents, sandblasters, filter pumps, or steam cleaners.'}, {'Task': 'Remove or limit contamination following emergencies involving hazardous substances.'}, {'Task': 'Clean mold-contaminated sites by removing damaged porous materials or thoroughly cleaning all contaminated nonporous materials.'}, {'Task': 'Operate machines or equipment to remove, package, store, or transport loads of waste materials.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role focus on the upkeep and repair of infrastructure, particularly roadways and associated areas. Their daily activities involve operating vehicles and equipment to perform repairs on pavement, guardrails, and drainage systems. They also manage vegetation by clearing brush and mowing, and ensure safety by setting up traffic control devices and warning motorists. These professionals conduct routine inspections and maintenance on vehicles and tools to ensure operational readiness. They are responsible for clearing debris, including snow and litter, from pathways and structures. This work requires attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and the ability to operate various tools and machinery effectively to maintain functional and safe conditions.

ONET description:
Maintain highways, municipal and rural roads, airport runways, and rights-of-way. Duties include patching broken or eroded pavement and repairing guard rails, highway markers, and snow fences. May also mow or clear brush from along road, or plow snow from roadway.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Set out signs and cones around work areas to divert traffic.'}, {'Task': 'Flag motorists to warn them of obstacles or repair work ahead.'}, {'Task': 'Perform preventative maintenance on vehicles and heavy equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Drive trucks to transport crews and equipment to work sites.'}, {'Task': 'Erect, install, or repair guardrails, road shoulders, berms, highway markers, warning signals, and highway lighting, using hand tools and power tools.'}, {'Task': 'Clean and clear debris from culverts, catch basins, drop inlets, ditches, and other drain structures.'}, {'Task': 'Drive heavy equipment and vehicles with adjustable attachments to sweep debris from paved surfaces, mow grass and weeds, remove snow and ice, and spread salt and sand.'}, {'Task': 'Haul and spread sand, gravel, and clay to fill washouts and repair road shoulders.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect, clean, and repair drainage systems, bridges, tunnels, and other structures.'}, {'Task': 'Remove litter and debris from roadways, including debris from rock and mud slides.'}, {'Task': 'Dump, spread, and tamp asphalt, using pneumatic tampers, to repair joints and patch broken pavement.'}, {'Task': 'Perform roadside landscaping work, such as clearing weeds and brush, and planting and trimming trees.'}]

Element Name: Rail-Track Laying and Maintenance Equipment Operators
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These operators are responsible for the construction and upkeep of rail lines. They operate specialized machinery to lay new track, making precise adjustments to ensure proper alignment and levelness. Daily tasks involve monitoring equipment performance, performing routine maintenance, and lubricating components. They also conduct repairs on various track elements, such as switches, and may weld sections of rail. Safety is paramount, requiring careful observation of indicators and adherence to operational controls. Operators also perform cleaning duties, clearing debris, snow, or ice from the tracks and ensuring ballast is properly maintained. When needed, they troubleshoot issues and perform repairs to keep the rail infrastructure in optimal condition.

ONET description:
Lay, repair, and maintain track for standard or narrow-gauge railroad equipment used in regular railroad service or in plant yards, quarries, sand and gravel pits, and mines. Includes ballast cleaning machine operators and railroad bed tamping machine operators.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Patrol assigned track sections so that damaged or broken track can be located and reported.'}, {'Task': 'Repair or adjust track switches, using wrenches and replacement parts.'}, {'Task': 'Weld sections of track together, such as switch points and frogs.'}, {'Task': 'Observe leveling indicator arms to verify levelness and alignment of tracks.'}, {'Task': 'Operate single- or multiple-head spike driving machines to drive spikes into ties and secure rails.'}, {'Task': 'Operate track wrenches to tighten or loosen bolts at joints that hold ends of rails together.'}, {'Task': 'Cut rails to specified lengths, using rail saws.'}, {'Task': 'Lubricate machines, change oil, or fill hydraulic reservoirs to specified levels.'}, {'Task': 'Drill holes through rails, tie plates, or fishplates for insertion of bolts or spikes, using power drills.'}, {'Task': 'Clean tracks or clear ice or snow from tracks or switch boxes.'}, {'Task': 'Clean, grade, or level ballast on railroad tracks.'}, {'Task': 'Raise rails, using hydraulic jacks, to allow for tie removal and replacement.'}, {'Task': 'Adjust controls of machines that spread, shape, raise, level, or align track, according to specifications.'}, {'Task': 'Dress and reshape worn or damaged railroad switch points or frogs, using portable power grinders.'}, {'Task': 'Clean or make minor repairs to machines or equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Grind ends of new or worn rails to attain smooth joints, using portable grinders.'}, {'Task': 'Operate single- or multiple-head spike pullers to pull old spikes from ties.'}]

Element Name: Septic Tank Servicers and Sewer Pipe Cleaners
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for maintaining and repairing underground systems that carry waste materials. They use specialized equipment to clear blockages and inspect lines for issues, often identifying problems using diagnostic tools. A significant part of their day involves operating machinery to clean pipes and tanks, and performing manual labor like digging when necessary. They meticulously document all maintenance and repair actions taken. This work also requires coordinating with team members, potentially driving vehicles to transport necessary tools and personnel, and performing routine checks and minor repairs on their own equipment to ensure operational readiness and safety. Generated description:
Professionals in this role prepare the ground for installation by removing unsuitable materials, compacting soil, and ensuring proper drainage. They then supply and place base materials, bedding sand, and edge restraints. Decisions are made regarding paver layouts, patterns, and precise markings for alignment. They cut paving units to size using specialized tools and carefully set them, ensuring correct spacing. After placing the pavers, they compact the bedding sand and the units themselves to create a finished surface. Finally, they fill the joints with sand, compacting to ensure they are full, and sweep excess sand from the completed area.

ONET description:
Lay out, cut, and place segmental paving units. Includes installers of bedding and restraining materials for the paving units.

Professionals in this field assess structures to identify areas needing improvement for energy efficiency. They perform diagnostic tests on heating, cooling, and air flow systems to detect issues like air leakage. Based on these assessments, they execute various improvements. They also conduct minor repairs to components like windows and walls, and apply materials to reduce drafts. Furthermore, they explain conservation measures and recommendations to clients, ensuring proper understanding of the work performed and its benefits. Maintaining accurate records of activities and materials used is also a key responsibility.

Perform a variety of activities to weatherize homes and make them more energy efficient. Duties include repairing windows, insulating ducts, and performing heating, ventilating, and air-conditioning (HVAC) work. May perform energy audits and advise clients on energy conservation measures.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the operation and maintenance of derrick equipment and associated pumps. They conduct regular inspections of derricks to identify potential flaws and ensure optimal working conditions through cleaning and lubrication. A key duty involves controlling the characteristics of drilling fluids, which includes mixing components, weighing materials, and preparing mud reports for crew members. They monitor pump operations, listening for unusual sounds or vibrations, and make necessary repairs to pumps and related equipment. Additionally, they manage the circulation of fluids through drill pipes, assist with pipe handling, and ensure proper assembly and alignment of derrick components. They may also oversee and train crew members on operational procedures and chemical handling.

ONET description:
Rig derrick equipment and operate pumps to circulate mud or fluid through drill hole.

Element Name: Rotary Drill Operators, Oil and Gas
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals operate and maintain specialized equipment to extract underground resources or collect geological samples. They closely monitor operational performance, making adjustments to controls like throttles and levers to regulate equipment speed and pressure. Their day involves connecting and disconnecting equipment components, maintaining machinery through lubrication and part replacement, and troubleshooting issues to ensure smooth operations. They meticulously record details about the drilling process, including depth, materials used, and encountered geological formations. Additionally, they oversee and instruct crew members, ensuring safety protocols are followed and guiding activities such as equipment setup and well servicing. They prepare necessary materials, like drilling fluids, and manage the removal of samples for analysis.

ONET description:
Set up or operate a variety of drills to remove underground oil and gas, or remove core samples for testing during oil and gas exploration.

[{'Task': 'Train crews, and introduce procedures to make drill work more safe and effective.'}, {'Task': 'Observe pressure gauge and move throttles and levers to control the speed of rotary tables, and to regulate pressure of tools at bottoms of boreholes.'}, {'Task': 'Count sections of drill rod to determine depths of boreholes.'}, {'Task': 'Push levers and brake pedals to control gasoline, diesel, electric, or steam draw works that lower and raise drill pipes and casings in and out of wells.'}, {'Task': 'Connect sections of drill pipe, using hand tools and powered wrenches and tongs.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain records of footage drilled, location and nature of strata penetrated, materials and tools used, services rendered, and time required.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain and adjust machinery to ensure proper performance.'}, {'Task': 'Start and examine operation of slush pumps to ensure circulation and consistency of drilling fluid or mud in well.'}, {'Task': 'Locate and recover lost or broken bits, casings, and drill pipes from wells, using special tools.'}, {'Task': 'Weigh clay, and mix with water and chemicals to make drilling mud.'}, {'Task': 'Direct rig crews in drilling and other activities, such as setting up rigs and completing or servicing wells.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor progress of drilling operations, and select and change drill bits according to the nature of strata, using hand tools.'}, {'Task': 'Repair or replace defective parts of machinery, such as rotary drill rigs, water trucks, air compressors, and pumps, using hand tools.'}, {'Task': 'Clean and oil pulleys, blocks, and cables.'}, {'Task': 'Bolt together pump and engine parts, and connect tanks and flow lines.'}, {'Task': 'Remove core samples during drilling to determine the nature of the strata being drilled.'}]

Element Name: Service Unit Operators, Oil and Gas
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals operate specialized equipment to enhance the flow of resources from producing wells or to retrieve items stuck in wells. They perform regular safety inspections on tools and equipment, and listen closely to machinery to identify any operational issues or unusual conditions. When necessary, they install specialized pressure-control devices. They analyze instrument readings to determine the depth of obstructions, and use their judgment to select appropriate methods and tools for removing obstacles. Communication with colleagues is essential for gathering critical information about well conditions and equipment. They also maintain detailed records of services performed, tools utilized, and time spent, often driving specialized units to various work locations.

ONET description:
Operate equipment to increase oil flow from producing wells or to remove stuck pipe, casing, tools, or other obstructions from drilling wells. Includes fishing-tool technicians.

[{'Task': 'Maintain and perform safety inspections on equipment and tools.'}, {'Task': 'Operate controls that raise derricks or level rigs.'}, {'Task': 'Listen to engines, rotary chains, or other equipment to detect faulty operations or unusual well conditions.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare reports of services rendered, tools used, or time required, for billing purposes.'}, {'Task': 'Install pressure-control devices onto wellheads.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with others to gather information regarding pipe or tool sizes or borehole conditions in wells.'}, {'Task': 'Operate pumps that circulate water, oil, or other fluids through wells to remove sand or other materials obstructing the free flow of oil.'}, {'Task': 'Drive truck-mounted units to well sites.'}, {'Task': 'Interpret instrument readings to ascertain the depth of obstruction.'}, {'Task': 'Thread cables through derrick pulleys, using hand tools.'}, {'Task': 'Select fishing methods or tools for removing obstacles such as liners, broken casing, screens, or drill pipe.'}, {'Task': 'Close and seal wells no longer in use.'}]

Element Name: Excavating and Loading Machine and Dragline Operators, Surface Mining
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Operators control heavy machinery to excavate and move loose materials. They receive instructions about material movement and excavation needs, then interpret digging plans and machine capabilities to perform tasks. This involves operating levers, pedals, and controls to manipulate equipment according to specifications, often guided by signals or markings. Operators ensure machinery is set up and inspected before use, performing routine lubrication, adjustments, and repairs, including replacing worn parts. They monitor operations for safety and efficiency, manage various site conditions like slides or cleanings, and create or maintain inclines and ramps. Regular maintenance and troubleshooting are key to ensuring equipment functions correctly and safely for the intended operations.

ONET description:
Operate or tend machinery at surface mining site, equipped with scoops, shovels, or buckets to excavate and load loose materials.

Element Name: Earth Drillers, Except Oil and Gas
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role operate specialized equipment to create holes in the earth. They meticulously select and attach appropriate drilling tools, then control the equipment to bore into various materials, adjusting settings based on subsurface conditions. Their daily work involves precisely positioning and stabilizing machinery, managing the insertion of casings, and regulating speed and pressure to achieve desired depths and alignments. They regularly monitor operations, perform essential maintenance and repairs on equipment, and document progress and geological findings. These professionals also manage logistical aspects, including transporting equipment to work sites and ensuring tools are properly assembled and maintained for safe and effective operation.

ONET description:
Operate a variety of drills such as rotary, churn, and pneumatic to tap subsurface water and salt deposits, to remove core samples during mineral exploration or soil testing, and to facilitate the use of explosives in mining or construction. Includes horizontal and earth boring machine operators.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Operate controls to stabilize machines and to position and align drills.'}, {'Task': 'Start, stop, and control drilling speed of machines and insertion of casings into holes.'}, {'Task': 'Regulate air pressure, rotary speed, and downward pressure, according to the type of rock or concrete being drilled.'}, {'Task': 'Select and attach drill bits and drill rods, adding more rods as hole depths increase, and changing drill bits as needed.'}, {'Task': 'Drive or guide truck-mounted equipment into position, level and stabilize rigs, and extend telescoping derricks.'}, {'Task': 'Operate machines to flush earth cuttings or to blow dust from holes.'}, {'Task': 'Verify depths and alignments of boring positions.'}, {'Task': 'Perform routine maintenance and upgrade work on machines and equipment, such as replacing parts, building up drill bits, and lubricating machinery.'}, {'Task': 'Select the appropriate drill for the job, using knowledge of rock or soil conditions.'}, {'Task': 'Document geological formations encountered during work.'}, {'Task': 'Drive trucks, tractors, or truck-mounted drills to and from work sites.'}, {'Task': 'Assemble and position machines, augers, casing pipes, and other equipment, using hand and power tools.'}, {'Task': 'Record drilling progress and geological data.'}, {'Task': 'Retrieve lost equipment from bore holes, using retrieval tools and equipment.'}]

Element Name: Explosives Workers, Ordnance Handling Experts, and Blasters
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for carefully placing and detonating explosive materials. They assess blast areas to determine the precise type and quantity of explosives required, while rigorously adhering to safety regulations. This involves preparing blast sites, positioning charges, and connecting initiation systems to achieve timed sequences. They ensure all personnel are safely cleared before initiating detonations. Additionally, responsibilities include managing the storage, transport, and inventory of materials, maintaining detailed records, and performing necessary maintenance on equipment. Decision-making is critical for ensuring safety and operational success in complex environments.

ONET description:
Place and detonate explosives to demolish structures or to loosen, remove, or displace earth, rock, or other materials. May perform specialized handling, storage, and accounting procedures.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Examine blast areas to determine amounts and kinds of explosive charges needed and to ensure that safety laws are observed.'}, {'Task': 'Tie specified lengths of delaying fuses into patterns in order to time sequences of explosions.'}, {'Task': 'Place safety cones around blast areas to alert other workers of danger zones, and signal workers as necessary to ensure that they clear blast sites prior to explosions.'}, {'Task': 'Place explosive charges in holes or other spots; then detonate explosives to demolish structures or to loosen, remove, or displace earth, rock, or other materials.'}, {'Task': 'Insert, pack, and pour explosives, such as dynamite, ammonium nitrate, black powder, or slurries into blast holes; then shovel drill cuttings, admit water into boreholes, and tamp material to compact charges.'}, {'Task': 'Mark patterns, locations, and depths of charge holes for drilling, and issue drilling instructions.'}, {'Task': 'Compile and keep gun and explosives records in compliance with local and federal laws.'}, {'Task': 'Measure depths of drilled blast holes, using weighted tape measures.'}, {'Task': 'Connect electrical wire to primers, and cover charges or fill blast holes with clay, drill chips, sand, or other material.'}, {'Task': 'Lay primacord between rows of charged blast holes, and tie cord into main lines to form blast patterns.'}, {'Task': 'Assemble and position equipment, explosives, and blasting caps in holes at specified depths, or load perforating guns or torpedoes with explosives.'}, {'Task': 'Verify detonation of charges by observing control panels, or by listening for the sounds of blasts.'}, {'Task': 'Move and store inventories of explosives, loaded perforating guns, and other materials, according to established safety procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Light fuses, drop detonating devices into wells or boreholes, or activate firing devices with plungers, dials, or buttons, in order to set off single or multiple blasts.'}, {'Task': 'Drive trucks to transport explosives and blasting equipment to blasting sites.'}, {'Task': 'Cut specified lengths of primacord and attach primers to cord ends.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain inventory levels, ordering new supplies as necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Repair and service blasting, shooting, and automotive equipment, and electrical wiring and instruments, using hand tools.'}]

Generated description:
These professionals operate specialized machinery to extract and move materials from underground locations. They control the equipment using various levers and controls, ensuring continuous operation and efficient material transfer to transport systems. A significant part of their day involves monitoring the machinery's performance, listening for any unusual sounds that might indicate malfunctions, and taking immediate action to address them. They also perform routine maintenance, such as cleaning, oiling, and replacing worn parts, to keep the equipment in optimal working condition. Additionally, they assess the safety of the work area, checking for structural stability and air quality, and make necessary adjustments to ventilation systems. They must make critical decisions regarding equipment positioning and operation to maximize productivity and ensure safety.

ONET description:
Operate self-propelled mining machines that rip coal, metal and nonmetal ores, rock, stone, or sand from the mine face and load it onto conveyors, shuttle cars, or trucks in a continuous operation.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Hang ventilation tubing and ventilation curtains to ensure that the mining face area is kept properly ventilated.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct methane gas checks to ensure breathing quality of air.'}, {'Task': 'Check the stability of roof and rib support systems before mining face areas.'}, {'Task': 'Operate mining machines to gather coal and convey it to floors or shuttle cars.'}, {'Task': 'Drive machines into position at working faces.'}, {'Task': 'Move controls to start and regulate movement of conveyors and to start and position drill cutters or torches.'}, {'Task': 'Reposition machines to make additional holes or cuts.'}, {'Task': 'Determine locations, boundaries, and depths of holes or channels to be cut.'}, {'Task': 'Observe and listen to equipment operation to detect binding or stoppage of tools or other equipment malfunctions.'}, {'Task': 'Repair, oil, and adjust machines, and change cutting teeth, using wrenches.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role operate specialized machinery to install essential support systems underground. They meticulously drill holes into overhead structures at precise intervals, ensuring stability by securing them with various anchoring devices. This process involves carefully positioning equipment, inserting and operating drilling tools, and then firmly inserting and tightening anchor bolts. They also assess and remove unstable materials, conduct safety checks, and perform tests to monitor environmental conditions. Maintaining equipment through routine checks and repairs is a key responsibility. Additionally, they may manage airflow systems and ensure that installed supports meet required tension and safety standards before proceeding to the next area, demonstrating a commitment to structural integrity and operational safety.

ONET description:
Operate machinery to install roof support bolts in underground mine.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Drill bolt holes into roofs at specified distances from ribs or adjacent bolts.'}, {'Task': 'Pull down loose rock that cannot be supported.'}, {'Task': 'Position bolting machines, and insert drill bits into chucks.'}, {'Task': 'Perform safety checks on equipment before operating.'}, {'Task': 'Perform tests to determine if methane gas is present.'}, {'Task': 'Force bolts into holes, using hydraulic mechanisms of self-propelled bolting machines.'}, {'Task': 'Perform ventilation tasks, such as hanging ventilation curtains and tubes.'}, {'Task': 'Dust rocks after bolting.'}, {'Task': 'Install various types of bolts, including truss, glue, and resin bolts, traversing entire ceiling spans.'}, {'Task': 'Drill test holes and test bolts for specified tension, using torque wrenches.'}, {'Task': 'Position safety jacks to support underground mine roofs until bolts can be installed.'}, {'Task': 'Rotate chucks to turn bolts and open expansion heads against rock formations.'}, {'Task': 'Remove drill bits from chucks after drilling holes, and insert bolts into chucks.'}, {'Task': 'Tighten ends of anchored truss bolts, using turnbuckles.'}]

Element Name: Loading and Moving Machine Operators, Underground Mining
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Operators control specialized machinery to load and move materials such as coal, rock, and ore. They maneuver equipment to gather materials and direct them into transport systems like cars or conveyors. This involves operating levers and controls to position booms or shovels precisely. They also drive vehicles to designated discharge points, ensuring loads are properly transferred. Daily responsibilities include monitoring the loading process for accuracy, clearing obstructions from paths, and maintaining equipment through cleaning, fueling, and minor repairs. They must also manage power cables and adhere to safety signals and guidelines while performing their duties.

ONET description:
Operate underground loading or moving machine to load or move coal, ore, or rock using shuttle or mine car or conveyors. Equipment may include power shovels, hoisting engines equipped with cable-drawn scraper or scoop, or machines equipped with gathering arms and conveyor.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Handle high voltage sources and hang electrical cables.'}, {'Task': 'Drive loaded shuttle cars to ramps and move controls to discharge loads into mine cars or onto conveyors.'}, {'Task': 'Pry off loose material from roofs and move it into the paths of machines, using crowbars.'}, {'Task': 'Move trailing electrical cables clear of obstructions, using rubber safety gloves.'}, {'Task': 'Control conveyors that run the entire length of shuttle cars to distribute loads as loading progresses.'}, {'Task': 'Observe hand signals, grade stakes, or other markings when operating machines.'}, {'Task': 'Examine roadway and clear obstructions from the path of travel.'}, {'Task': 'Drive machines into piles of material blasted from working faces.'}, {'Task': 'Operate levers to move conveyor booms or shovels so that mine contents such as coal, rock, and ore can be placed into cars or onto conveyors.'}, {'Task': 'Clean, fuel, service, and perform safety checks on all equipment, and repair and replace parts as necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Clean hoppers, and clean spillage from tracks, walks, driveways, and conveyor decking.'}, {'Task': 'Oil, lubricate, and adjust conveyors, crushers, and other equipment, using hand tools and lubricating equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor loading processes to ensure that materials are loaded according to specifications.'}, {'Task': 'Measure, weigh, or verify levels of rock, gravel, or other excavated material to prevent equipment overloads.'}, {'Task': 'Replace hydraulic hoses, headlight bulbs, and gathering-arm teeth.'}]

Generated description:
Workers in this role meticulously examine large stone masses, identifying natural patterns and lines to guide their actions. They operate specialized equipment to carefully separate desired blocks from the main formations. This involves precise insertion of tools and controlled application of force to achieve clean breaks. They also mark the stone, indicating dimensions and outlines to ensure accurate cuts. Decision-making is critical for selecting the best methods to split the material according to specifications, managing resources effectively, and ensuring the quality of the separated pieces. Continuous monitoring of equipment and work progress is essential for safety and efficiency.

Separate blocks of rough dimension stone from quarry mass using jackhammers, wedges, or chop saws.

occupation_text:
Generated description:
This role involves overseeing and coordinating the daily activities of mechanics, installers, and repairers. Key responsibilities include monitoring work progress, reviewing performance, and ensuring adherence to quality and safety standards through inspections and training. This position requires making decisions on task assignments, scheduling, and resource allocation, such as requisitioning necessary materials and parts. Interactions are frequent, involving conferring with team members, management, and potentially customers to resolve issues, provide guidance on services, and address grievances. The role also includes counseling employees, recommending personnel actions, and investigating incidents to maintain efficient operations and a safe working environment.

ONET description:
Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of mechanics, installers, and repairers. May also advise customers on recommended services. Excludes team or work leaders.

Element Name: Computer, Automated Teller, and Office Machine Repairers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals diagnose and fix malfunctioning electronic office equipment. They begin by listening to users to understand the problem, then disassemble devices to inspect components for wear or defects. They use various tools and diagnostic equipment to pinpoint issues, replacing or repairing faulty parts and recalibrating systems. After repairs, they reassemble and test the equipment to ensure proper functioning. They may also install new equipment, configure software, and provide guidance to users on operation and maintenance. Maintaining accurate records of work performed and parts used is also a key responsibility, along with managing inventory and ordering necessary supplies.

ONET description:
Repair, maintain, or install computers, word processing systems, automated teller machines, and electronic office machines, such as duplicating and fax machines.

Element Name: Radio, Cellular, and Tower Equipment Installers and Repairers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for installing, maintaining, and repairing communication equipment. They interpret technical documents, blueprints, and work orders to guide their actions. Their day involves physically installing components, such as antennas, mounts, and cables, ensuring secure and proper placement. They meticulously test and verify that equipment functions correctly, often using specialized tools to analyze signal strength and network coverage. Following installation or repair, they conduct thorough inspections to confirm all work meets specifications and safety standards. This requires careful coordination, precise execution of tasks, and attention to detail, ensuring reliable communication systems. They also maintain records of their work and document progress through reports and photographs.

ONET description:
Repair, install, or maintain mobile or stationary radio transmitting, broadcasting, and receiving equipment, and two-way radio communications systems used in cellular telecommunications, mobile broadband, ship-to-shore, aircraft-to-ground communications, and radio equipment in service and emergency vehicles. May test and analyze network coverage.

After identifying issues, they repair or replace faulty equipment, ensuring all connections are adequate and functional. They also perform routine inspections and preventative maintenance to guarantee optimal equipment performance. Collaboration with colleagues is frequent for troubleshooting and resolving complex problems. Additionally, they maintain detailed records of facilities and equipment, adhering to manufacturer specifications and technical documentation. Demonstrating equipment to users and explaining its functionality is also a key responsibility, along with responding to inquiries and complaints.

ONET description:
Install, set up, rearrange, or remove switching, distribution, routing, and dialing equipment used in central offices or headends. Service or repair telephone, cable television, Internet, and other communications equipment on customers' property. May install communications equipment or communications wiring in buildings.

Element Name: Electric Motor, Power Tool, and Related Repairers
occupation_text:

These professionals diagnose and fix mechanical and electrical issues with various equipment. They meticulously inspect and test components to identify damage, wear, or malfunctions by using diagnostic tools and schematic drawings. After disassembling the equipment, they repair or rebuild defective parts, making precise adjustments and ensuring all connections, wiring, and contacts meet specifications. This often involves cleaning, lubricating, and reassembling components using specialized tools. They also document the repairs performed, parts utilized, and the time taken. Their work requires careful measurement of performance metrics and adherence to detailed repair guides and diagrams to restore functionality and ensure optimal operation of the equipment.

ONET description:
Repair, maintain, or install electric motors, wiring, or switches.

Element Name: Electrical and Electronics Installers and Repairers, Transportation Equipment
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this role meticulously inspect and test electrical systems and equipment to identify and diagnose malfunctions. They utilize visual inspections, specialized testing devices, and software to pinpoint issues. Following diagnosis, they adjust, repair, or replace defective components such as wiring and relays, ensuring proper function of ignition, lighting, climate control, and safety systems. This involves splicing wires, soldering connections, and locating and rectifying circuit defects like blown fuses or malfunctioning transistors. They meticulously reassemble and test equipment post-repair, referring to schematics and manufacturer specifications to guide their work. Additionally, they install new components, cut openings, drill holes for fixtures, and maintain detailed service records of all equipment.

Generated description:
Professionals in this field meticulously restore damaged vehicle exteriors. They begin by examining damage reports and estimates, planning the necessary repair sequence. Using a variety of hand and power tools, they remove damaged sections, including panels and glass, and meticulously shape metal by beating out dents and smoothing surfaces. They also straighten frames using specialized equipment. For more complex repairs, they may work with composite materials or fit and weld replacement parts. Following repairs, they prepare surfaces by sanding and priming before applying paint. Finally, they conduct thorough inspections, test-drive vehicles to confirm proper handling and alignment, and reassemble any removed interior components.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role meticulously prepare vehicle glass areas by cleaning and priming surfaces, ensuring optimal adhesion for repairs or replacements. They carefully select necessary tools and materials, then expertly remove damaged glass components using specialized techniques.  Attention to detail is paramount as they prepare the vehicle frame, manage environmental factors like temperature and humidity, and meticulously install new glass.  Finally, they reassemble all associated parts, ensuring a weatherproof and secure fit, while also verifying the proper functioning of related mechanisms. Their work demands precision to restore vehicle integrity and safety.

Replace or repair broken windshields and window glass in motor vehicles.

Routine maintenance tasks like oil changes and lubrication are also part of their responsibilities. Element Name: Mobile Heavy Equipment Mechanics, Except Engines
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role diagnose, adjust, repair, and overhaul mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic equipment. They meticulously inspect machines, read technical drawings and manuals, and use diagnostic tools to identify faults and malfunctions. A key responsibility involves dismantling equipment, examining parts for damage or wear, and fitting new components or repairing existing ones. This includes tasks like welding, soldering, and fabricating parts as needed. They test and adjust repaired equipment to ensure optimal performance, adhering to specifications. Additionally, they perform routine maintenance such as cleaning and lubrication, manage parts inventory, and maintain service records. Some may also oversee and guide other workers involved in assembly or disassembly.

ONET description:

Generated description:
These professionals diagnose, adjust, repair, and overhaul various types of rail cars. They meticulously inspect components such as bearings, seals, wheels, and coupler assemblies to identify defects, wear, and damage, both internally and externally. Based on these inspections, they repair or replace worn or defective parts using a variety of tools. This often involves removing and reinstalling major units, fabricating and installing fittings, and performing scheduled maintenance. They also test units for operability before and after repairs, making necessary adjustments to ensure proper function. Additionally, their responsibilities include maintaining detailed records of conditions and work performed, and sometimes painting exteriors and interiors.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously inspect, diagnose, and repair complex mechanical and electrical systems. They disassemble components to pinpoint issues, using specialized tools and gauges, then replace or recondition faulty parts. Routine maintenance, such as fluid changes and filter replacements, is also a key responsibility. Technicians test repairs by starting engines, monitoring performance indicators like temperature and vibration, and conducting operational tests on the water. They meticulously document all inspections, tests, and work performed, ensuring functionality and adherence to performance standards. This role requires precise adjustments to various controls and systems, followed by thorough verification of proper operation and safety.

ONET description:
Repair and adjust electrical and mechanical equipment of inboard or inboard-outboard boat engines.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role focus on diagnosing and repairing motorized two-wheeled vehicles. They meticulously examine these vehicles, listening to engines and conferring with customers to identify issues. Using a variety of tools, they dismantle engines and other components, replacing or repairing defective parts such as brakes, transmissions, or ignition systems. They perform tasks like tire maintenance, component adjustments, and accessory installation. After repairs, they reassemble units, ensure proper alignment, and test functionality to confirm the vehicle is operating correctly and safely. Their work involves careful inspection, precise repair, and thorough testing to restore vehicles to optimal working condition.

Element Name: Outdoor Power Equipment and Other Small Engine Mechanics
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals diagnose, adjust, and repair small engines that power various equipment. They meticulously examine engines, dismantling them to identify and replace or repair defective parts using a variety of tools. Routine maintenance, such as cleaning, oiling, and tuning systems, is also a key responsibility. They often interact with customers to understand issues, provide repair estimates, and explain maintenance procedures. After completing repairs, they thoroughly test and inspect engines to ensure proper functioning. Detailed record-keeping of repairs, time, and parts used is essential. They may also be involved in selling parts and equipment, requiring knowledge of available options and their applications.

ONET description:
Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul small engines used to power lawn mowers, chain saws, recreational sporting equipment, and related equipment.

[{'Task': 'Record repairs made, time spent, and parts used.'}, {'Task': 'Test and inspect engines to determine malfunctions, to locate missing and broken parts, and to verify repairs, using diagnostic instruments.'}, {'Task': 'Dismantle engines, using hand tools, and examine parts for defects.'}, {'Task': 'Repair and maintain gasoline engines used to power equipment such as portable saws, lawn mowers, generators, and compressors.'}, {'Task': 'Adjust points, valves, carburetors, distributors, and spark plug gaps, using feeler gauges.'}, {'Task': 'Repair or replace defective parts such as magnetos, water pumps, gears, pistons, and carburetors, using hand tools.'}, {'Task': 'Perform routine maintenance such as cleaning and oiling parts, honing cylinders, and tuning ignition systems.'}, {'Task': 'Reassemble engines after repair or maintenance work is complete.'}, {'Task': 'Replace motors.'}, {'Task': 'Obtain problem descriptions from customers, and prepare cost estimates for repairs.'}, {'Task': 'Show customers how to maintain equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Remove engines from equipment, and position and bolt engines to repair stands.'}, {'Task': 'Sell parts and equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Grind, ream, rebore, and re-tap parts to obtain specified clearances, using grinders, lathes, taps, reamers, boring machines, and micrometers.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this role focus on maintaining and repairing vehicle tires. They begin by safely raising vehicles using specialized equipment, then meticulously unbolting and removing wheels. Their work involves identifying tire damage, locating punctures, and performing repairs by sealing or patching them. This includes reassembling tires onto wheels, balancing them by adding counterweights, and ensuring proper inflation based on size and ply. They also perform routine tasks such as rotating tires for even wear, replacing valve stems, and assisting with other vehicle maintenance duties. Maintaining a clean workspace is also part of their daily responsibilities.

ONET description:
Repair and replace tires.

Generated description:
These professionals install, service, and repair automated and mechanical door systems. They carefully inspect job sites to assess conditions and determine the best approach for installations, consulting blueprints and diagrams to guide their work. Day-to-day activities involve assembling and fastening tracks, installing frames, and attaching various door components, including openers, closers, and seals. They also diagnose and fix issues by repairing or replacing worn or broken parts, often fabricating replacements as needed. This requires meticulous work, using a range of tools and equipment to ensure doors function correctly and safely. They may also handle administrative tasks like completing paperwork and collecting payments upon completion of services.

ONET description:
Install, service, or repair automatic door mechanisms and hydraulic doors. Includes garage door mechanics.

Element Name: Control and Valve Installers and Repairers, Except Mechanical Door
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role focus on the installation, maintenance, and repair of mechanical regulating and controlling devices. They regularly disassemble equipment, diagnose issues, and perform necessary repairs using various tools. This includes lubricating moving parts to ensure smooth operation and recording detailed information about the work performed, such as test outcomes and materials utilized. They must carefully monitor equipment performance and apply troubleshooting and repair skills to maintain functionality and prevent future problems. Decision-making is crucial when assessing the condition of devices and determining the appropriate course of action for repairs or replacements, all while ensuring proper operation and functionality of the controlled systems.

ONET description:
Install, repair, and maintain mechanical regulating and controlling devices, such as electric meters, gas regulators, thermostats, safety and flow valves, and other mechanical governors.

Element Name: Heating, Air Conditioning, and Refrigeration Mechanics and Installers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals install, repair, and maintain systems that control the temperature and air quality of indoor environments. They inspect existing systems, troubleshoot malfunctions, and diagnose problems by testing components and consulting with users. After identifying issues or preparing for installations, they repair or replace defective parts, braze or solder joints, and connect wiring and components according to specifications. They also perform regular maintenance tasks, such as cleaning and replacing filters, to ensure optimal system performance. They study blueprints and manufacturer recommendations to guide their work, ensuring compliance with standards and proper system balancing. They accurately document their work, including materials used and any encountered issues.

ONET description:
Install or repair heating, central air conditioning, HVAC, or refrigeration systems, including oil burners, hot-air furnaces, and heating stoves.

Diagnose, adjust, and repair a variety of electric and gas household appliances. Examine appliances to detect malfunctions, and consult manuals and diagrams to identify and resolve problems. Replace defective parts, ensuring proper functionality through testing and adjustments. Install new appliances, ensuring correct setup and initial operation. Communicate with customers to understand issues, provide estimates, recommend repair or replacement options, and instruct on proper usage and care. Maintain records of work performed and manage necessary parts inventory. Respond to emergency service needs, prioritizing safety and timely resolution of issues. Bill customers and collect payments upon completion of services.

Professionals in this field are responsible for maintaining and repairing complex machinery. They meticulously examine components for wear or defects, troubleshoot operational issues by observing and testing equipment, and diagnose problems using diagnostic devices and analyzing error messages. Based on their findings, they disassemble, repair, or replace malfunctioning parts, often involving precise adjustments or fabrication through cutting and welding. They meticulously reassemble and test the machinery to ensure proper functioning, documenting all repairs and parts used. They also interpret technical manuals and blueprints to ensure correct installation and operation, and may instruct operators on equipment functions.

Repair, install, adjust, or maintain industrial production and processing machinery or refinery and pipeline distribution systems. May also install, dismantle, or move machinery and heavy equipment according to plans.

Generated description:
Workers in this field perform routine inspections and maintenance on machinery. They read work orders and specifications to identify equipment needing attention, then proceed with lubrication, cleaning, or part replacement. This involves dismantling machinery, using various tools and equipment to remove defective parts, and installing new ones according to precise standards. They also reassemble machines after repairs and monitor their operation to ensure efficiency and detect any emerging issues. Collaboration with colleagues is common when moving or repairing equipment. Record-keeping of production and maintenance activities is essential, as is managing inventory and requisitioning necessary supplies to maintain operational readiness.

ONET description:
Lubricate machinery, change parts, or perform other routine machinery maintenance.

Safety is paramount, requiring adherence to strict procedures and the use of protective measures. This work may involve driving vehicles to job sites, digging holes for poles, replacing damaged poles, and trimming trees that pose a risk to lines. They coordinate their efforts with colleagues to ensure efficient and safe completion of assignments.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously examine musical instruments to identify any defects or necessary repairs, assessing their condition and potential for restoration. They skillfully disassemble instruments, using a variety of tools to repair or replace worn or damaged components like strings, keys, or structural elements. Following repairs, they reassemble the instruments, ensuring proper alignment and lubrication. A key responsibility involves tuning instruments, adjusting string tensions to achieve precise pitches by comparing sounds with electronic devices or by ear. They also shape and fit replacement parts for optimal sound quality and intonation, and meticulously polish the finished instruments. This work requires a keen ear, precision, and expertise in handling delicate materials and mechanisms.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role are responsible for inspecting, diagnosing, and repairing complex equipment. They systematically troubleshoot and resolve malfunctions across various systems, including electrical, mechanical, and hydraulic components. This involves conducting thorough tests using specialized equipment to identify issues and ensure proper functionality. They perform routine maintenance to prevent problems and manage necessary inventories of tools and replacement parts. Additionally, these individuals may train others on technical procedures, collect operational data for analysis, and collaborate with teams to evaluate and ensure the optimal performance of equipment. Climbing and working at significant heights is often a part of the daily work to access and service the machinery.

ONET description:
Inspect, diagnose, adjust, or repair wind turbines. Perform maintenance on wind turbine equipment including resolving electrical, mechanical, and hydraulic malfunctions.
