Generated description:
These professionals are responsible for the safe and efficient operation of complex systems, controlling and monitoring various equipment to ensure optimal performance. They meticulously adjust controls and manage system parameters according to established procedures, meticulously recording important data. A key aspect of their role involves constant vigilance, monitoring equipment for any deviations from normal operation and responding proactively to abnormalities. This includes diagnosing issues, determining root causes, and implementing corrective actions or recommending solutions. They also oversee the coordination of auxiliary operations, communicate instructions clearly, and participate in essential maintenance and handling activities, always prioritizing safety and adherence to operational protocols.

ONET description:
Operate or control nuclear reactors. Move control rods, start and stop equipment, monitor and adjust controls, and record data in logs. Implement emergency procedures when needed. May respond to abnormalities, determine cause, and recommend corrective action.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Operate nuclear power reactors in accordance with policies and procedures to protect workers from radiation and to ensure environmental safety.'}, {'Task': 'Adjust controls to position rod and to regulate flux level, reactor period, coolant temperature, or rate of power flow, following standard procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Develop or implement actions such as lockouts, tagouts, or clearances to allow equipment to be safely repaired.'}, {'Task': 'Respond to system or unit abnormalities, diagnosing the cause, and recommending or taking corrective action.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor all systems for normal running conditions, performing activities such as checking gauges to assess output or the effects of generator loading on other equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor or operate boilers, turbines, wells, or auxiliary power plant equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Record operating data, such as the results of surveillance tests.'}, {'Task': 'Implement operational procedures, such as those controlling start-up or shut-down activities.'}, {'Task': 'Note malfunctions of equipment, instruments, or controls and report these conditions to supervisors.'}, {'Task': 'Participate in nuclear fuel element handling activities, such as preparation, transfer, loading, or unloading.'}, {'Task': 'Dispatch orders or instructions to personnel through radiotelephone or intercommunication systems to coordinate auxiliary equipment operation.'}, {'Task': 'Review and edit standard operating procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Conduct inspections or operations outside of control rooms as necessary.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this role oversee the distribution of electricity and steam, ensuring smooth and safe operations. They continuously monitor and control equipment using data from various instruments and computer systems, making real-time adjustments to regulate flow and meet demand. A key responsibility involves coordinating with engineers, planners, and field personnel to manage switching orders, clearances, and process changes, often referring to system diagrams. They respond to emergencies, rerouting power to minimize disruptions and directing other staff on operational procedures. This work requires calculating load estimates, tracking conditions that affect needs, and meticulously recording operational data to maintain system integrity and efficiency.

ONET description:
Coordinate, regulate, or distribute electricity or steam.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Coordinate with engineers, planners, field personnel, or other utility workers to provide information such as clearances, switching orders, or distribution process changes.'}, {'Task': 'Respond to emergencies, such as transformer or transmission line failures, and route current around affected areas.'}, {'Task': 'Control, monitor, or operate equipment that regulates or distributes electricity or steam, using data obtained from instruments or computers.'}, {'Task': 'Direct personnel engaged in controlling or operating distribution equipment or machinery, such as instructing control room operators to start boilers or generators.'}, {'Task': 'Distribute or regulate the flow of power between entities, such as generating stations, substations, distribution lines, or users, keeping track of the status of circuits or connections.'}, {'Task': 'Manipulate controls to adjust or activate power distribution equipment or machines.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare switching orders that will isolate work areas without causing power outages, referring to drawings of power systems.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor and record switchboard or control board readings to ensure that electrical or steam distribution equipment is operating properly.'}, {'Task': 'Implement energy schedules, including real-time transmission reservations or schedules.'}, {'Task': 'Calculate load estimates or equipment requirements to determine required control settings.'}, {'Task': 'Track conditions that could affect power needs, such as changes in the weather, and adjust equipment to meet any anticipated changes.'}, {'Task': 'Record and compile operational data, such as chart or meter readings, power demands, or usage and operating times, using transmission system maps.'}]

occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals oversee and manage systems that treat water and wastewater. They regularly monitor operating conditions, gauges, and meters to ensure processes run correctly and detect potential issues. A key responsibility involves operating and adjusting control systems to purify water, process sewage, and manage power generation. They also conduct tests on samples and add necessary chemicals to maintain quality. This role includes routine maintenance, cleaning, and repair of equipment, alongside recording operational data and attending to meter readings. They often direct and coordinate the efforts of other workers involved in daily operations and upkeep, making critical judgments to maintain system integrity and efficiency.

ONET description:
Operate or control an entire process or system of machines, often through the use of control boards, to transfer or treat water or wastewater.

[{'Task': 'Collect and test water and sewage samples, using test equipment and color analysis standards.'}, {'Task': 'Operate and adjust controls on equipment to purify and clarify water, process or dispose of sewage, and generate power.'}, {'Task': 'Record operational data, personnel attendance, or meter and gauge readings on specified forms.'}, {'Task': 'Add chemicals, such as ammonia, chlorine, or lime, to disinfect and deodorize water and other liquids.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect equipment or monitor operating conditions, meters, and gauges to determine load requirements and detect malfunctions.'}, {'Task': 'Direct and coordinate plant workers engaged in routine operations and maintenance activities.'}, {'Task': 'Clean and maintain tanks, filter beds, and other work areas, using hand tools and power tools.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain, repair, and lubricate equipment, using hand tools and power tools.'}]

Element Name: Petroleum Pump System Operators, Refinery Operators, and Gaugers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals operate and control processing units, managing the flow of liquids through various systems. They closely monitor instruments, gauges, and meters to detect and report any operational issues, ensuring variables like temperature and pressure remain within specified parameters. Their duties include starting pumps, opening and closing valves, and coordinating activities with other workers via communication systems. They also collect samples, record data, and perform routine checks on equipment and pipelines. When malfunctions occur, they maintain or repair equipment or report the issues for scheduled servicing. Maintaining cleanliness and ensuring safe, efficient operations are also key responsibilities in their daily work.

ONET description:
Operate or control petroleum refining or processing units. May specialize in controlling manifold and pumping systems, gauging or testing oil in storage tanks, or regulating the flow of oil into pipelines.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Signal other workers by telephone or radio to operate pumps, open and close valves, and check temperatures.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain and repair equipment, or report malfunctioning equipment to valves or use automated equipment to regulate the flow of oil in pipelines and into and out of tanks.'}, {'Task': 'Operate control panels to coordinate and regulate process variables such as temperature and pressure, and to direct product flow rate, according to process schedules.'}, {'Task': 'Verify that incoming and outgoing products are moving through the correct meters, and that and lubricating valves as necessary.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously calculate, measure, and mix feedstock with additives within processing vessels. They continuously monitor production operations, ensuring smooth and efficient processes. Day-to-day tasks involve operating various equipment, such as pumps and valves, to control and adjust operations. They also collect samples for laboratory analysis to maintain quality standards and inspect processing equipment regularly, documenting any necessary repairs or maintenance. This includes performing routine upkeep, troubleshooting issues, and replacing worn components to ensure optimal equipment function and adherence to safety protocols. Accurate record-keeping of processing data and maintenance activities is essential throughout their work.

ONET description:
Calculate, measure, load, mix, and process refined feedstock with additives in fermentation or reaction process vessels and monitor production process. Perform, and keep records of, plant maintenance, repairs, and safety inspections.

Element Name: Separating, Filtering, Clarifying, Precipitating, and Still Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Operators adjust and control machinery to separate, filter, and clarify liquids, gases, or solids from other materials. They meticulously monitor equipment performance and material flow using various instruments, ensuring optimal processing conditions are met. Operators regulate machine controls for parameters like temperature and pressure, and frequently inspect equipment for potential hazards or malfunctions. They also examine material samples to verify qualities such as clarity, dryness, and texture, and collect samples for further analysis. Operators are responsible for loading raw materials, transferring processed substances, and maintaining detailed logs of operations and production. Cleaning and sterilizing equipment and work areas are also key daily activities, ensuring compliance with operational standards and maintaining efficient workflow.

ONET description:
Set up, operate, or tend continuous flow or vat-type equipment; filter presses; shaker screens; centrifuges; condenser tubes; precipitating, fermenting, or evaporating tanks; scrubbing towers; or batch stills. These machines extract, sort, or separate liquids, gases, or solids from other materials to recover a refined product. Includes dairy processing equipment operators.

[{'Task': 'Dump, pour, or load specified amounts of refined or unrefined materials into equipment or containers for further processing or storage.'}, {'Task': 'Operate machines to process materials in compliance with applicable safety, energy, or environmental regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor material flow or instruments, such as temperature or pressure gauges, indicators, or meters, to ensure optimal processing conditions.'}, {'Task': 'Turn valves or move controls to admit, drain, separate, filter, clarify, mix, or transfer materials.'}, {'Task': 'Set up or adjust machine controls to regulate conditions such as material flow, temperature, or pressure.'}, {'Task': 'Examine samples to verify qualities such as clarity, cleanliness, consistency, dryness, or texture.'}, {'Task': 'Start agitators, shakers, conveyors, pumps, or centrifuge machines.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect machines or equipment for hazards, operating efficiency, malfunctions, wear, or leaks.'}, {'Task': 'Collect samples of materials or products for laboratory analysis.'}, {'Task': 'Communicate processing instructions to other workers.'}, {'Task': 'Turn valves to pump sterilizing solutions or rinse water through pipes or equipment or to spray vats with atomizers.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain logs of instrument readings, test results, or shift production for entry in computer databases.'}, {'Task': 'Remove clogs, defects, or impurities from machines, tanks, conveyors, screens, or other processing equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Clean or sterilize tanks, screens, inflow pipes, production areas, or equipment, using hoses, brushes, scrapers, or chemical solutions.'}]

Element Name: Crushing, Grinding, and Polishing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Operators oversee the functioning of machines designed to process materials through crushing, grinding, or polishing. They meticulously monitor equipment operations, ensuring a continuous and safe flow while identifying any potential malfunctions. Operators adjust controls to start, stop, or regulate machinery, and tend auxiliary equipment like pumps and conveyors. They perform regular cleaning and maintenance using hand tools, and make adjustments to machinery to resolve issues. Operators also weigh and measure materials, inspect equipment for wear, and examine products to verify they meet required standards. When problems arise or repairs are needed, they record operational data and notify supervisors.

ONET description:
Set up, operate, or tend machines to crush, grind, or polish materials, such as coal, glass, grain, stone, food, or rubber.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously prepare and refine surfaces of various materials using hand and power tools. They examine workpieces, compare them to specifications, and measure dimensions to ensure accuracy. Workers grind, sand, clean, and polish objects to remove defects or prepare them for subsequent finishing. They may also trim, scrape, or deburr parts, and mark imperfections for repair. Selecting appropriate abrasive tools based on material and desired finish is a key responsibility. They carefully load workpieces, operate and adjust equipment controls, and maintain tools and machinery. The process involves understanding blueprints and layouts to guide their work and ensure adherence to quality standards.

ONET description:
Grind, sand, or polish, using hand tools or hand-held power tools, a variety of metal, wood, stone, clay, plastic, or glass objects. Includes chippers, buffers, and finishers.

Element Name: Mixing and Blending Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Operators monitor and control machinery used for mixing and blending various substances. They prepare equipment by setting it up according to specifications and ensuring it is clean and functional. Operators read work orders to understand production requirements and measure or weigh ingredients accurately before introducing them into the machines. They operate the equipment, carefully controlling the mixing or blending process for specified durations, while constantly observing for safety and efficiency. Operators also conduct visual inspections of materials and products to ensure they meet quality standards, collect samples for testing, and record production data. After processes are complete, they transfer the finished mixtures and clean the machinery and work areas.

ONET description:
Set up, operate, or tend machines to mix or blend materials, such as chemicals, tobacco, liquids, color pigments, or explosive ingredients.

Throughout the operation, they closely monitor the machines for any signs of malfunction or the need for replenishments, making necessary adjustments to speed, pressure, and alignment to maintain product standards. Operators also conduct quality checks, examining and measuring output to ensure it meets specifications. They maintain production logs, handle the removal and stacking of finished materials, and perform routine cleaning and lubrication of equipment to ensure optimal performance and longevity.

Element Name: Extruding, Forming, Pressing, and Compacting Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Operators manage machinery designed to shape and form various materials. They begin by reviewing production orders to understand specific requirements for materials, settings, and adjustments. Operators then set up equipment, calibrating components to regulate speeds, pressures, temperatures, and material flow according to specifications. They activate machines, closely monitoring their operation through gauges and indicators to detect any issues or deviations from standards. Operators make adjustments to machine functions, clear jams, and remove any defective products. They also perform quality checks by measuring and weighing materials to ensure they meet required standards. Additionally, operators maintain production records and clean equipment to ensure continued proper functioning.

ONET description:
Set up, operate, or tend machines, such as glass-forming machines, plodder machines, and tuber machines, to shape and form products such as glassware, food, rubber, soap, brick, tile, clay, wax, tobacco, or cosmetics.

Repairing damaged or worn items is another key responsibility, requiring careful adjustment and restoration. Throughout the process, they may calculate material costs and document production details. Their work demands a keen eye for detail, precision, and a deep understanding of material properties to create or restore decorative and valuable pieces.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role meticulously examine gemstones and diamonds, utilizing specialized optical instruments and magnification tools to assess their quality, identify unique characteristics, and detect any imperfections. They make critical judgments on polish, symmetry, and clarity, assigning grades based on established standards. These individuals also estimate the value of stones by considering pricing guides and market conditions. They often advise others on how to best utilize these materials in creating aesthetically pleasing items. Throughout their work, they maintain a keen focus on precision, ensuring that the angles and positions of cuts are accurate for both aesthetic and industrial applications.

ONET description:
Fabricate, finish, or evaluate the quality of gems and diamonds used in jewelry or industrial tools.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role receive prescriptions and examine models to understand the design requirements for dental products. They meticulously fabricate, adjust, and repair a variety of dental devices, including dentures, crowns, and appliances for aligning teeth. This involves precise work using specialized equipment to test for accuracy and proper function, ensuring the devices conform to specifications. They prepare materials by melting metals or mixing compounds, then pour these into molds or over frameworks to form the prostheses. Additionally, they refine finished products by removing excess material and polishing surfaces. Some may also oversee and guide the work of other technicians and bench workers, ensuring overall quality and adherence to standards.

ONET description:
Construct and repair full or partial dentures or dental appliances.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role construct, maintain, and repair medical supportive devices. They meticulously read prescriptions and specifications to determine the necessary materials and tools for fabricating items like artificial limbs, braces, and surgical supports. This involves taking precise body measurements and creating or utilizing casts and impressions to serve as fabrication patterns. They work with various materials, shaping and assembling components by drilling, tapping, gluing, welding, or riveting. Adjustments are made to ensure proper fit and function, and devices are polished for a finished appearance. They also test devices for alignment and stability, instruct patients on their use, and service the machinery involved in the fabrication process.

ONET description:
Construct, maintain, or repair medical supportive devices such as braces, orthotics and prosthetic devices, joints, arch supports, and other surgical and medical appliances.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously shape and refine optical elements to precise specifications. They begin by examining work orders or existing items to understand the exact requirements for lenses. Using specialized machinery, they cut, grind, and polish lens blanks, carefully selecting the appropriate tools and settings. Following initial shaping, they inspect lenses for flaws, verify surface smoothness, and ensure correct thickness, making adjustments as needed. Finally, they meticulously mount and align the finished lenses into frames or assemblies, often performing final quality checks with precision instruments. This process may also involve cleaning and minor repairs to ensure the optical elements meet all required standards.

ONET description:
Cut, grind, and polish eyeglasses, contact lenses, or other precision optical elements. Assemble and mount lenses into frames or process other optical elements. Includes precision lens polishers or grinders, centerer-edgers, and lens mounters.

Element Name: Packaging and Filling Machine Operators and Tenders
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role operate and monitor machinery involved in preparing products for distribution. They ensure that production lines run smoothly, starting machines and regulating their speed, flow, and temperature. Daily tasks include supplying materials to machines, packaging items by filling, sealing, or wrapping them, and attaching necessary identification. They meticulously inspect products and packaging for quality and conformity to standards, sorting and weighing items as needed. When equipment malfunctions or jams occur, they stop the machines, clear obstructions, and perform minor maintenance or adjustments. They also maintain a clean workspace, record production counts, and manage packaging supplies. Continuous attention to operations and swift identification of issues are crucial for maintaining output and quality.

ONET description:
Operate or tend machines to prepare industrial or consumer products for storage or shipment. Includes cannery workers who pack food products.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Attach identification labels to finished packaged items, or cut stencils and stencil information on containers, such as lot numbers or shipping destinations.'}, {'Task': 'Sort, grade, weigh, and inspect products, verifying and adjusting product weight or measurement to meet specifications.'}, {'Task': 'Stop or reset machines when malfunctions occur, clear machine jams, and report malfunctions to a supervisor.'}, {'Task': 'Observe machine operations to ensure quality and conformity of filled or packaged products to standards.'}, {'Task': 'Remove finished packaged items from machine and separate rejected items.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor the production line, watching for problems such as pile-ups, jams, or glue that isn\'t sticking properly.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect and remove defective products and packaging material.'}, {'Task': 'Start machine by engaging controls.'}, {'Task': 'Tend or operate machine that packages product.'}, {'Task': 'Clean, oil, and make minor adjustments or repairs to machinery and equipment, such as opening valves or setting guides.'}, {'Task': 'Regulate machine flow, speed, or temperature.'}, {'Task': 'Adjust machine components and machine tension and pressure according to size or processing angle of product.'}, {'Task': 'Supply materials to spindles, conveyors, hoppers, or other feeding devices and unload packaged product.'}, {'Task': 'Stack finished packaged items, or wrap protective material around each item, and pack the items in cartons or containers.'}, {'Task': 'Package the product in the form in which it will be sent out, for example, filling bags with flour from a chute or spout.'}, {'Task': 'Stock and sort product for packaging or filling machine operation, and replenish packaging supplies, such as wrapping paper, plastic sheet, boxes, cartons, glue, ink, or labels.'}, {'Task': 'Count and record finished and rejected packaged items.'}, {'Task': 'Clean packaging containers, line and pad crates, or assemble cartons to prepare for product packing.'}, {'Task': 'Secure finished packaged items by hand tying, sewing, gluing, stapling, or attaching fastener.'}, {'Task': 'Clean and remove damaged or otherwise inferior materials to prepare raw products for processing.'}]

Maintaining cleanliness and proper functioning of their tools and equipment is also a daily responsibility, involving the use of solvents and cleaning materials. These individuals must also monitor their work to ensure consistency and quality throughout the process.

Paint, coat, or decorate articles, such as furniture, glass, plateware, pottery, jewelry, toys, books, or leather.

Element Name: Coating, Painting, and Spraying Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role set up and operate machinery designed for coating and painting various items. They are responsible for preparing the equipment, which includes filling reservoirs with coating materials, attaching hoses, and adjusting settings for optimal spray or roller function. Throughout the process, they closely monitor machine gauges and the quality of the coating, making necessary adjustments to maintain standards and correct any defects like streaks or blisters. Tasks also involve disassembling and cleaning equipment, ensuring proper waste disposal, and performing touch-ups or finishing work by hand. They examine and measure products to ensure they meet specifications and maintain a clean work environment.

ONET description:
Set up, operate, or tend spraying or rolling machines to coat or paint any of a wide variety of products, including glassware, cloth, ceramics, metal, plastic, paper, or wood, with lacquer, silver, copper, rubber, varnish, glaze, enamel, oil, or rust-proofing materials. Includes painters of transportation vehicles such as painters in auto body repair facilities.

Tasks:

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously follow instructions and processing charts to prepare and process semiconductor materials. They operate control panels by manipulating various input devices to initiate and manage production cycles. A significant part of their day involves inspecting materials and components for defects, often using specialized equipment and measurement tools. They are responsible for cleaning wafers through various methods and maintaining processing equipment, which includes managing solutions and containers. Additionally, they carefully load and unload materials into processing chambers and transport them for subsequent stages. Maintaining accurate records and adhering to quality control standards are also key responsibilities.

ONET description:
Perform any or all of the following functions in the manufacture of electronic semiconductors: load semiconductor material into furnace; saw formed ingots into segments; load individual segment into crystal growing chamber and monitor controls; locate crystal axis in ingot using x-ray equipment and saw ingots into wafers; and clean, polish, and load wafers into series of special purpose furnaces, chemical baths, and equipment used to form circuitry and change conductive properties.

Tasks:

Element Name: Photographic Process Workers and Processing Machine Operators
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role manage the reproduction of visual content, transforming analog or digital inputs into final outputs. They interpret work orders to determine necessary processes and select appropriate materials and equipment. A key responsibility involves operating specialized machinery, which includes loading media, setting controls according to specifications, and monitoring performance to detect issues. They prepare and maintain processing solutions, and perform quality control checks on the output, examining for defects and ensuring adherence to standards. This may involve making adjustments or reprinting to meet requirements. Additionally, they maintain records of work completed and materials used, and prepare finished products for distribution.

ONET description:
Perform work involved in developing and processing photographic images from film or digital media. May perform precision tasks such as editing photographic negatives and prints.

Generated description:

They interpret blueprints and program specifications to set up and sequence machine operations, ensuring precise dimensions and adherence to standards. This involves mounting and aligning tools and workpieces, calculating speeds and feed ratios, and initiating machine cycles. They actively monitor machine performance through displays and auditory cues, adjusting controls, speeds, and feeds as needed to correct malfunctions or optimize production. Tasks also include replacing worn tools, maintaining lubrication and cooling systems, and performing routine cleaning. Communication with supervisors and programmers is essential for resolving issues and approving continued operation.

ONET description:

Generated description:
Individuals in this role analyze specifications, blueprints, and design data to determine the sequence of operations, select appropriate tools, and calculate dimensions for machining. They develop and write instructions for automated machinery, ensuring that programmed paths and settings are accurate for producing desired shapes and outcomes. This involves writing code, entering coordinates, and storing programs. They monitor trial runs and simulations to verify functionality, troubleshoot errors by revising programs, and retesting to ensure specifications are met. Additionally, they may optimize existing programs for efficiency, prepare geometric layouts, and manage tooling and material resources to maximize utilization and minimize setup times. Some also perform basic maintenance and minor repairs on equipment.

ONET description:
Develop programs to control machining or processing of materials by automatic machine tools, equipment, or systems. May also set up, operate, or maintain equipment.

Element Name: Adhesive Bonding Machine Operators and Tenders
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role operate and tend machines that use adhesive substances to join materials. They meticulously align and position items, ensuring precise application of adhesives or heat. Operators adjust machine components based on material specifications and required adhesive amounts, while monitoring operational controls like temperature, pressure, and speed. They regularly replenish adhesive supplies and perform test runs, making necessary adjustments to meet quality standards. This involves examining and measuring finished products for conformity, and maintaining detailed production records. When issues arise, such as material jams, they troubleshoot, clear obstructions, and recalibrate equipment to ensure continuous operation and efficient output.

ONET description:
Operate or tend bonding machines that use adhesives to join items for further processing or to form a completed product. Processes include joining veneer sheets into plywood; gluing paper; or joining rubber and rubberized fabric parts, plastic, simulated leather, or other materials.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Align and position materials being joined to ensure accurate application of adhesive or heat sealing.'}, {'Task': 'Adjust machine components according to specifications such as widths, lengths, and thickness of materials and amounts of glue, cement, or adhesive required.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor machine operations to detect malfunctions and report or resolve problems.'}, {'Task': 'Start machines, and turn valves or move controls to feed, admit, apply, or transfer materials and adhesives, and to adjust temperature, pressure, and time settings.'}, {'Task': 'Fill machines with glue, cement, or adhesives.'}, {'Task': 'Perform test production runs and make adjustments as necessary to ensure that completed products meet standards and specifications.'}, {'Task': 'Examine and measure completed materials or products to verify conformance to specifications, using measuring devices such as tape measures, gauges, or calipers.'}, {'Task': 'Read work orders and communicate with coworkers to determine machine and equipment settings and adjustments and supply and product specifications.'}, {'Task': 'Remove and stack completed materials or products, and restock materials to be joined.'}, {'Task': 'Observe gauges, meters, and control panels to obtain information about equipment temperatures and pressures, or the speed of feeders or conveyors.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain production records such as quantities, dimensions, and thicknesses of materials processed.'}, {'Task': 'Remove jammed materials from machines and readjust components as necessary to resume normal operations.'}, {'Task': 'Mount or load material such as paper, plastic, wood, or rubber in feeding mechanisms of cementing or gluing machines.'}, {'Task': 'Transport materials, supplies, and finished products between storage and work areas, using forklifts.'}]

Element Name: Cleaning, Washing, and Metal Pickling Equipment Operators and Tenders
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role operate and tend machinery designed for cleaning and washing various items to remove impurities. They meticulously monitor machine operations, gauges, and thermometers, making necessary adjustments to maintain specified conditions and cycle times. Responsibilities include precisely adding chemicals to equipment to ensure correct solution levels and concentrations, and measuring or mixing cleaning agents. Operators also set controls for temperature and cycle duration, starting automated processes. They conduct routine cleaning and refilling of machines and tanks, and meticulously record operational data. Furthermore, they perform visual inspections of equipment to identify potential malfunctions and ensure the process adheres to quality standards.

ONET description:
Operate or tend machines to wash or clean products, such as barrels or kegs, glass items, tin plate, food, pulp, coal, plastic, or rubber, to remove impurities.

[{'Task': 'Add specified amounts of chemicals to equipment at required times to maintain solution levels and concentrations.'}, {'Task': 'Observe machine operations, gauges, or thermometers, and adjust controls to maintain specified conditions.'}, {'Task': 'Set controls to regulate temperature and length of cycles, and start conveyors, pumps, agitators, and machines.'}, {'Task': 'Drain, clean, and refill machines or tanks at designated intervals, using cleaning solutions or water.'}, {'Task': 'Operate or tend machines to wash and remove impurities from items such as barrels or kegs, glass products, tin plate surfaces, dried fruit, pulp, animal stock, coal, manufactured articles, plastic, or rubber.'}, {'Task': 'Record gauge readings, materials used, processing times, or test results in production logs.'}, {'Task': 'Examine and inspect machines to detect malfunctions.'}, {'Task': 'Measure, weigh, or mix cleaning solutions, using measuring tanks, calibrated rods or suction tubes.'}]

Element Name: Cooling and Freezing Equipment Operators and Tenders
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These individuals operate and monitor specialized machinery designed for cooling and freezing. They meticulously observe various gauges and readouts, such as thermometers and pressure meters, to ensure that operating conditions like temperature, feed rates, and machine speeds are maintained within precise parameters. They actively adjust controls and valves to regulate these conditions and the flow of materials or refrigerants. When necessary, they initiate operational sequences by starting equipment and admitting necessary substances. These individuals are involved in planning work schedules to meet fluctuating demands and may participate in hiring and training processes. They evaluate worker performance, provide guidance, and handle personnel matters, preparing necessary records and reports. Occasionally, they may also perform or assist with the core tasks of the workers they supervise.

Element Name: First-Line Supervisors of Material-Moving Machine and Vehicle Operators
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals oversee and coordinate the daily activities of operators who move materials and operate vehicles. They ensure that work assignments and equipment are allocated effectively to meet operational objectives, and they interpret regulations, orders, and company policies for their teams. They also train new personnel, resolve employee issues, and collaborate with various stakeholders to exchange information and address problems. These supervisors inspect materials, vehicles, and equipment to guarantee safety and adherence to specifications, while also monitoring field operations. They maintain records, requisition necessary resources, and recommend improvements for work methods and performance. Furthermore, they are involved in personnel decisions, including selection and evaluation, and may dispatch personnel and vehicles during emergencies.

ONET description:
Directly supervise and coordinate activities of material-moving machine and vehicle operators and helpers.

Element Name: Airline Pilots, Copilots, and Flight Engineers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this role operate and control aircraft, ensuring safe and efficient journeys. They meticulously inspect aircraft before flights, check fuel levels, and confirm weight and balance specifications. During flights, they monitor critical systems, interpret instrumentation, and make informed decisions regarding routes, altitudes, and speeds, often utilizing automated systems. They communicate extensively with control towers and flight dispatchers, relaying flight information and responding to changing conditions or emergencies. These individuals work collaboratively with other crew members, especially during critical phases like takeoff and landing, and may brief crews or instruct less experienced pilots. They maintain detailed flight records and adhere strictly to operational procedures and safety regulations.

ONET description:
Pilot and navigate the flight of fixed-wing aircraft, usually on scheduled air carrier routes, for the transport of passengers and cargo. Requires Federal Air Transport certificate and rating for specific aircraft type used. Includes regional, national, and international airline pilots and flight instructors of airline pilots.

[{'Task': 'Use instrumentation to guide flights when visibility is poor.'}, {'Task': 'Start engines, operate controls, and pilot airplanes to transport passengers, mail, or freight, adhering to flight plans, regulations, and procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Work as part of a flight team with other crew members, especially during takeoffs and landings.'}, {'Task': 'Respond to and report in-flight emergencies and malfunctions.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect aircraft for defects and malfunctions, according to pre-flight checklists.'}, {'Task': 'Contact control towers for takeoff clearances, arrival instructions, and other information, using radio equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor engine operation, fuel consumption, and functioning of aircraft systems during flights.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor gauges, warning devices, and control panels to verify aircraft performance and to regulate engine speed.'}, {'Task': 'Steer aircraft along planned routes, using autopilot and flight management computers.'}, {'Task': 'Check passenger and cargo distributions and fuel amounts to ensure that weight and balance specifications are met.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with flight dispatchers and weather forecasters to keep abreast of flight conditions.'}, {'Task': 'Order changes in fuel supplies, loads, routes, or schedules to ensure safety of flights.'}, {'Task': 'Brief crews about flight details, such as destinations, duties, and responsibilities.'}, {'Task': 'Choose routes, altitudes, and speeds that will provide the fastest, safest, and smoothest flights.'}, {'Task': 'Direct activities of aircraft crews during flights.'}, {'Task': 'Record in log books information, such as flight times, distances flown, and fuel consumption.'}, {'Task': 'Instruct other pilots and student pilots in aircraft operations and the principles of flight.'}, {'Task': 'Make announcements regarding flights, using public address systems.'}]

This involves communicating with ground control and crew members, managing navigation, and responding to changing circumstances by altering routes or altitudes as needed. They also conduct operational tests and maintain detailed flight records, ensuring all procedures and maintenance requirements are met.

ONET description:
Pilot and navigate the flight of fixed-wing aircraft on nonscheduled air carrier routes, or helicopters. Requires Commercial Pilot certificate. Includes charter pilots with similar certification, and air ambulance and air tour pilots. Excludes regional, national, and international airline pilots.

Generated description:
This role involves monitoring and directing the movement of aircraft to ensure safety and efficiency. Professionals in this occupation communicate with pilots via radio, providing critical information about weather, other aircraft, and flight paths. They issue authorizations for takeoffs and landings, and manage the transfer of flights between different airspace sectors. Decisions are made regarding flight vector changes, runway assignments, and emergency procedures. They coordinate with adjacent control centers and alert emergency services when necessary. Professionals also maintain records, compile flight information, and may train new personnel. This requires keen observation, complex problem-solving, and effective communication to manage air traffic flow and respond to dynamic situations.

ONET description:
Control air traffic on and within vicinity of airport, and movement of air traffic between altitude sectors and control centers, according to established procedures and policies. Authorize, regulate, and control commercial airline flights according to government or company regulations to expedite and ensure flight safety.

Generated description:
These professionals monitor and coordinate aircraft movements to ensure safe operations. They communicate essential information between air traffic control, maintenance teams, and other relevant agencies, facilitating smooth arrivals, departures, and ground activities. Daily tasks involve inspecting airfield conditions, implementing safety protocols, and managing various aspects of the airfield environment, including potential wildlife hazards and weather impacts. They also oversee aircraft status, handle record-keeping, and respond to emergencies. Decisions are made regarding operational procedures, safety compliance, and resource coordination to maintain an efficient and secure flight environment. This role requires continuous monitoring, active listening, and effective communication to manage complex, time-sensitive operations.

ONET description:
Ensure the safe takeoff and landing of commercial and military aircraft. Duties include coordination between air-traffic control and maintenance personnel, dispatching, using airfield landing and navigational aids, implementing airfield safety procedures, monitoring and maintaining flight records, and applying knowledge of weather information.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role ensure passenger safety and comfort during travel. They meticulously check emergency equipment and cabin readiness before and during flights. This involves communicating safety procedures clearly, monitoring passenger compliance with regulations, and providing assistance with seating and luggage. They attend briefings to understand flight details, weather conditions, and service plans. Throughout the journey, they address passenger needs, offer refreshments and amenities, answer questions, and manage any in-flight issues or emergencies. They also handle service-related transactions and prepare detailed reports on cabin conditions and passenger experiences.

ONET description:
Monitor safety of the aircraft cabin. Provide services to airline passengers, explain safety information, serve food and beverages, and respond to emergency incidents.

Element Name: Ambulance Drivers and Attendants, Except Emergency Medical Technicians
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Professionals in this role are responsible for the safe and efficient transport of individuals requiring medical assistance. They operate vehicles and provide support during transit, ensuring patient comfort and security. This involves assisting with patient transfers, including lifting and positioning them onto stretchers and into vehicles. They maintain a clean and well-supplied environment within the transport vehicle, performing routine cleaning and restocking. Additionally, they may administer basic first aid, assist medical personnel, and report critical information to relevant parties upon arrival. Responsibilities also include basic vehicle upkeep and adherence to necessary certifications to perform duties competently.

ONET description:
Drive ambulance or assist ambulance driver in transporting sick, injured, or convalescent persons. Assist in lifting patients.

[{'Task': 'Remove and replace soiled linens or equipment to maintain sanitary conditions.'}, {'Task': 'Drive ambulances or assist ambulance drivers in transporting sick, injured, or convalescent persons.'}, {'Task': 'Report facts concerning accidents or emergencies to hospital personnel or law enforcement officials.'}, {'Task': 'Place patients on stretchers, and load stretchers into ambulances, usually with assistance from other attendants.'}, {'Task': 'Accompany and assist emergency medical technicians on calls.'}, {'Task': 'Replace supplies and disposable items on ambulances.'}, {'Task': 'Perform minor maintenance on emergency medical services vehicles, such as ambulances.'}, {'Task': 'Clean and wash rigs, ambulances, or equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Earn and maintain appropriate certifications.'}, {'Task': 'Administer first aid, such as bandaging, splinting, or administering oxygen.'}, {'Task': 'Restrain or shackle violent patients.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role navigate established routes, delivering a variety of goods. They interact with customers to inform them about new offerings and price adjustments, while also addressing any concerns or complaints. A key responsibility includes managing transactions, collecting payments, and accurately recording sales details. Maintaining the cleanliness and operational readiness of their vehicle and any associated equipment is also crucial. These professionals must effectively manage their time, make sound judgments regarding deliveries and customer interactions, and adhere to established procedures throughout their daily operations. Their work involves a blend of logistical execution and direct customer engagement, ensuring timely and satisfactory service delivery.

ONET description:
Drive truck or other vehicle over established routes or within an established territory and sell or deliver goods, such as food products, including restaurant take-out items, or pick up or deliver items such as commercial laundry. May also take orders, collect payment, or stock merchandise at point of delivery.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role operate large vehicles to transport goods and materials. They are responsible for conducting pre-trip inspections to ensure vehicles are in good mechanical and safety condition, checking that loads are properly secured, and verifying documentation accuracy. They navigate routes, which may involve using navigation systems and adapting to changing conditions. Throughout their work, they maintain detailed logs of hours and vehicle status, adhering to regulations. Interactions include receiving delivery instructions, communicating with dispatch, and obtaining signatures or payment upon delivery. They also perform basic maintenance and emergency repairs on their vehicles, and ensure the safe coupling and uncoupling of trailers.

ONET description:
Drive a tractor-trailer combination or a truck with a capacity of at least 26,001 pounds Gross Vehicle Weight (GVW). May be required to unload truck. Requires commercial drivers' license. Includes tow truck drivers.

[{'Task': 'Check all load-related documentation for completeness and accuracy.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect loads to ensure that cargo is secure.'}, {'Task': 'Check vehicles to ensure that mechanical, safety, bills of lading to determine assignment details.'}, {'Task': 'Report vehicle defects, accidents, traffic violations, or damage to the vehicles.'}, {'Task': 'Perform basic vehicle maintenance tasks, conditions of trailers after contents have been unloaded to ensure that there has been no damage.'}, {'Task': 'Operate equipment, such as truck cab computers, CB radios, phones, or global positioning with state regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Load or unload trucks or help others with loading or unloading, using special loading-related equipment or other equipment as necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Plan or adjust routes based on changing conditions, using computer equipment, global positioning systems (GPS) equipment, or other navigation devices, to minimize fuel consumption and carbon emissions.'}, {'Task': 'Perform emergency roadside repairs, such as changing tires or installing light bulbs, tire chains, or spark plugs.'}, {'Task': 'Remove debris from loaded trailers.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role operate light vehicles to transport goods between specified locations. They are responsible for verifying inventory against shipping documents and ensuring the safe and efficient loading and unloading of materials. A key part of their day involves inspecting and maintaining the vehicle, checking essential supplies like fuel and oil, and reporting any mechanical issues. They must adhere strictly to traffic laws and operational procedures, accurately recording details of their trips, including cargo and payments. Following directions, whether written or verbal, and navigating routes effectively are crucial daily activities. This work requires careful monitoring of the vehicle and adherence to regulations for all operations.

ONET description:
Drive a light vehicle, such as a truck or van, with a capacity of less than 26,001 pounds Gross Vehicle Weight (GVW), primarily to pick up merchandise or packages from a distribution center and deliver. May load and unload vehicle.

[{'Task': 'Obey traffic laws and follow established traffic and transportation procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Report any mechanical problems encountered with vehicles.'}, {'Task': 'Verify the contents of inventory loads against shipping papers.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect and maintain vehicle supplies and equipment, such as gas, oil, water, tires, lights, or brakes, to ensure that vehicles are in proper working condition.'}, {'Task': 'Read maps and follow written or verbal geographic directions.'}, {'Task': 'Load and unload trucks, vans, or automobiles.'}, {'Task': 'Present bills and receipts and collect payments for goods delivered or loaded.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain records, such as vehicle logs, records of cargo, or billing statements, in accordance with regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Drive vehicles with capacities under three tons to transport materials to and from specified destinations, such as railroad stations, plants, residences, offices, or within industrial yards.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this role are responsible for safely transporting passengers according to predetermined schedules and routes. A key part of the day involves conducting pre-trip inspections of vehicles and their equipment to ensure operational readiness and safety compliance. During journeys, they monitor passengers to maintain order and ensure well-being, assisting them as needed when boarding or exiting. They strictly adhere to traffic laws and safety protocols, managing their routes and responding to unexpected situations like delays or incidents by communicating through radios. Record-keeping is also essential, involving the documentation of trips, mileage, or fuel usage. Maintaining the cleanliness of the vehicle's interior is another ongoing responsibility.

ONET description:
Drive a school bus to transport students. Ensure adherence to safety rules. May assist students in boarding or exiting.

Tasks:

Generated description:
Individuals in this role operate specialized vehicles to transport goods or people along established routes. They meticulously interpret operational instructions, including electronic or manual signals and relevant regulations, to ensure safe and efficient movement. Day-to-day responsibilities involve monitoring various indicators to maintain optimal performance and control speed, as well as communicating with colleagues via radio for coordination regarding stops, delays, or other traffic. They conduct pre- and post-operation inspections of the vehicle, checking for necessary supplies and any mechanical issues, and maintain detailed logs of any operational irregularities or problems encountered. They must also respond appropriately to unexpected circumstances or malfunctions, adhering strictly to safety protocols.

ONET description:
Drive electric, diesel-electric, steam, or gas-turbine-electric locomotives to transport passengers or freight. Interpret train orders, electronic or manual signals, and railroad rules and regulations.

Element Name: Rail Yard Engineers, Dinkey Operators, and Hostlers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals operate engines to move and reconfigure rail cars within designated areas. They meticulously inspect engines and tracks before and after each operation, monitoring gauges for proper functioning and ensuring safety systems are operational. Communication is key, as they confer with colleagues via radio and hand signals to coordinate movements and relay essential information. They interpret instructions and schedules to determine work orders, coupling and uncoupling cars as needed. Responsibilities include spotting cars for specific purposes, operating switches to direct train routing, and performing routine maintenance and minor repairs. They also maintain accurate logs of operations and report critical information regarding schedules and work completion.

ONET description:
Drive switching or other locomotive or dinkey engines within railroad yard, industrial plant, quarry, construction project, or similar location.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Observe and respond to wayside and cab signals, including color light signals, position signals, torpedoes, flags, and hot box detectors.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect engines before and after use to ensure proper operation.'}, {'Task': 'Apply and release hand brakes.'}, {'Task': 'Signal crew members for movement of engines or trains, using lanterns, hand signals, radios, or telephones.'}, {'Task': 'Confer with conductors and other workers via radiotelephones or computers to exchange switching information.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect track for defects such as broken rails and switch malfunctions.'}, {'Task': 'Observe water levels and oil, air, and steam pressure gauges to ensure proper operation of equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Couple and uncouple air hoses and electrical connections between cars.'}, {'Task': 'Drive engines within railroad yards or other establishments to couple, uncouple, or switch railroad cars.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect the condition of stationary trains, rolling stock, and equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Read switching instructions and daily car schedules to determine work to be performed, or receive orders from yard conductors.'}, {'Task': 'Receive, relay, and act upon instructions and inquiries from train operations and customer service center personnel.'}, {'Task': 'Spot cars for loading and unloading at customer locations.'}, {'Task': 'Operate track switches, derails, automatic switches, and retarders to change routing of train or cars.'}, {'Task': 'Report arrival and departure times, train delays, work order completion, and time on duty.'}, {'Task': 'Perform routine repair and maintenance duties.'}, {'Task': 'Drive locomotives to and from various stations in roundhouses to have locomotives cleaned, serviced, repaired, or supplied.'}, {'Task': 'Pull knuckles to open them for coupling.'}, {'Task': 'Provide assistance in aligning drawbars, using available equipment to lift, pull, or push on the drawbars.'}]

Element Name: Railroad Brake, Signal, and Switch Operators and Locomotive Firers
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the safe and efficient operation of trains and their components. A significant part of their day involves monitoring various instruments and gauges to ensure equipment is functioning correctly, adjusting controls as needed. They actively observe signals, both visual and auditory, from crew members and trackside indicators to make critical decisions about train movement. This includes operating switches to direct train cars, coupling and uncoupling rolling stock, and ensuring secure connections. They also conduct regular inspections of equipment, identifying and reporting potential issues or performing minor repairs. Communication and coordination with other personnel are essential to maintain operational flow and safety protocols.

ONET description:
Operate or monitor railroad track switches or locomotive instruments. May couple or uncouple rolling stock to make up or break up trains. Watch for and relay traffic signals. May inspect couplings, air hoses, journal boxes, and hand brakes. May watch for dragging equipment or obstacles on rights-of-way.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Observe train signals along routes and verify their meanings for engineers.'}, {'Task': 'Signal locomotive engineers to start or stop trains when coupling or uncoupling cars, using hand signals, lanterns, or radio communication.'}, {'Task': 'Pull or push track switches to reroute cars.'}, {'Task': 'Observe signals from other crew members so that work activities can be coordinated.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor trains as they go around curves to detect dragging equipment and smoking journal boxes.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect couplings, air hoses, journal boxes, and handbrakes to ensure that they are securely fastened and functioning properly.'}, {'Task': 'Observe tracks from left sides of locomotives to detect obstructions on tracks.'}, {'Task': 'Operate locomotives in emergency situations.'}, {'Task': 'Raise levers to couple and uncouple cars for makeup and breakup of trains.'}, {'Task': 'Climb ladders to tops of cars to set brakes.'}, {'Task': 'Receive oral or written instructions from yardmasters or yard conductors indicating track assignments and cars to be switched.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect locomotives to detect damaged or worn parts.'}, {'Task': 'Signal other workers to set brakes and to throw track switches when switching cars from trains to way stations.'}, {'Task': 'Check to see that trains are equipped with supplies such as fuel, water, and sand.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor oil, temperature, and pressure gauges on dashboards to determine if engines are operating safely and efficiently.'}, {'Task': 'Set flares, flags, lanterns, or torpedoes in front and at rear of trains during emergency stops to warn oncoming trains.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect tracks, cars, and engines for defects and to determine service needs, sending engines and cars for repairs as necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Start diesel engines to warm engines before runs.'}, {'Task': 'Make minor repairs to couplings, air hoses, and journal boxes, using hand tools.'}, {'Task': 'Connect air hoses to cars, using wrenches.'}]

Generated description:
These professionals manage the flow of train traffic and coordinate the activities of train crews. They review schedules and switching orders, and direct workers engaged in various yard operations, such as making up or breaking up trains and switching tracks. They communicate with engineers, often using telecommunications or signals, to ensure trains start, stop, or change speed as planned. They also monitor train progress, address any issues with routes or equipment, and make decisions to reroute trains or remove defective cars. Accurate record-keeping of car contents and destinations is crucial. They document any accidents, delays, or unscheduled stops, and ensure timely departures by verifying timekeeping instruments.

ONET description:
Coordinate activities of switch-engine crew within railroad yard, industrial plant, or similar location. Conductors coordinate activities of train crew on passenger or freight trains. Yardmasters review train schedules and switching orders and coordinate activities of workers engaged in railroad traffic operations, such as the makeup or breakup of trains and yard switching.

Generated description:
Professionals in this role are responsible for operating rail-guided public transportation vehicles to safely transport passengers. They continuously monitor signals, track conditions, and traffic to anticipate and avoid potential hazards. Key duties include controlling vehicle speed and adhering to schedules, managing passenger boarding and disembarking by operating doors, and communicating essential information to passengers, such as upcoming stops or delays. They also handle passenger inquiries regarding fares and routes. In case of emergencies, they initiate evacuation procedures and report critical incidents, delays, or mechanical issues to supervisors via radio. Accurate record-keeping through shift and incident reports is also part of their daily responsibilities.

ONET description:
Operate subway or elevated suburban trains with no separate locomotive, or electric-powered streetcar, to transport passengers. May handle fares.

[{'Task': 'Monitor lights indicating obstructions or other trains ahead and watch for car and truck traffic at crossings to stay alert to potential hazards.'}, {'Task': 'Operate controls to open and close transit vehicle doors.'}, {'Task': 'Drive and control rail-guided public transportation, such as subways, elevated trains, and electric-powered streetcars, trams, or trolleys, to transport passengers.'}, {'Task': 'Report delays, mechanical problems, and emergencies to supervisors or dispatchers, using radios.'}, {'Task': 'Regulate vehicle speed and the time spent at each stop to maintain schedules.'}, {'Task': 'Make announcements to passengers, such as notifications of upcoming stops or schedule delays.'}, {'Task': 'Direct emergency evacuation procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Complete reports, including shift summaries and incident or accident reports.'}, {'Task': 'Greet passengers, provide information, and answer questions concerning fares, schedules, transfers, and routings.'}, {'Task': 'Attend meetings on driver and passenger safety to learn ways in which job performance might be affected.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role maintain the operational readiness of vessels by performing a variety of critical tasks. They actively monitor equipment, recording vital data and ensuring proper lubrication. A significant part of their day involves preventative maintenance, including cleaning, chipping rust, and painting various surfaces to preserve the ship's condition. They also manage and maintain rigging and cargo-handling gear, preparing it for use and stowing it appropriately. In emergencies, they are responsible for operating lifeboats and utilizing emergency equipment. Additionally, they manage mooring lines, assist with cargo and passenger transfers, and ensure overall cleanliness of the vessel's exterior and interior spaces.

ONET description:
Stand watch to look for obstructions in path of vessel, measure water depth, turn wheel on bridge, or use emergency equipment as directed by captain, mate, or pilot. Break out, rig, overhaul, and store cargo-handling gear, stationary rigging, and running gear. Perform a variety of maintenance tasks to preserve the painted surface of the ship and to maintain line and ship equipment. Must hold government-issued certification and tankerman certification when working aboard liquid-carrying vessels. Includes able seamen and ordinary seamen.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Tie barges together into tow units for tugboats to handle, inspecting barges periodically during voyages and disconnecting them when destinations are reached.'}, {'Task': 'Attach hoses and operate pumps to transfer substances to and from liquid cargo tanks.'}, {'Task': 'Handle lines to moor vessels to wharfs, to tie up vessels to other vessels, or to rig towing lines.'}, {'Task': 'Read pressure and temperature gauges or displays and record data in engineering logs.'}, {'Task': 'Stand watch in ships\' bows or bridge wings to look for obstructions in a ship\'s path or to locate navigational aids, such as buoys or lighthouses.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain government-issued certifications, as required.'}, {'Task': 'Examine machinery to verify specified pressures or lubricant flows.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain a ship\'s engines under the direction of the ship\'s engineering officers.'}, {'Task': 'Break out, rig, and stow cargo-handling gear, stationary rigging, or running gear.'}, {'Task': 'Lubricate machinery, equipment, or engine parts, such as gears, shafts, or bearings.'}, {'Task': 'Lower and man lifeboats when emergencies occur.'}, {'Task': 'Sweep, mop, and wash down decks to remove oil, dirt, and debris, using brooms, mops, brushes, and hoses.'}, {'Task': 'Splice and repair ropes, wire cables, or cordage, using marlinespikes, wire cutters, twine, and hand tools.'}, {'Task': 'Load or unload materials, vehicles, or passengers from vessels.'}, {'Task': 'Chip and clean rust spots on decks, superstructures, or sides of ships, using wire brushes and hand or air chipping machines.'}, {'Task': 'Provide engineers with assistance in repairing or adjusting machinery.'}, {'Task': 'Operate, maintain, or repair ship equipment, such as winches, cranes, derricks, or weapons system.'}, {'Task': 'Paint or varnish decks, superstructures, lifeboats, or sides of ships.'}, {'Task': 'Give directions to crew members engaged in cleaning wheelhouses or quarterdecks.'}]

Element Name: Captains, Mates, and Pilots of Water Vessels
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role oversee and direct the operation of water vessels, ensuring safe and efficient navigation. They consult charts, weather reports, and navigation equipment to plot courses and monitor conditions, making critical decisions about speed and direction. Responsibilities include steering, docking, and undocking vessels, often in challenging conditions. They conduct regular inspections of vessels and equipment, performing necessary maintenance and repairs, and maintaining detailed operational logs. Communication is key, involving signaling other vessels, coordinating with crew members for tasks like cargo handling or maintenance, and reporting any regulatory violations. They also advise masters on local rules and procedures, and may participate in rescue operations.

ONET description:
Command or supervise operations of ships and water vessels, such as tugboats and ferryboats. Required to hold license issued by U.S. Coast Guard.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Direct courses and speeds of ships, based on specialized knowledge of local winds, weather, water depths, tides, currents, and hazards.'}, {'Task': 'Prevent ships under navigational control from engaging in unsafe operations.'}, {'Task': 'Serve as a vessel\'s docking master upon arrival at a port or at a berth.'}, {'Task': 'Consult maps, charts, weather reports, or navigation equipment to determine and direct ship movements.'}, {'Task': 'Steer and operate vessels, using radios, depth finders, radars, lights, buoys, or lighthouses.'}, {'Task': 'Operate ship-to-shore radios to exchange information needed for ship operations.'}, {'Task': 'Dock or undock vessels, sometimes maneuvering through narrow spaces, such as locks.'}, {'Task': 'Stand watches on vessels during specified periods while vessels are under way.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect vessels to ensure efficient and safe operation of vessels and equipment and conformance to regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Read gauges to verify sufficient levels of hydraulic fluid, air pressure, or oxygen.'}, {'Task': 'Report to appropriate authorities any violations of federal or state pilotage laws.'}, {'Task': 'Provide assistance in maritime rescue operations.'}, {'Task': 'Signal passing vessels, using whistles, flashing lights, flags, or radios.'}, {'Task': 'Measure depths of water, using depth-measuring equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Signal crew members or deckhands to rig tow lines, open or close gates or ramps, or pull guard chains across entries.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain boats or equipment on board, such as engines, winches, navigational systems, fire extinguishers, or life preservers.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain records of daily activities, personnel reports, ship positions and movements, ports of call, weather and sea conditions, pollution control efforts, or cargo or passenger status.'}, {'Task': 'Advise ships\' masters on harbor rules and customs procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Observe loading or unloading of cargo or equipment to ensure that handling and storage are performed according to specifications.'}, {'Task': 'Calculate sightings of land, using electronic sounding devices and following contour lines on charts.'}, {'Task': 'Learn to operate new technology systems and procedures through instruction, simulators, or models.'}, {'Task': 'Direct or coordinate crew members or workers performing activities such as loading or unloading cargo, steering vessels, operating engines, or operating, maintaining, or repairing ship equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Arrange for ships to be fueled, restocked with supplies, or repaired.'}, {'Task': 'Supervise crews in cleaning or maintaining decks, superstructures, or bridges.'}, {'Task': 'Purchase supplies or equipment.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the operation and control of watercraft. They steer vessels, manage engine controls, and maintain navigational courses using various aids. Day-to-day activities involve securing and releasing vessels, performing routine maintenance on equipment and motors, and ensuring cleanliness. They make critical decisions regarding safety procedures, emergency responses, and operational efficiency. These professionals oversee the movement of passengers or goods, communicate with crew members, and report navigational hazards. They also coordinate necessary repairs, fuel, and supplies, ensuring vessels and their components are in good working order. Their responsibilities extend to directing loading and unloading processes and implementing safety protocols.

ONET description:
Operate small motor-driven boats. May assist in navigational activities.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Operate engine throttles and steering mechanisms to guide boats on desired courses.'}, {'Task': 'Direct safety operations in emergency situations.'}, {'Task': 'Secure boats to docks with mooring lines, and cast off lines to enable departure.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain desired courses, using compasses or electronic navigational aids.'}, {'Task': 'Organize and direct the activities of crew members.'}, {'Task': 'Follow safety procedures to ensure the protection of passengers, cargo, and vessels.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain equipment such as range markers, fire extinguishers, boat fenders, lines, pumps, and fittings.'}, {'Task': 'Report any observed navigational hazards to authorities.'}, {'Task': 'Oversee operation of vessels used for carrying passengers, motor vehicles, or goods across rivers, harbors, lakes, and coastal waters.'}, {'Task': 'Service motors by performing tasks such as changing oil and lubricating parts.'}, {'Task': 'Arrange repairs, fuel, and supplies for vessels.'}, {'Task': 'Issue directions for loading, unloading, and seating in boats.'}, {'Task': 'Clean boats and repair hulls and superstructures, using hand tools, paint, and brushes.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this role oversee the operation and upkeep of essential shipboard systems. They continuously monitor engine performance, machinery indicators, and power generation, identifying and troubleshooting any malfunctions. Daily responsibilities include performing routine maintenance and repairs on mechanical, electrical, and auxiliary equipment, ensuring all systems function correctly and safely. They meticulously maintain detailed logs of operational activities and equipment performance, often recording critical data. These individuals also manage the procurement and inventory of necessary supplies and parts. Furthermore, they coordinate activities, supervise technicians performing repairs, and ensure adherence to operational standards and safety protocols, making critical decisions to maintain efficiency and prevent issues.

ONET description:
Supervise and coordinate activities of crew engaged in operating and maintaining engines, boilers, deck machinery, and electrical, sanitary, and refrigeration equipment aboard ship.

[{'Task': 'Monitor engine, machinery, or equipment indicators when vessels are underway, and report abnormalities to appropriate shipboard staff.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor the availability, use, or malfunctions and their causes can be identified.'}, {'Task': 'Start engines to propel ships, and regulate engines and power transmissions to control speeds of ships, according to directions from members with maintenance or repair duties.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain complete records of engineering department activities, including machine operations.'}, {'Task': 'Operate or maintain off-loading liquid pumps or valves.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain electrical power, heating, ventilation, refrigeration, water, or sewerage systems.'}, {'Task': 'Install engine controls, propeller shafts, or propellers.'}, {'Task': 'Clean engine parts and keep engine rooms clean.'}, {'Task': 'Record orders for changes in ship speed or direction, and note gauge readings or test data, such as revolutions Generated description:
Individuals in this role operate and monitor machinery to facilitate marine and vehicular passage. They control the movement of vessels and vehicles by opening and closing structures like locks and bridges. Responsibilities include observing approaching traffic, communicating with vessel operators, and managing traffic signals and lights to ensure safe transit. They meticulously record data on vessel traffic, lock usage, and environmental conditions, such as water levels. Additionally, they maintain operational logs, prepare incident reports, and perform routine upkeep to ensure the facilities remain functional and orderly. They may also be involved in supervising these operations.

ONET description:
Operate and tend bridges, canal locks, and lighthouses to permit marine passage on inland waterways, near shores, and at danger points in waterway passages. May supervise such operations. Includes drawbridge operators, lock operators, and slip bridge operators.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Control machinery to open and close canal locks and dams, railroad or highway drawbridges, or horizontally or vertically adjustable bridges.'}, {'Task': 'Direct movements of vessels in locks or bridge areas, using signals, telecommunication equipment, or loudspeakers.'}, {'Task': 'Observe position and progress of vessels to ensure best use of lock spaces or bridge opening spaces.'}, {'Task': 'Record names, types, and destinations of vessels passing through bridge openings or locks, and numbers of trains or vehicles crossing bridges.'}, {'Task': 'Observe approaching vessels to determine size and speed, and listen for whistle signals indicating desire to pass.'}, {'Task': 'Move levers to activate traffic signals, navigation lights, and alarms.'}, {'Task': 'Write and submit maintenance work requisitions.'}, {'Task': 'Log data, such as water levels and weather conditions.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare accident reports.'}, {'Task': 'Perform maintenance duties, such as sweeping, painting, and yard work to keep facilities clean and in order.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for managing vehicle access and customer service in parking areas. They greet patrons, inspect vehicles for existing damage, and issue identification tags. Their duties include safely parking and retrieving vehicles, providing clear instructions on vehicle locations, and ensuring parking areas remain organized and efficient. They handle financial transactions, including calculating and collecting fees, making change, and balancing cash drawers. Additionally, they address customer inquiries and complaints, offer general assistance like directions, and may provide support in situations such as vehicle malfunctions. A key aspect of the job involves clear communication and interaction with the public while maintaining orderly operations.

ONET description:
Park vehicles or issue tickets for customers in a parking lot or garage. May park or tend vehicles in environments such as a car dealership or rental car facility. May collect fee.
