Generated description:
Professionals in this role interact with customers to provide essential vehicle services. They assess fluid levels, tire pressure, and other operational indicators, replenishing them as necessary. These individuals perform routine maintenance, which may include lubrication, oil changes, and filter replacements. They also handle minor repairs, such as replacing worn parts or adjusting critical systems. Furthermore, they are responsible for selling and installing accessories to enhance vehicle functionality. Managing transactions, they collect payments, provide receipts, and maintain the cleanliness of service areas and equipment. Their duties extend to managing inventory and ensuring accessories are properly stocked and displayed.

ONET description:
Service automobiles, buses, trucks, boats, and other automotive or marine vehicles with fuel, lubricants, and accessories. Collect payment for services and supplies. May lubricate vehicle, change motor oil, refill antifreeze, or replace lights or other accessories, such as windshield wiper blades or fan belts. May repair or replace tires.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Collect cash payments from customers, and make change or charge purchases to customers\' credit cards, providing customers with receipts.'}, {'Task': 'Check tire pressure and levels of fuel, motor oil, transmission, radiator, battery, or other fluids, adding air or fluids as required.'}, {'Task': 'Perform minor repairs, such as adjusting brakes, replacing spark plugs, or changing engine oil or filters.'}, {'Task': 'Clean parking areas, offices, restrooms, or equipment, and remove trash.'}, {'Task': 'Order stock, and price and shelve incoming goods.'}, {'Task': 'Sell and install accessories, such as batteries, windshield wiper blades, fan belts, bulbs, or headlamps.'}, {'Task': 'Grease and lubricate vehicles or specified units, such as springs, universal joints, or steering knuckles, using grease guns or spray lubricants.'}, {'Task': 'Rotate, test, and repair or replace tires.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role collect data by observing and measuring traffic flow, delays, and vehicle speeds in various conditions. They conduct field studies to assess factors influencing traffic movement, such as signal effectiveness and lighting. These professionals interact with the public to address inquiries, respond to concerns, and explain traffic regulations or plans. They meticulously document their findings, often creating visual aids like graphs and charts to support their observations and conclusions for further analysis and decision-making. This work involves careful monitoring, analysis, and clear communication of complex information to ensure optimal traffic management strategies.

ONET description:
Conduct field studies to determine traffic volume, speed, effectiveness of signals, adequacy of lighting, and other factors influencing traffic conditions, under direction of traffic engineer.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Study traffic delays by noting times of delays, the numbers of vehicles affected, and vehicle speed through the delay area.'}, {'Task': 'Interact with the public to answer traffic-related questions, respond to complaints or requests, or discuss traffic control ordinances, plans, policies, or procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare graphs, charts, diagrams, or other aids to illustrate observations or conclusions.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously examine goods and equipment to ensure safe transportation. They conduct thorough inspections of shipments, checking that cargo is properly secured and that all procedures are followed during loading. They also verify that storage areas maintain appropriate environmental conditions to protect the cargo. When violations or issues are identified, they document the findings and recommend corrective actions. This may involve advising crews on proper techniques for handling and stowing diverse types of cargo, including hazardous materials. They are responsible for directing immediate adjustments, such as reloading freight or adding bracing, to guarantee compliance with regulations and safety standards. Finally, they prepare and submit detailed reports documenting shipment conditions and any actions taken.

ONET description:
Inspect equipment or goods in connection with the safe transport of cargo or people. Includes rail transportation inspectors, such as freight inspectors, rail inspectors, and other inspectors of transportation vehicles not elsewhere classified.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Prepare and submit reports after completion of freight shipments.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect shipments to ensure that freight is securely braced and blocked.'}, {'Task': 'Record details about freight conditions, handling of freight, and any problems encountered.'}, {'Task': 'Advise crews in techniques of stowing dangerous and heavy cargo.'}, {'Task': 'Observe loading of freight to ensure that crews comply with procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Recommend remedial procedures to correct any violations found during inspections.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect loaded cargo, cargo lashed to decks or in storage facilities, and cargo handling devices to determine compliance with health and safety regulations and need for maintenance.'}, {'Task': 'Notify workers of any special treatment required for shipments.'}, {'Task': 'Direct crews to reload freight or to insert additional bracing or packing as necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Check temperatures and humidities of shipping and storage areas to ensure that they are at appropriate levels to protect cargo.'}, {'Task': 'Determine cargo transportation capabilities by reading documents that set forth cargo loading and securing procedures, capacities, and stability factors.'}, {'Task': 'Read draft markings to determine depths of vessels in water.'}]

Generated description:
Professionals in this field meticulously examine various components and systems to ensure strict adherence to established standards and procedures. They review maintenance logs and records to verify that scheduled upkeep and overhauls have been completed appropriately. Their work involves detailed inspections of structures, equipment, and systems for any damage, defects, or signs of wear, utilizing specialized tools and instruments. Decisions are made regarding the airworthiness and conformity to regulations, leading to the approval or denial of certifications. They also play a role in documenting findings, recommending necessary repairs or replacements, and suggesting improvements to existing rules and guidelines based on their operational insights and observations of evolving technology.

ONET description:
Inspect aircraft, maintenance procedures, air navigational aids, air traffic controls, and communications equipment to ensure conformance with Federal safety regulations.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Inspect work of aircraft mechanics performing maintenance, modification, or repair and overhaul of aircraft and aircraft mechanical systems to ensure adherence to standards and procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Examine maintenance records and flight logs to determine if service and maintenance checks and overhauls were performed at prescribed intervals.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect new, repaired, or modified aircraft to identify damage or defects and to assess airworthiness and conformance to standards, using checklists, hand tools, and test instruments.'}, {'Task': 'Approve or deny issuance of certificates of airworthiness.'}, {'Task': 'Prepare and maintain detailed repair, inspection, investigation, and certification records and reports.'}, {'Task': 'Examine landing gear, tires, and exteriors of fuselage, wings, and engines for evidence of damage or corrosion and the need for repairs.'}, {'Task': 'Recommend replacement, repair, or modification of aircraft equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Start aircraft and observe gauges, meters, and other instruments to detect evidence of malfunctions.'}, {'Task': 'Examine aircraft access plates and doors for security.'}, {'Task': 'Recommend changes in rules, policies, standards, and regulations, based on knowledge of operating conditions, aircraft improvements, and other factors.'}]

Element Name: Transportation Vehicle, Equipment and Systems Inspectors, Except Aviation
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role meticulously examine vehicles and equipment, looking for any signs of damage, wear, or malfunction that could compromise safety. They meticulously check if all systems meet established operational standards and regulatory requirements. A key part of their responsibility involves verifying that any necessary repairs have been completed correctly and effectively. This requires careful observation, critical evaluation of findings, and clear documentation to ensure everything is in order. They also assess whether the equipment adheres to all governing rules and specifications, making decisions based on their findings to ensure overall safety and compliance.

ONET description:
Inspect and monitor transportation equipment, vehicles, or systems to ensure compliance with regulations and safety standards.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Inspect vehicles or other equipment for evidence of abuse, damage, or mechanical malfunction.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect vehicles or equipment to ensure compliance with rules, standards, or regulations.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect repairs to transportation vehicles or equipment to ensure that repair work was performed properly.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role focus on ensuring passenger well-being and safety during transit. They actively monitor the environment and passengers, providing assistance as needed, such as helping individuals secure themselves or determine seating arrangements. A key aspect of the job involves clear communication, actively listening to inquiries, and responding to passenger questions, requests, or complaints with a strong service orientation. They may also assist passengers with specific needs, like boarding, and are responsible for ensuring adherence to safety protocols. This requires careful attention to detail and the ability to anticipate and address passenger needs effectively throughout their journey.

ONET description:
Provide services to ensure the safety of passengers aboard ships, buses, trains, or within the station or terminal. Perform duties such as explaining the use of safety equipment, serving meals or beverages, or answering questions related to travel.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Secure passengers for transportation by buckling seatbelts or fastening wheelchairs with tie-down straps.'}, {'Task': 'Provide boarding assistance to elderly, sick, or injured people.'}, {'Task': 'Respond to passengers\' questions, requests, or complaints.'}, {'Task': 'Determine or facilitate seating arrangements.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for managing the flow of materials and products using conveyor systems. They continuously monitor operations by observing equipment indicators and gauges to ensure optimal performance and identify any malfunctions. A key part of their day involves adjusting the speed and routing of items to maintain specified operational levels. They also manually intervene by loading, unloading, and adjusting items on the conveyors, and clearing jams when they occur. Recording essential data on production, material types, quantities, and equipment performance is also a regular duty, along with communicating any issues to supervisors for prompt resolution.

ONET description:
Control or tend conveyors or conveyor systems that move materials or products to and from stockpiles, processing stations, departments, or vehicles. May control speed and routing of materials or products.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Inform supervisors of equipment malfunctions that need to be addressed.'}, {'Task': 'Observe conveyor operations and monitor lights, dials, and gauges to maintain specified operating levels and to detect equipment malfunctions.'}, {'Task': 'Record production data such as weights, types, quantities, and storage locations of materials, as well as equipment performance problems and downtime.'}, {'Task': 'Load, unload, or adjust materials or products on conveyors by hand, by using lifts, hoists, and scoops, or by opening gates, chutes, or hoppers.'}, {'Task': 'Stop equipment or machinery and clear jams, using poles, bars, and hand tools, or remove damaged materials from conveyors.'}, {'Task': 'Distribute materials, supplies, and equipment to work stations, using lifts and trucks.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role operate specialized mechanical equipment to precisely lift and reposition various materials. They meticulously review daily schedules and instructions to understand specific loading or movement requirements. A key responsibility involves assessing the weight of loads and comparing it to the equipment's lifting capacity to ensure safety and prevent damage. They manipulate controls to guide the equipment, carefully moving objects in designated directions. Regular inspections of the machinery and its components are performed to identify any wear or potential malfunctions. Routine maintenance, including cleaning and lubrication, is carried out, and necessary repairs or replacements are made to ensure operational integrity. They also guide support personnel in preparing the worksite.

ONET description:
Operate mechanical boom and cable or tower and cable equipment to lift and move materials, machines, or products in many directions.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Determine load weights and check them against lifting capacities to prevent overload.'}, {'Task': 'Move levers, depress foot pedals, or turn dials to operate cranes, cherry pickers, electromagnets, or other moving equipment for lifting, moving, or placing loads.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect and adjust crane mechanisms or lifting accessories to prevent malfunctions or damage.'}, {'Task': 'Inspect cables or grappling devices for wear and install or replace cables, as needed.'}, {'Task': 'Direct helpers engaged in placing blocking or outrigging under cranes.'}, {'Task': 'Clean, lubricate, and maintain mechanisms such as cables, pulleys, or grappling devices, making repairs, as necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Load or unload bundles from trucks, or move containers to storage bins, using moving equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Review daily work or delivery schedules to determine orders, sequences of deliveries, or special loading instructions.'}]

Generated description:
Operators manage specialized machinery to excavate and maintain waterways. They skillfully manipulate controls, including levers and switches, to position equipment, engage power systems, and adjust operational components. This involves starting and stopping engines, operating winches for cable adjustments, and monitoring depth gauges to ensure accurate excavation. They also oversee tasks related to anchor placement, pipeline connections, and water removal from flotation devices. Regular monitoring of equipment performance, performing routine maintenance, and troubleshooting operational issues are key responsibilities. This role requires careful coordination with team members and precise execution of procedures to achieve desired outcomes.

ONET description:
Operate dredge to remove sand, gravel, or other materials in order to excavate and maintain navigable channels in waterways.

[{'Task': 'Move levers to position dredges for excavation, to engage hydraulic pumps, to raise and lower suction booms, and to control rotation of cutterheads.'}, {'Task': 'Start and stop engines to operate equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Start power winches that draw in or let out cables to change positions of dredges, or pull in and let out cables manually.'}, {'Task': 'Pump water to clear machinery pipelines.'}, {'Task': 'Lower anchor poles to verify depths of excavations, using winches, or scan depth gauges to determine depths of excavations.'}, {'Task': 'Direct or assist workers placing shore anchors and cables, laying additional pipes from dredges to shore, and pumping water from pontoons.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the precise operation of powered cable equipment to move and lift various loads. They also attach and disconnect cables using hand tools, select appropriate materials based on specifications, and assist other workers with loading and unloading. This requires careful attention, coordination with others, and critical decision-making to manage equipment and materials effectively.

[{'Task': 'Move levers, pedals, and throttles to stop, start, and regulate speeds of hoist or winch drums in response to hand, bell, buzzer, telephone, loud-speaker, or whistle signals, or by observing dial indicators or cable marks.'}, {'Task': 'Start engines of hoists or winches and use levers and pedals to wind or unwind cable on drums.'}, {'Task': 'Observe equipment gauges and indicators and hand signals of other workers to verify load positions or depths.'}, {'Task': 'Operate compressed air, diesel, electric, gasoline, or steam-driven hoists or winches to control movement of cableways, cages, derricks, draglines, loaders, railcars, or skips.'}, {'Task': 'Move or reposition hoists, winches, loads and materials, manually or using equipment and machines such as trucks, cars, and hand trucks.'}, {'Task': 'Select loads or materials according to weight and size specifications.'}, {'Task': 'Signal and assist other workers loading or unloading materials.'}, {'Task': 'Attach, fasten, and disconnect cables or lines to loads, materials, and equipment, using hand tools.'}]

occupation_text:

This involves moving items to and from various locations, including storage areas, production zones, loading docks, and transport vehicles, using their hands or simple equipment. A key responsibility includes maintaining storage areas to ensure that all inventory is properly protected and organized. They often work collaboratively, coordinating movements and ensuring materials are in the correct place at the right time. Their daily activities focus on the safe and efficient handling of goods.

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for sorting and preparing various materials for recycling processes. This involves identifying and separating items like metals, glass, wood, and paper into designated containers. They also handle the removal of hazardous substances to ensure safety. A significant part of their day includes dismantling components of discarded products. They may also perform upkeep tasks, such as cleaning the work area by sweeping or collecting debris. Additionally, they operate equipment to move and load materials for transport to processing facilities. Routine checks and minor maintenance on equipment are also part of their duties, ensuring operational efficiency and safety.

ONET description:
Prepare and sort materials or products for recycling. Identify and remove hazardous substances. Dismantle components of products such as appliances.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Sort materials, such as metals, glass, wood, paper or plastics, into appropriate containers for recycling.'}, {'Task': 'Clean recycling yard by sweeping, raking, picking up broken glass and loose paper debris, or moving barrels and bins.'}, {'Task': 'Operate forklifts, pallet jacks, power lifts, or front-end loaders to load bales, bundles, or other heavy items onto trucks for shipping to smelters or other recycled materials processing facilities.'}, {'Task': 'Sort metals to separate high-grade metals, such as copper, brass, and aluminum, for recycling.'}, {'Task': 'Clean, inspect, or lubricate recyclable collection equipment or perform routine maintenance or minor repairs on recycling equipment, such as star gears, finger sorters, destoners, belts, and grinders.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for managing inventory and fulfilling orders. They receive and count incoming stock, verifying information and storing items appropriately. A significant part of their day involves picking items from storage to fill orders or restock displays. This requires carefully reading order details to ensure accuracy in quantity, size, and type of product. They also manage inventory levels by taking stock, identifying items needing replenishment, and sometimes recommending disposal of damaged or obsolete goods. Additionally, they may prepare items for sale by marking prices and arranging merchandise to attract customers, while maintaining organized and safe storage and work areas.

ONET description:
Receive, store, and issue merchandise, materials, equipment, and other items from stockroom, warehouse, or storage yard to fill shelves, racks, tables, or customers' orders. May operate power equipment to fill orders. May mark prices on merchandise and set up sales displays.

Element Name: Gas Compressor and Gas Pumping Station Operators
occupation_text:
Generated description:
These professionals oversee the operation of various engine-driven equipment used to move and compress gases. Their daily activities involve closely monitoring meters and gauges to track consumption rates, temperatures, and pressures, making adjustments to valves and controls to ensure optimal performance. They are responsible for starting and stopping pumps and auxiliary machinery, and meticulously documenting all instrument readings and operational changes in logs. When issues arise, they diagnose problems, either by adjusting equipment themselves or by directing other personnel. They also perform routine maintenance, including cleaning, lubrication, and minor repairs, and maintain accurate records of gas handled. Additionally, they conduct quality tests on gases or prepare samples for laboratory analysis, and ensure the general upkeep and cleanliness of their work areas.

ONET description:
Operate steam-, gas-, electric motor-, or internal combustion-engine driven compressors. Transmit, compress, or recover gases, such as butane, nitrogen, hydrogen, and natural gas.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Monitor meters and pressure gauges to determine consumption rate variations, temperatures, and pressures.'}, {'Task': 'Respond to problems by adjusting control room equipment or instructing other personnel to adjust equipment at problem locations or in other control areas.'}, {'Task': 'Record instrument readings and operational changes in operating logs.'}, {'Task': 'Adjust valves and equipment to obtain specified performance.'}, {'Task': 'Move controls and turn valves to start compressor engines, pumps, and auxiliary equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Operate power-driven pumps that transfer liquids, semi-liquids, gases, or powdered materials.'}, {'Task': 'Submit daily reports on facility operations.'}, {'Task': 'Take samples of gases and conduct chemical tests to determine gas quality and sulfur or moisture content, or send samples to laboratories for analysis.'}, {'Task': 'Read gas meters, and maintain records of the amounts of gas received and dispensed from holders.'}, {'Task': 'Turn knobs or switches to regulate pressures.'}, {'Task': 'Clean, lubricate, and adjust equipment, and replace filters and gaskets, using hand tools.'}, {'Task': 'Maintain each station by performing general housekeeping duties such as painting, washing, and cleaning.'}, {'Task': 'Connect pipelines between pumps and containers that are being filled or emptied.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the operation and control of equipment that transfers various substances, including liquids, gases, and powdered materials, between different vessels and processes. They meticulously monitor gauges, flowmeters, and equipment to ensure that critical levels, temperatures, and pressures are maintained within specified ranges, actively reporting any deviations. A key part of their day involves planning the flow of materials, understanding pipeline interconnections and capacities to optimize transfers. They initiate and regulate these flows by operating valves and pumps, coordinating actions with colleagues through various communication methods. This also includes connecting and disconnecting hoses and pipelines, performing routine maintenance like cleaning and lubrication, and conducting tests on materials.

ONET description:
Tend, control, or operate power-driven, stationary, or portable pumps and manifold systems to transfer gases, oil, other liquids, slurries, or powdered materials to and from various vessels and processes.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Monitor gauges and flowmeters and inspect equipment to ensure that tank levels, temperatures, chemical amounts, and pressures are at specified levels, reporting abnormalities as necessary.'}, {'Task': 'Record operating data such as products and quantities pumped, stocks used, gauging results, and operating times.'}, {'Task': 'Plan movement of products through lines to processing, storage, and shipping units, using knowledge of interconnections and capacities of pipelines, valve manifolds, pumps, and tankage.'}, {'Task': 'Turn valves and start pumps to start or regulate flows of substances such as gases, liquids, slurries, or powdered materials.'}, {'Task': 'Communicate with other workers, using signals, radios, or telephones, to start and stop flows of materials or substances.'}, {'Task': 'Connect hoses and pipelines to pumps and vessels prior to material transfer, using hand tools.'}, {'Task': 'Tend vessels that store substances such as gases, liquids, slurries, or powdered materials, checking levels of substances by using calibrated rods or by reading mercury gauges and tank charts.'}, {'Task': 'Clean, lubricate, and repair pumps and vessels, using hand tools and equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Read operating schedules or instructions or receive verbal orders to determine amounts to be pumped.'}, {'Task': 'Test materials and solutions, using testing equipment.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the daily operation and upkeep of equipment that extracts resources from the ground. They closely monitor control panels and various components, ensuring operations run at optimal pressure and flow rates. A key duty involves actively observing systems for leaks and other potential issues, and performing necessary adjustments to maintain efficiency. They gauge and record the volume of extracted materials, and manage the flow into storage. This role also includes performing routine maintenance and repairs on equipment and auxiliary systems to ensure continuous and safe operations. Decision-making is crucial for responding to operational changes and addressing problems as they arise.

ONET description:
Operate power pumps and auxiliary equipment to produce flow of oil or gas from wells in oil field.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Monitor pumps and flow lines for gas and fluid leaks.'}, {'Task': 'Gauge oil and gas production.'}, {'Task': 'Start compressor engines and divert oil from storage tanks into compressor units and auxiliary equipment to recover natural gas from oil.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor control panels during pumping operations to ensure that materials are being pumped at the correct pressure, density, rate, and concentration.'}, {'Task': 'Operate engines and pumps to shut off wells according to production schedules, and to switch flow of oil into storage tanks.'}, {'Task': 'Repair gas and oil meters and gauges.'}, {'Task': 'Perform routine maintenance on vehicles and equipment.'}]

Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for the safe and efficient collection of materials. They begin by inspecting vehicles to ensure they are in proper working order, and may refuel them as needed. Following predetermined routes, they operate specialized equipment to empty containers into the vehicle. This often involves dismounting to collect materials and remounting to proceed. They also manage the collected materials by operating compaction devices. Throughout their shifts, they communicate with dispatchers regarding route status, potential hazards, or vehicle issues. Finally, they ensure vehicles are clean and properly maintained after completing their routes and may deliver materials to designated disposal sites.

ONET description:
Collect and dump refuse or recyclable materials from containers into truck. May drive truck.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Inspect trucks prior to beginning routes to ensure safe operating condition.'}, {'Task': 'Drive trucks, following established routes, through residential streets or alleys or through business or industrial areas.'}, {'Task': 'Refuel trucks or add other fluids, such as oil or brake fluid.'}, {'Task': 'Dump refuse or recyclable materials at disposal sites.'}, {'Task': 'Fill out defective equipment reports.'}, {'Task': 'Operate automated or semi-automated hoisting devices that raise refuse bins and dump contents into openings in truck bodies.'}, {'Task': 'Dismount garbage trucks to collect garbage and remount trucks to ride to the next collection point.'}, {'Task': 'Operate equipment that compresses collected refuse.'}, {'Task': 'Communicate with dispatchers concerning delays, unsafe sites, accidents, equipment breakdowns, or other maintenance problems.'}, {'Task': 'Check road or weather conditions to determine how routes will be affected.'}, {'Task': 'Clean trucks or compactor bodies after routes have been completed.'}]

Element Name: Tank Car, Truck, and Ship Loaders
occupation_text:
Generated description:
Individuals in this role are responsible for managing the transfer of bulk materials, including liquids and solids, into and out of various transportation conveyances. They operate specialized equipment to control the flow of products, ensuring accurate placement and quantity. This involves monitoring operations, verifying load information against instructions, and adjusting valves and pumps accordingly. They also perform checks on equipment and conveyances to ensure cleanliness and adherence to procedures. Tasks may include recording operational data, sealing valves, and using other material handling equipment for transportation and storage. Decision-making is crucial for coordinating product movement, maintaining constant flow, and ensuring safety and compliance throughout the loading and unloading processes.

ONET description:
Load and unload chemicals and bulk solids, such as coal, sand, and grain, into or from tank cars, trucks, or ships, using material moving equipment. May perform a variety of other tasks relating to shipment of products. May gauge or sample shipping tanks and test them for leaks.

Tasks:
[{'Task': 'Seal outlet valves on tank cars, barges, and trucks.'}, {'Task': 'Verify tank car, barge, or truck load numbers to ensure car placement accuracy based on written or verbal instructions.'}, {'Task': 'Start pumps and adjust valves or cables to regulate the flow of products to vessels, using knowledge of loading procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Check conditions and weights of vessels to ensure cleanliness and compliance with loading procedures.'}, {'Task': 'Observe positions of cars passing loading spouts, and swing spouts into the correct positions at the appropriate times.'}, {'Task': 'Monitor product movement to and from storage tanks, coordinating activities with other workers to ensure constant product flow.'}, {'Task': 'Operate ship loading and unloading equipment, conveyors, hoists, and other specialized material handling equipment such as railroad tank car unloading equipment.'}, {'Task': 'Record operating data such as products and quantities pumped, gauge readings, and operating times, manually or using computers.'}, {'Task': 'Operate industrial trucks, tractors, loaders, and other equipment to transport materials to and from transportation vehicles and loading docks, and to store and retrieve materials in warehouses.'}]
